The liberals "conserve" withholding attack
while the conservatives make war to "liberate" Iraq
quite hypocritical... as it would seem
but we just say the words, not what we mean
don't give in to nobody, unless we're gettin' a deal
capitialize on misfortune, think and don't feel
but hey we're protecting the inocent and seting them free
we're saving the world, but the world don't agree
we're setting the pace, of how you should live
we've redifined what a dictator is
America, more than meets the eye
America, bureaucrats in desguise
America, always lighting up the skies
America, ploting our own dimise
da-DA-da NA-na-NA-na-na
da-DA-da NA-na-NA-na-na

Subject: [sfraves] [NRR]Why?

Why is it when a person sees some one they know (personally) on the side
of the road with car problems they just drive by and then the next day
ask if everything is all right? I just listened to a woman next to me in
the office tell someone she saw them on the side of the road on her way
home and she is sitting and asking if the other person is okay. My
personal opinion that is pretty damn fucked up. I don't mind if someone
I know drives by when I am stuck just don't tell me you saw me on the
side of the road. If you are that compassionate to ask of someone's well
being the next day then why didn't you stop and at least offer to let
someone use your cell phone or give them a ride to the gas station at
the next exit. Sorry just had to vent; fucking morons I tell you. Clear
your conscious by asking of a persons well being the next day. Peace

Jason Philips
Compos-Mentis
Problematic Beats

Subject: RE: [sfraves] nrr: styrofoam (sp?) or starbux

I'm addicted to Starbucks Chai, but only their downtown locations where
they make it strong.  For you though, get a reusable coffee mug
available at any gas station (and most coffee shops) and go to the
independent shop.  I don't drink much coffee and unfortunately for me
the only place nearby that has chai let alone good chai is starbucks.
Anyone looking to open up a coffee shop in the
Spear/Beale/Main/Folsom/Howard/Harrison area that has a good strong chai
latte please do as I don't like being addicted to Star Bucks Chai.

-Rayn

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: localhost 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Love math and *bored*? Hyperreal Number

Hyperreal number
http://www.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyperreal_numbers

"...The hyperreal numbers or nonstandard reals (usually denoted as *R) are
an extension of the real numbers R that adds infinitely large as well as
infinitesimal numbers to R. The study of these numbers, their functions
and properties is called nonstandard analysis which some find more
intuitive than standard real analysis..."

"... Properties

The hyperreals *R form an ordered field containing the reals R as a
subfield. Unlike the reals, the hyperreals do not form a metric space, but
by virtue of their order they carry an order topology.

The hyperreals are defined in such a way that every first-order logic
statement that uses basic arithmetic (the natural numbers, plus, times,
comparison) and quantifies only over the real numbers is also true if we
presume that they quantify over hyperreal numbers. For example, we can
state that for every real number there is another number greater than it:

        forall x in R : exist y in R : x < y

The same will then also hold for hyperreals:

        forall x in *R : exist y in *R : x < y

Another example is the statement that if you add 1 to a number you get a
bigger number:

        forall x in R : x < x + 1

which will also hold for hyperreals:

        forall x in *R : x < x + 1
..."

Serenity,

Karina

Content-Transfer-Encoding: QUOTED-PRINTABLE
X-Spam-Rating: localhost 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Fusion Anomaly: Hyperreality

http://fusionanomaly.net/hyperreality.html

hyperrealism

hyperrealism (h=EC=B4per-r=EA=B4e-l=EEz=B4em) noun
An artistic style characterized by highly realistic graphic
representation.
- hy=B4perre=B4alist adjective & noun
- hy=B4perre=B4alist=B4ic adjective

Reality

The very definition of the real becomes: that of which it is possible to
give an equivalent reproduction. . . . The real is not only what can be
reproduced, but that which is always already reproduced. The hyperreal.
Jean Baudrillard (b. 1929), French semiologist. Simulations, pt. 2, "The
Hyperrealism of Simulation" (1983). Baudrillard goes on to say, "Reality
no longer has the time to take on the appearance of reality. It no longer
even surpasses fiction: it captures every dream even before it takes on
the appearance of a dream."

See page for more details and some cool tracks.....

Longevity,
Karina

Subject: [sfraves] fwd: "DETROIT" this Sunday Aug 3 w/ Domingo Yu! (bsp)

from: Woodward Posse (woodwardposse@yahoo.com)

Greetings from "DETROIT"!

Thank-you all who attended our past Sunday night parties in celebration of the musical contributions of the D'. As many of you know, we've been going strong through the summer with some truely great sets by our host and guest DJs. Since our start last May, we've honed our signature mix of funk, techno, hip hop, electro, garage rock, Motown, ghettotech and more to give all of our guests that tingly soul-infused feeling head-to-toe. 

This Sunday, we are graced by the timely return of maestro spinna Domingo Yu AKA DJ Chino. Domingo has spent years DJing in and around Detroit at several residencies, DJ battles, and underground cabarets. He has represented the Detroit Techno and hip hop sound around the US and the world from Taiwan and Austrailia to the UK and Spain. And he has shared the stage with such well known Detroit artists as techno legends Derrick May and Alan Oldham AKA DJ T-1000, hip hoppers Eminem, Royce the Five Nine, Cha Cha, Defari, Xzibit, reggae act Poison Dart and numerous spoken word performers, including Jessica Care Moore and the Last Poets and served as the longtime DJ for ledgenary midwest breakdancing crew K.H.A.O.S. (Krazy Hip hop Asiatic Old School Style). Read more about Domingo at his website here: http://domingoyu.com

Detroit is free, and starts at 9 every Sunday night at the Skylark, 3089 16st., San Francisco.

Thanks - The Woodward Posse

I want to plug my favorite small roaster and coffee shop...
Capricorn Coffee on 9th street at Harrison. Here in SF.

Starbucks employs a lot of artists, DJ's, producers and even plain old white
trash peeps.
Something to keep in mind, when trying to justify going to starfucks.
They (inadvertently) funnel money into our dance/art community economy.

I have to say that a lot of independents do not have good coffee.

Clockwork invites you to join us, as we ignite the long anticipated 5TH ANNUAL

ATLANTiS 2003 
An Aquatic Underworld Beyond Your Imagination 
Saturday AUGUST 23rd, 2003


* KELLY's MISSION ROCK & GROUNDS in SF :::5,000 capacity::: *

body piercing,

Always, PLURified peeps, Cultureized beats, Positive Vibes and Collective 
Tribes. The events we envision can only be possible because of your support. And 
because of you, we have collectively made a stance to keep the electronic 
music scene alive today. We are only one part in a growing Phenomenon of Music and 
Dance that is forever getting stronger, more artistic and culturally diverse. 
Please remember that this is your party, your music, your scene. Be 
Responsible and Dance till the sun comes up.

BUY PRESALE!
Buy your tickets early, Save Green, avoid long lines,
And secure you and your friends guaranteed entry inside Atlantis!!!
Buy only from listed outlets, beware of forgeries!

Tickets will be $30. 
Once those Sell Out, Tickets will then be $35.

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U

From: squidlist-admin@lists.laughingsquid.org
[mailto:squidlist-admin@lists.laughingsquid.org]On Behalf Of Laughing Squid
Sent: Saturday, August 02, 2003 12:00 PM

Subject: SQUID [agit-prop] Billboard Liberation Front Calls for Injunction
against Citizens Against Lawsuit Abuse

The BLF have struck once again. Here's the press release that was sent
to us yesterday.

Scott Beale
primary tentacle
Laughing Squid

------------------------------------------------------------------------
-

Billboard Liberation Front
News on the March!
Date: August 1, 2003
Subject: Billboard Liberation Front Calls for Injunction against
Citizens
Against Lawsuit Abuse
From: Fred Demara

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

Confidential-Destroy Before Reading


The Billboard Liberation Front Joins Trial Lawyers in the American Dream

"First thing we do, let's hire all the lawyers."

While some may argue that the American Dream is "Mom, baseball, and
apple
pie", Real Americans know that it's about something more than that; it's
about getting paid millions of dollars after losing your eye to a
defective
rectal thermometer, and eating delicious flourless cakes.

Today the BLF took an important stand against Corporate America and the
Anti-Torte Lobby by defending the public's right to trade their
appendages
for large cash settlements while eating tasty baked sweets.

It is certainly true that it is every American Corporation's God-given
right to skimp on safety or save on costs by dumping their toxic sludge
in
the neighborhood swimming hole, this should never be allowed to stand in
the way of our common hope of winning the lottery by being maimed by an
electric foot massager. Without such dreams, what do Real Americans
have to
strive for? And what will happen to our economy when consumers are
stripped
of their prime motivation to buy home leg-waxing kits or buy property
near
nuclear power plants?

And what can possibly be accomplished by restricting our access to
exquisitely dense chocolate decadence?

Finally, how can we turn our backs on the tiny percentage of attorneys
who
daily sacrifice themselves in the brave and noble pursuit of the deep
pocket? Do we really want to live in a nation where ambulances go
unchased?

Visit the BLF's improvements at TWO separate locations: 15th St @
Mission
and Noe St @18th.

The new BLF - working twice as hard to improve your perceptions on
advertising.


-Fred Demara

Billboard Liberation Front Please direct all inquiries to
jack@billboardliberation.com


For more propaganda, please visit http://www.billboardliberation.com



The Billboard Liberation Front has been improving and enhancing the
Outdoor
Ad images of the biggest and best (sic) of America's commercial and
industrial giants for 22 years. Exxon, Levi's, R.J. Reynolds, Apple,
G.M.C.
and dozens of other corporate behemoths have had their Ad campaigns
tweaked
by the BLF. The Billboard Liberation Front was formed in 1977 by Jack
Napier and Irving Glikk after the two were kidnapped, blindfolded and
forced to alter a billboard along with 24 other clueless copywriters by
the
nefarious San Francisco Suicide Club.


---> The Squid List Admin <---------------------------------------------

Subject: [sfraves] boob lady parties nrr

--0-152877796-1059858469=:78258
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

"well, dear" said the wife to the husband, "i think it is time for me to go out and take my friend up on the invite to the las vegas style boob lady party. been watching you practically live at these things for years now, and even though this is the first five minutes you've had to spare for me inbetween, i figure, i want to jump on the hobbie horse too."
 
"very well, honey-buns." said the hubbie, "i'll just pout and make another baby again with another woman like i usually do while your out, and then when you come back, i will sort of go out with a group of high school students who will alienate you. just as long as you don't do anything that you truly enjoy, we can stay married till death do us part."
 
"brilliant, dear." said the wife. "please continue to rate my every move and judge me as much as you possibly can or i might actually start to feel genuine affection in my life." 
 
the end. :)

Subject: [sfraves] PHOTEK @ DNA TONIGHT

Sunday August 3, 2003 
DNA Lounge 
Deft Moves & Faultline present:

PHOTEK [Photek Productions, Do Or Die / UK] 
Photek aka Special Forces is recognized around the
globe as one of the most prolific artists in the
history of Drum & Bass. His innovative releases and
remixes on such labels as Metalheadz, Certificate 18,
Good Looking, Prototype and Science span the evolution
of D&B and helped lay the blueprints for the genre. In
addition to his DJing and production Photek pilots his
own seminal Photek Productions and new Do or Die
imprints. Don't miss this exclusive Bay Area
appearance. 

JUJU [Cartel, Phuturo] 
Currently one of the States' busiest and most
established DJ/Producers, Juju has been destroying
discotecas from the Americas to Asia and is showing no
signs of slowing down. His releases on Renegade,
Commercial Suicide, Violence, Breakbeat Science,
Advanced and his own Phuturo label have received
worldwide acclaim. Don't miss one of the most popular
stateside DJ's and the Bay Area's own in a set that
promises pure dancefloor madness. 

MC DUH [Groundscore] 
Subversive flow, spontaneous freestyles and
characteristic razor-sharp wit have made Duh MC the
most in-demand lyricist in the Bay Area and beyond. He
has been a staple at too many D&B nights to mention
and continues to uplift and excite crowds on the
regular. 

DJ M [Faultline, Tenderloft, Freebeats]

so, little lady comes home to hubby and he is yell'in! 
 
"DID YOU HAVE A GOOD TIME AT THE BOOB LADY PARTY? DID YOU HEAR ANY GOOD MUSIC?"
 
"no, dear, i had a rotten time, because i posted that i was going to attend the boob lady party with my friend on "raves and graves" and all these total losers showed up and bothered me the whole night, and all the other people there thought i was the boob lady too, and no one watched the real boob lady show, because they were all drunk or high and thinking that everyone else was the boob lady. why are you yelling at me, dear?"
 
"well, it is not that i give a shit about your welfare, beyond your potential paycheck and continual good nature inspite of my ignorance, but i am actually almost totally deaf from all the boob lady parties i went to when i was ignoring you and fleeing the relationship, unknowingly of course. also, i suffered my first heart attack last night, so, i am a whole lot grumpier than usual, but GOOD NEWS! i am not going ANYWHERE anymore, and i am ready for you to devote the rest of your life to caring for me! kind of like a little hospital or premature rest home situation."
 
"fabulous, darling. i knew time was on our side!" the end. :)

From sfraves-return-104579-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Mon Aug 04 02:05:48 2003
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-104579-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 49327 invoked by uid 1103); 4 Aug 2003 02:05:47 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 49313 invoked from network); 4 Aug 2003 02:05:47 -0000
Message-ID: <20030804020544.1704.qmail@web12301.mail.yahoo.com>
Date: Sun, 3 Aug 2003 19:05:44 -0700 (PDT)
From: "John B." <svnlyrbrto@yahoo.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] How do YOU choose which party to attend?

A friend and I were IMing today about a topic she saw on some other message
board.  And it really got me to thinking.  In my current financial state, I
don't get to party that often anymore.  And I have to be really selective about
which party I'm going to invest my hard-earned dollar into.  I'm actually all
the way down to about one party a month, of late; less actually, most recently.
because my car has been unavailable for a while.

In the course of the conversation, I really got to thinking about what EXACTLY
motivates me to go to a given party.  And I was wondering what motivates others
in THEIR choices?

For me, it comes down to four major points, in decending order of importance: 
Crew, Location, Price, and Lineup.

1)  CREW
Now that I've been around the block a few times, this is my #1 criteria.  There
are some crews who will get me at their party regardless of other
considerations.  And others who have proven that they don't ever deserve a
penny from me.

At the top, are the crews that both a) have their act together, and b) are
throwing parties for what I believe are the right reasons.  Quite frankly, I'm
a sucker for a benefit party.  It makes me SOOO happy that some crews are
throwing their parties for the good of the community, rathar than as a cynical
exercise at fattening their own wallets.  That's why I love crews like Unity
and Moksha so, and why it hurt so much not to be able to make it to Jagan last
night.  Even when it's not a benefit, it's still nice when I know that the
proceeds are being rolled into the budget for the next party, instead of being
taken as profit.  It frusterates me more than I can say, that I've had to
rercently miss THREE parties (AEC, FnF, and Moksha), thrown by crews I respect
the most, in the last month because of my vehicular difficulties.  But if
circumstances were normal, Duckee and Alison, for example, could throw anything
from a 200-person renegade to a 10,000-person massive, and I'd be camped out at
F8, on the first day the presales were available, waiting to get mine. 
Regardless of the other details about the party, that little Unity triangle
with the sunflowers would be enough to get me there.

Next step below, are the crews who throw parties for reasons which I don't
regard as so pure as the above, but generally have their shit together.  They
don't lie, on their flyers, about which talent they will deliver.  And most
everything will go as advretized and expected, with little chance of a bust. 
And mostly, they don't pull that 18+ (sometimes even 21+) or 2am bullshit. 
Groups like Cosmic Beats or Anubis would fall into this category.

Next are crews that I would normally consider to fall in the next category
above, but simply don't throw the kind of party I care for.  Best example is
Skills.  I like Jason and Tom as persons and DJs, but the plain and simple fact
is: I *DON'T* like massives.  And even more, I think that going home at 2am is
LAME!  I make no pretense otherwise, and no apologies for it.  I consider the
best size for a party to be 350 people or so: large enough for lots of your
friends to be there, and to meet some new people; but no so large that you
can't FIND your friends, or that you can get lost in the crowd.  And the proper
time for a party to end is about when the sun starts to peek over the
Berkeley/Oakland hills.  That said tho, I *DO* go to the occasional Skills
massive; because, a) they WOULD otherwise fall into the next higher slot, and
b) there are some people who have faded mostly out of the scene, who only come
out for the occasional Skills party.  I'd miss my chance to see these people
(Tigger (Eric) would be the best example off the top of my head.) otherwise.

Next are the crews that I like as people, but just haven't had their shit
together.  Call it bad luck, call it poor planning, whatever.  For example, I
love Marty to death, and wish him nothing but the best as an individual; but I
would have serious reservations about going to another Happy Kids party, if
they were to start up again.

Next to last, are the ones that are the paragons of greed and exploitation. 
The ones that are ALL about enriching some corporate bottom line, and not about
contributing to the community.  Even worse, they actually LIE about what
(talent, age limits, location) they are going to deliver.  In the intrests of
not starting drama, I won't name any names.

Even lower than the low, are the ones who actively sabotage other crews'
parties... ESPECIALLY if the crew being attacked falls into the top category
(Something I've seen happen twice...  Attacking, or trying to get busted, a
benefit party is just extra super loathesome.).  Also, in the intrests of not
starting drama... no names.

2)  LOCATION
This has two subcategories...  the venue and location in general.

Some venues are just fun as hell to party in!  Army and Conneticuit, Infinite
Kaos/Tenderloft, that indoor jungle gym where Superfriends was, the place where
Duckee held the two Imagine half-years ;-)  Those are some of my most favorite
venues ever, and I would gladly go again.  There are also some others that are
not, objectively, so great, but I'd want to go back for nostalgia's sake...
that bowling alley in Petaluma, the Crackhouse, the gym with the bouncy floors
in Concord, and so on.  And there are some that were so astoundingly cool,
stupendously badass, INSANELY GREAT, that I'd give my left nut in order to be
able to party there again.  The perfect example of this kind of venue is San
Francisco's CITY HALL.

Then, there are the bad venues.... the places I avoid... the places that it
would take a top-notch crew in order to lure me back.  For instance, the
actions of Bones and his band of tweaker thugs outside of Survival led directly
to my decision that I would never go to a party at the Maratime Hall again.  In
fact, I did a little happy dance when I heard that it was finally shut down for
good.  Likewise, after that shooting, it was well past time for Campbell to
die.  And the treatment of the attendees at the hands of the Sweets' staff at
Hope made me give up on that venue.

As much as I dislike spoiling the suprise; with venues out there that I don't
feel deserve my money (even if it IS laundered through the promoter), I do have
to make an active effort to find out where parties are.  Sucks to have
principles, I guess.

Then there's the "general location" thing.  I'm friends with some of the crews
that have thrown parties in Santa Cruz.  But I'm sorry guys, once you go over
those mountains, it just isn't the Bay Area anymore.  Likewise, getting that:
"you ain't from heayah, are ya... boy", from a local when I stopped at the gas
station in Sebastapol just creeped me the hell out!  And sometimes, it's just
the wrong day/week/season/whatever for an outdoor party!  And as a matter of
general principle, I think that it's important to fight for our right to
peacably assemble and dance HERE.  Retreating farther and farther away from The
City is, at best, a sub-optimal solution; and completely counterproductive and
wrong, at worst.

And, as a purely pratical matter, location dovetails into factor #3...  Gas is
expensive, now moreso than ever!

3)  PRICE
Let's face it:  the dot-com boom is over, the tech industry as a whole is still
in a slump, prosperity is on hiatus, many of us are under-employed at crappy
jobs that are, technically, beneath us.  I, for one, can't afford to go out
every friday and saturday and blow $30 or more, just for the TICKET, anymore! 
And I know that more than a few others are in situations similar to mine. 
Everybody DOESN'T have ludicrous amounts of money to throw around anymore!  But
some promoters seem not to have realized this, and are still throwing
expensive-as-fuck parties!  (And the ticket price is just the start of the
night's expenses.  Why, for example, does it seem that, with VERY few
exceptions, the higher the ticket price, the higher the water will be priced as
well?)

Andy and Andy (Tronic and Neuropsyintist) are an excellent example of a crew
that *HAS* realized that the dot-com boom is over.  Not only have they priced
their parties for the depressed economy, they DELIVER value, lots of it, for
that $5!  The many Many MANY parties that they have thrown with a $5 ticket
price have delivered more fun to me than many of parties I used to go to at
five times their price.  Hell, they're starting presales for their NEXT party
at $1!  You can bet your sweet ass that I'll be there to get mine!

Finally, price is related to location.  Gas costs money, moreso now than ever. 
And if I'm going to have to drive to the-middle-of-godforsaken-bumfuck-nowhere,
it better be worth my time and (gas)money.

4)  LINEUP
Odd that this, the most important consideration for some, is last for me.  But
the fact is, that we have a LOT of talent here in the Bay Area.  At almost ANY
party that I would go to, given my top three criteria, I *WILL* see talent I
like... the only exception being, perhaps, parties that specialize in a genre
I'm not fond of.  Sure I have my own favorites.  But most all of those
favorites are local.  And if I miss them at this party; chances are that I'll
see them at the next one.

Heh... I've suceeded in turning what was going to be a simple "my friend and I
were talking about $x, I was curious what you gues think" into one of my
classic mini-novellas.  Doh!  But then, maybe that means things ARE about to
get back to normal for me?

In any case, I DO think it's an intresting topic.  What criteria DO other
people use for selecting the parties you're going to attend?  What do you think
the criteria SHOULD be?


cya,
john

Subject: [sfraves] JAGAN:  Moksha Tribe Thanks You!!!!!

--=====================_27705843==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Our heartfelt appreciation to all of you who shared the dance floors with 
us last night at Jagan.

The Moksha crew has been working on this event for weeks and, among other 
things, created seven new banners just for this party.  As those of you who 
attend Moksha events know, we have high production standards. Many of us 
were working for two days in the venue putting Jagan together.

Most of the crew, therefore, were near exhaustion and beyond Red Bull when 
the lights went down:)  But then our guests arrived and everything 
changed.  The entire crew and I were instantly energized by the vibe all of 
you brought to the party.   We are deeply grateful for the solid raver 
values you all bring to the mix.  All of us had much fun partying with you, 
and I hope it was the same for our extended family.  I saw many familiar 
and welcome faces from other Moksha parties.

The theme was Japanese anime and culture and many of the attendees wore 
very creative and elaborate costumes.  And there were quite a few dancers 
still on the floor when the lights went up.

Special thanks to Terry from Viberation for visuals that were stunning, 
creative, and thematically right on the mark.  And to Marshal of Swat Sound 
and Andy from Neuroscience Creations who provided excellent sound.

In the end, however, throwing parties is meaningless if you don't create 
some happiness and memorable experiences.  We hope that we accomplished 
this from our side.  I can say that all of you who attended filled our 
souls with much joy.

Again, thanks Moksha family!!!!  We will begin planning our next party soon.

Much love,

Apollo for Moksha Tribe

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U

to
> give a quick "hello" to you all, and ask for a little information
> assistance.
>
> Since I'm unfamiliar with the area in general, what's going on scene wise?
> Here in DC, the underground is all but gone, and clubs are the dominating
> force. The talent that's here on a regular basis is generally pretty
> top-notch, but the people have gotten downright snotty.  How're things in
> that area in regards to clubs, parties, undergrounds and general attitude?
>
> Also, what are the dominating genres in the area, or is there a little bit
> of something for everyone? I'm not loyal to any one particular genre
really,
> so I'm hoping there's a good bit of variety to be had.
>
> I'm sure I'll have plenty more questions for you all in the future, but
for
> now I'm going to leave it at that. Any help will be greatly appreciated.
>
> Just a brief bit about myself...
>
> I've been partying since around '90-'91, and in the last two years decided
> to attempt a bit of DJ'ing. I have no intentions of ever trying to make a
> living at it, it's more just a hobby and a way to continue to play music
(I
> used to sing for bands and got tired of working with egotistical
musicians).
> I play several genres, sticking mainly in the house & breaks categories,
and
> trying my best to get comfortable with D&B. I listen and play music
> according to mood. I kind of feel there's a time and place for every
> genre/style....it's just a matter of synching things up. I have a website
> up, but it's still under construction. right now. There're a couple of
mixes
> up to listen to on it. If you get bored and decide to check them out,
don't
> expect world class dj'ing. Hopefully you'll like them despite the flaws.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] JAGAN:  Moksha Tribe Thanks You!!!!!

Hmm, thanks for the update and a bit of insider info.

If my dancing spirit did anything to uplift the atmosphere, sweaty body and
all, then I achieved my supreme goal of much happiness. Sometimes I just am
carried away because the music takes me to a higher place, without the
worries of the world. Endorphins rush in like a natural high and life seems
wonderful.

I hope that I was able to communicate some euphoria to others, even the
crew, with their impending exhaustion from all of the hard preparation work.
I could tell that the set up was laborious and I appreciated the efforts of
all.

Side note: thanks for the refreshments. I don't know what I would have done
without the nutritional benefits of the 3 peaches and 2 bananas that I
consumed at around 4 am, after getting completely exhausted from dancing.
Now I really know how important it is to replenish the body to get it going
again. After water + fruits I was able to dance until closing time.
I will try to post a review later,
Thanks,
Greg VP



----- Original Message -----
From: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Sunday, August 03, 2003 9:03 PM
Subject: [sfraves] JAGAN: Moksha Tribe Thanks You!!!!!


Our heartfelt appreciation to all of you who shared the dance floors with
us last night at Jagan.

The Moksha crew has been working on this event for weeks and, among other
things, created seven new banners just for this party.  As those of you who
attend Moksha events know, we have high production standards. Many of us
were working for two days in the venue putting Jagan together.

Most of the crew, therefore, were near exhaustion and beyond Red Bull when
the lights went down:)  But then our guests arrived and everything
changed.  The entire crew and I were instantly energized by the vibe all of
you brought to the party.   We are deeply grateful for the solid raver
values you all bring to the mix.  All of us had much fun partying with you,
and I hope it was the same for our extended family.  I saw many familiar
and welcome faces from other Moksha parties.

The theme was Japanese anime and culture and many of the attendees wore
very creative and elaborate costumes.  And there were quite a few dancers
still on the floor when the lights went up.

Special thanks to Terry from Viberation for visuals that were stunning,
creative, and thematically right on the mark.  And to Marshal of Swat Sound
and Andy from Neuroscience Creations who provided excellent sound.

In the end, however, throwing parties is meaningless if you don't create
some happiness and memorable experiences.  We hope that we accomplished
this from our side.  I can say that all of you who attended filled our
souls with much joy.

Again, thanks Moksha family!!!!  We will begin planning our next party soon.

Much love,

Apollo for Moksha Tribe

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring

-Helen Keller

Subject: RE: [sfraves] nrr: styrofoam (sp?) or starbux

--0-1957133003-1059977521=:1095
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

FYI:
Styrofoam is actually more environmentaly friendly than the Paper cups. Most people don't know that they have taken a lot of the cfcs out of the styrofoam AND styrofoam is 100% recyclable. They make hard plastic ( I forget the number, but it is the kind videotape cases are made from )  out of it. Sadly, there was a brief period of time in the late 80s where McDonalds had started a successful recycling program, only to have it thwarted by the perception that paper was beter for the environment, sadly NONE of the allegedly  "Environmentaly Friendly" Mc Donald's paper packaging gets recycled today.This caused a chain reaction reducing the demand for Styrofoam recycling facilities, so even though styrofam is efficiently recyclable, almost none of it gets recycled. To the best of my knowledge, ( somebody feel free to update me if I am wrong,, because I have been out of manufacturing for a long time) The paper cups are totaly non recyclable, so if you have been tossing them in the "Mixed
 Paper" bin, quit it. As said before, your best bet is a reusable commuter mug, it always was anyway. The same goes for water bottles, you can recycle them, but most of the time they don't get recycled, and recycling takes a lot more energy than refilling.


--
Sarah Schumm <sarah_schumm@yahoo.com>
Hypnobunny Creative Services - Posters, Logos, Ads and More

Yahoo! SiteBuilder - Free, easy-to-use web site design software

Hi, I was wondering how people enjoyed Audio Playground on Saturday? 

Went to Rendezvous on Saturday. Some good out of town talent, such as Thee-o, 
who I always enjoy. Great seeing Denise as always. Not a  whole lot of people 
there, though. What's up? Guess everybody was at Audio Playground, and there 
was another big party too, that night, I believe. 
A few years ago, you could have more than one bumpin' party on a Saturday 
night, but it seems to me that a lot fewer people are going to parties now. The 
people who go are cool, but the number seems to be shrinking. 
Is there any way to coordinate things so the good parties don't all happen on 
the same night? I know there are some fridays and saturdays when it doesn't 
seem like there's a good party, so instead of having three good ones the same 
night, I wish they could be spread out a little. 
Anyway, curious about Audio Playground, please let me know how it was. 
Thanks.
John in Berkeley

--part1_192.1e14492b.2c5fc5d8_boundary--

Sat i made it out to audio playground. This was probably one of my fav 
parties ever! i mean hey ,a party with a slide, twister and giant legos to build 
forts! what more could you ask for?!? hehe! the music and engery in all 3 rooms 
were going all nite long... jaxx the ripper and reim's set was off the hook! 
they had the whole place jumping. ive noticed lately a lot of new faces at 
parties, but every one was really cool, and this party gave me a chance to start 
meeting some new people! The amount of hard work , time and energy that 
audiopreservationn puts into there parties shows off , and makes them unforgetable! i 
had a great time!

P-Nut(meghan)

PS where was the hopscotch??!?!?? thats always a playground favorite! heheh!

--part1_1ec.e4a68e2.2c5fe2de_boundary--

don't wanna miss this finale...with each part of the series it gets better
and better, as it should be.  cheers,

miss g

Meglove02@aol.com wrote:
Sat i made it out to audio playground. This was probably one of my fav
parties ever! i mean hey ,a party with a slide, twister and giant legos to
build
forts! what more could you ask for?!? hehe! the music and engery in all 3
rooms
were going all nite long... jaxx the ripper and reim's set was off the hook!
they had the whole place jumping. ive noticed lately a lot of new faces at
parties, but every one was really cool, and this party gave me a chance to
start
meeting some new people! The amount of hard work , time and energy that
audiopreservationn puts into there parties shows off , and makes them
unforgetable! i
had a great time!

P-Nut(meghan)

PS where was the hopscotch??!?!?? thats always a playground favorite! heheh!

could teleologically take over  the state!

On Monday, August 4, 2003, at 11:58 AM, max phillips wrote:

> I was thinking if anyone was tempted to or is really going to
> put down their $60 (I think it is, something ridiculously low)
> registration fee and run for governor?

It's 65 signatures and a $3,500 deposit, or 10,000 signatures and no 
deposit.
You must declare candidacy by August 9.

My coworkers are trying to get me to do it, but I don't have that kind 
of money, nor could I collect it from people in time.. haha.. like I'd 
even have a shot.

But now that I know how easy it is, maybe I'll run when there's a real 
election in the near future and not have to go up against 200+ 
contenders.  I'd most definitely be a raver-friendly candidate. And I'd 
be sure to institute a statewide Crazy Pants Day once a month. Because 
no state can be successful without 12 opportunities to sport funky 
leggings every year!

  - omid

****************PRINT THIS EMAIL AND GET IN FOR A

Hey all,
Thanks for a great weekend, the Moksha Tribe event "Jagan" was successful 
and off the hook. Thanks to all the members of my Moksha family.
My son turns 3 today, so it's cause for celebration! Tonight, we have our 
regular scheduled guest dj, mixing his funky ass style of tech house and 
acid house goodies.. and for those who like it hard and hoovered, The recent 
AEC party got me pumped on old jams and I want to bring it back one more 
time for all who loved it and wanted more or couldn't make it out to BFE 
that night. I'm takin it all the way back to 1992 and before. With a solid 
set of nothing but retro-rave classics, come down to hear Messiah, 2 Bad 
Mice, Prodigy, Acen, DJ Seduction, Kicks Like a Mule, Return of the Living 
Acid, Nation 12 and much much more! Go back in time with me tonight.. wear a 
funky hat and whistle and get in free! If you have some rave classics you'd 
like to play or hear tonight, email me and lets talk about it!

While I'm at it, I'm taking Secret Society bookings for the rest of the 
year, if you'd like to play or would like to hear someone special, don't 
hesitate to get in touch..

Details for tonight..

SECRET SOCIETY - August 4, 2003
a reunion of people - a revival of culture

Chapter CXXIV
Rave Music new and old

DJs:
KEVIN JAMES (Mind.Body.Soul)
the return of

GABE

JUSTIN HALE
MICHAEL LIU
GABRIEL BLACK
ARADIA

Don't forget *POWER HOUR* - $1 Draft beers -> 10pm to 11pm

Music starts after 9pm
21+ ID required
$5 [$1 with flyer or this post printed out]

Secret Society is located at Club Savoy @ 3546 Flora Vista Avenue, Santa 
Clara, CA 95051
[Savoy - 408.244.6909]
Secret Society continues in loving memory of Chris "Laffy" Taflanidis.

Subject: [sfraves] [BSP] Estuary :: Mon Aug 4 :: DJ Dragn'fly :: New weekly format!

Estuary :: Open Deck Weekly 

Monday July 28, 2003
9:00 pm - 2:00 am 
Masse's Nightclub :: 21+ w/ID, Free
Featured Guest :: DJ Dragn'fly

Estuary :: (Noun) 1. Where the river blends with the sea. 2. A place 
where all styles mix.

We've decided to change the format of the night. Now it's...

In the back room we have "first come first served" open deck slots. 

In the main room signups will be for the following week. At 10pm you
can put your name on the list of djs who want to spin the following
week and we will set the lineup. This allows for several things: 

1) We can group the genres together, which is more pleasing for the
audience than radically changing styles every 1/2 hour.

2) Starting the signups at 10pm gives you more time to get there,
especially for those coming from places like San Francisco and Marin
County.

3) You will have a whole week to tell your friends exactly what time
you will be spinning, so that they can come and support you.

If you have no skills at all, but have some cool tracks that you'd like
to share, you are just as welcome as anyone else! 

* Please bring needles and headphones. If you don't have your own, find
a friend to share with! *

This week's line-up:
9:00pm  :: Gavin (Trance)
9:30pm  :: Summer K (breaks)
10:00pm :: Jacob B (Hard House)
10:30pm :: JaggedMetalO (hard house)
11:00pm :: Teks (hard house/techno)

Featured Guest:
11:30pm :: Dragn'fly

12:30pm :: Marcine (jungle)
1:00pm  :: Phaedrus (jungle)
1:30pm  :: Lewt (DnB/jungle)

Our Featured Guest this week is Dragn'fly! After spending the whole
weekend down here in the Bay rockin' Moksha's Jagan (among other
parties), she comes to give us one last fix before heading back to Sac.


Added bonuses:
$2 STRONG Islands
FREE pool tables
Outdoor smoking patio
NO COVER CHARGE!!! WOOHOO!!
21+ up w/ ID, please

Masse's Nightclub
6180 Stoneridge Mall Drive 
Pleasanton, CA 
(650) 463-8181

http://www.happycandykid.com/estuary/
***Brought to you by Happy/Devil and Estuary Collective***

a
> > living at it, it's more just a hobby and a way to continue to play music

> > trying my best to get comfortable with D&B. I listen and play music

info is below:


**************************************


Estuary :: Open Deck Weekly

Monday July 28, 2003
9:00 pm - 2:00 am 
Masse's Nightclub :: 21+ w/ID, Free
Featured Guest :: DJ Dragn'fly

Estuary :: (Noun) 1. Where the river blends with the
sea. 2. A place 
where all styles mix.

We've decided to change the format of the night. Now
it's...

In the back room we have "first come first served"
open deck slots. 

In the main room signups will be for the following
week. At 10pm you
can put your name on the list of djs who want to spin
the following
week and we will set the lineup. This allows for
several things: 

1) We can group the genres together, which is more
pleasing for the
audience than radically changing styles every 1/2
hour.

2) Starting the signups at 10pm gives you more time to
get there,
especially for those coming from places like San
Francisco and Marin
County.

3) You will have a whole week to tell your friends
exactly what time
you will be spinning, so that they can come and
support you.

If you have no skills at all, but have some cool
tracks that you'd like
to share, you are just as welcome as anyone else!

* Please bring needles and headphones. If you don't
have your own, find
a friend to share with! *

This week's line-up:
9:00pm  :: Gavin (Trance)
9:30pm  :: Summer K (breaks)
10:00pm :: Jacob B (Hard House)
10:30pm :: JaggedMetalO (hard house)
11:00pm :: Teks (hard house/techno)

Featured Guest:
11:30pm :: Dragn'fly

12:30pm :: Marcine (jungle)
1:00pm  :: Phaedrus (jungle)
1:30pm  :: Lewt (DnB/jungle)

Our Featured Guest this week is Dragn'fly! After
spending the whole
weekend down here in the Bay rockin' Moksha's Jagan
(among other
parties), she comes to give us one last fix before
heading back to Sac.


Added bonuses:
$2 STRONG Islands
FREE pool tables
Outdoor smoking patio
NO COVER CHARGE!!! WOOHOO!!
21+ up w/ ID, please

Masse's Nightclub
6180 Stoneridge Mall Drive
Pleasanton, CA 
(650) 463-8181

http://www.happycandykid.com/estuary/
***Brought to you by Happy/Devil and Estuary
Collective***

     The tix for Audio Playground were cheap... and so was the venue. It was=
=20
an old rundown warehouse that was partially falling apart. There were many=20
obsticles to climb over & duck under in the opening hallway. It was overcrow=
ded=20
too not much room to dance, they let wayyy too many people into this small r=
un=20
down building... but aside from those minor faults it was a fun party. The=20
kids at the party seemed to have a great time. There was good music in some=20=
of=20
the rooms. There were three or four rooms in the place so it was fun to wand=
er=20
around & check shit out (of course you'd have to push people around to get=20
through). Morgan had a phat set. If you don't mind all ages & you like to st=
and in=20
one place and cheer the DJ with the rest of the crowd, then you'd probably=20
have a great time. But if you're the type that likes a big open dance floor=20
where you can actually work on your dance skills then this was not the party=
 for=20
you. At one point they threw down some housey sets and there were actually=20
dance circles with some bomb ass dancers which was fun to watch but still th=
ere=20
was no room to dance for yourself unless you wanted to show off inside the=20
center of the circle... which can be a bit awkward if you can't even warm up=
 by=20
dancing on an open floor, you know what i mean? So all in all it was worth t=
he=20
money but not what i call a "good" party. just an average one. I give them p=
rops=20
for pulling it off UG style in Oakland and not getting shut down.=20

Subject: [sfraves] New Anti-Rave Legislation

--=====================_1667063==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

ROAR!, The National Dance and Music Rights Alliance

NEWS FLASH

August 1, 2003

2 Bills in the House  As Bad or Worse than the RAVE Act!!

Both Acts, the previously proposed CLEAN-UP of Methamphetamine Act and the
newly proposed Ecstasy Awareness Act of 2003 have strikingly similiar
provisions. ROAR! strongly urges all supporters to got o
http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/action/index.asp?step=2&item=10378
and send a letter to your congressperson opposing the CLEAN-UP Act. THIS ACT
HAS OVER 60 CO-SPONSORS!!!


H. R. 2962: The Ecstasy Awareness Act of 2003
July 25, 2003

` Whoever profits monetarily from a rave or similar electronic dance event,
knowing or having reason to know that the unlawful use or distribution of a
controlled substance occurs at the rave or similar event, shall be fined not
more than $500,000 or imprisoned not more than 20 years, or both. If the
defendant is an organization, the fine imposable for the offense is not more
than $2,000,000'

--------------------

H.R.834: Clean, Learn, Educate, Abolish, Neutralize, and Undermine Production
(CLEAN-UP) of Methamphetamines Act

`Whoever, for a commercial purpose, knowingly promotes any rave, dance, music,
or other entertainment event, that takes place under circumstances where the
promoter knows or reasonably ought to know that a controlled substance will be
used or distributed in violation of Federal law or the [state or local law],
shall be fined under title 18, United States Code, or imprisoned for not more
than 9 years, or both.'



--

ROAR! is a national organization dedicated to fighting government threats to
the electronic music industry and community. ROAR! educates the public and
influences the course of legislation with the goal of advancing the freedom to
gather, dance, listen to, perform and promote music in a public setting. We
seek to preserve both the livelihood of all those associated with the
electronic music industry and the vibrant culture of those who participate, as
well as civil liberties for all Americans.

-- 
ROAR!
The National Dance and Music Rights Alliance
www.roargroup.org
202-546-2128


Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Apollo" <apollo@speakeasy.org>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Tuesday, August 05, 2003 10:40 AM
Subject: [sfraves] New Anti-Rave Legislation


> ROAR!, The National Dance and Music Rights Alliance
>
> NEWS FLASH
>
> August 1, 2003
>
> 2 Bills in the House - As Bad or Worse than the RAVE Act!!
>
> Both Acts, the previously proposed CLEAN-UP of Methamphetamine Act and the
> newly proposed Ecstasy Awareness Act of 2003 have strikingly similiar
> provisions. ROAR! strongly urges all supporters to got o
> http://actioncenter.drugpolicy.org/action/index.asp?step=2&item=10378
> and send a letter to your congressperson opposing the CLEAN-UP Act. THIS
ACT
> HAS OVER 60 CO-SPONSORS!!!
>
>
> H. R. 2962: The Ecstasy Awareness Act of 2003
> July 25, 2003
>
> ` Whoever profits monetarily from a rave or similar electronic dance
event,
> knowing or having reason to know that the unlawful use or distribution of
a
> controlled substance occurs at the rave or similar event, shall be fined
not
> more than $500,000 or imprisoned not more than 20 years, or both. If the
> defendant is an organization, the fine imposable for the offense is not
more
> than $2,000,000'
>
> --------------------
>
> H.R.834: Clean, Learn, Educate, Abolish, Neutralize, and Undermine
Production
> (CLEAN-UP) of Methamphetamines Act
>
> `Whoever, for a commercial purpose, knowingly promotes any rave, dance,
music,
> or other entertainment event, that takes place under circumstances where
the
> promoter knows or reasonably ought to know that a controlled substance
will be
> used or distributed in violation of Federal law or the [state or local
law],
> shall be fined under title 18, United States Code, or imprisoned for not
more
> than 9 years, or both.'
>
>
>
> --
>
> ROAR! is a national organization dedicated to fighting government threats
to
> the electronic music industry and community. ROAR! educates the public and
> influences the course of legislation with the goal of advancing the
freedom to
> gather, dance, listen to, perform and promote music in a public setting.
We
> seek to preserve both the livelihood of all those associated with the
> electronic music industry and the vibrant culture of those who
participate, as
> well as civil liberties for all Americans.
>
> -- 
> ROAR!
> The National Dance and Music Rights Alliance
> www.roargroup.org
> 202-546-2128
>
>
> Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net
>
> House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
>
> "Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do
> the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no
> safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring
> adventure or nothing."
> -Helen Keller
>
> "Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.
It's
> a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well
can
> we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when
we
> recognize our shared humanity."
> -Pema Chodron
>
> "It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
> -Dizzy Gillespie

***********************


Subject: Fw: Fw: Mouse Balls=20

I don't know how they wrote this with a straight=20
face.....=20

This apparently was a real memo sent out by a computer=20
company to its employees in all seriousness. It went=20
to all field engineers about a computer peripheral=20
problem. The author of this memo was quite genuine.=20

The word is that the engineers literally rolled on the=20
floor!=20

Especially note the last couple of sentences.)=20
.......................................................=20
Re: Replacement of Mouse Balls.=20
If a mouse fails to operate or should it perform=20
erratically, it may need a ball replacement. Mouse=20
balls are now available as FRU (Field Replacement=20
Units).=20

Because of the delicate nature of this procedure,=20
replacement of mouse balls should only be attempted by=20
properly trained personnel.=20

Before proceeding, determine the type of mouse balls=20
by examining the underside of the mouse. Domestic=20
balls will be larger and harder than foreign balls.=20

Ball removal procedures differ depending upon the=20
manufacturer of the mouse.=20

Foreign balls can be replaced using the pop off=20
method. Domestic balls are replaced by using the twist=20
off method.=20

Mouse balls are not usually static sensitive. However,=20
excessive handling can result in sudden discharge.=20

Upon completion of ball replacement, the mouse may be=20
used immediately. It is recommended that each person=20
have a pair of spare balls for maintaining optimum=20
customer satisfaction.=20

Any customer missing his balls should contact the=20
local personnel in charge of removing and replacing=20
these necessary items. Please keep in mind=20
that a customer without properly working balls is an=20
unhappy customer.=20


------=_NextPart_000_0105_01C35B56.3DE6B230--

Subject: [sfraves] BSP-Tonight-Spin This! CD Giveaways!

The next Spin This! will be whirling your way on Tues Aug 5th!
We have some exciting things lined up!
http://dark-tekno.com/spinthis/

-CD GIVEAWAY!!!!!!!!  Lucky winners will receive Dark Pathways Vol One: 
Force and/or  Vol Two: Eclipse.  These are REALLY cool and we're very 
excited to pass them on! Volume One features rhythmic noise artists, 
while Volume Two assaults us with dark ambient, power electronics and 
dark industrial sounds. To hear samples and get more info on these CDs, 
as well as other cool releases, please visit the wonderful sponsor of 
the giveaway,
Crunchpod Media-
http://www.crunchpodmedia.com/

-Just for shits and giggles, August 5th is declared PURPLE NIGHT!!  Ok, 
well maybe it has a LITTLE to do with the fact that Phreaki Boi has an 
extreme purple fetish.  Wear purple and get in FREE all night long!  
Don't have any purple?  If you can come up with a REAL word that rhymes 
with purple, we'll still let you in free!

AND HERE ARE THE REST OF THE DEETS.....
WHAT: SPIN THIS! is a monthly genre-bending party celebrating all forms 
of DARK ELEKTRONIKA

WHO: Yours hosts-The Dark-Tekno Collective with residents- Fanboy, 
Jawa, Phreaki Boi, & RMS

WHEN: August 5th (and every 1st Tuesday) 9PM-2AM

WHERE: 26Mix: 3024 Mission Street (at 26th) in San Francisco
There are several MUNI lines that are within a couple block radius (14 
& 49 go right by!) and BART is 2 blocks away. See our web site for more 
in depth public transportation info and maps.

HOW: FREE before 10:30 and only $3 after.

ANYTHING ELSE?: This is a great venue with pool tables, pinball, and 
classic video games!
$1 customer abuse shots (mystery shots) & $1 Pabst Blue Ribbons all 
night long!
Happy Hour ends at nine, so if you come a little early you can get $2 
well, draft & domestic bottles
Free lockers on a first come, first served basis.  Obtain key from 
bartender or bring your own lock.

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U

> > controlled substance occurs at the rave or similar event, shall be 
> > fined
>not
> > more than $500,000 or imprisoned not more than 20 years, or both. If

> > the defendant is an organization, the fine imposable for the offense

> > is not
>more
> > than $2,000,000'
> >
> > --------------------
> >
> > H.R.834: Clean, Learn, Educate, Abolish, Neutralize, and Undermine
>Production
> > (CLEAN-UP) of Methamphetamines Act
> >
> > `Whoever, for a commercial purpose, knowingly promotes any rave, 
> > dance,
>music,
> > or other entertainment event, that takes place under circumstances 
> > where
>the
> > promoter knows or reasonably ought to know that a controlled 
> > substance
>will be
> > used or distributed in violation of Federal law or the [state or 
> > local
>law],
> > shall be fined under title 18, United States Code, or imprisoned for

> > not
>more
> > than 9 years, or both.'
> >
> >
> >
> > --
> >
> > ROAR! is a national organization dedicated to fighting government 
> > threats
>to
> > the electronic music industry and community. ROAR! educates the 
> > public and influences the course of legislation with the goal of 
> > advancing the
>freedom to
> > gather, dance, listen to, perform and promote music in a public 
> > setting.
>We
> > seek to preserve both the livelihood of all those associated with 
> > the electronic music industry and the vibrant culture of those who
>participate, as
> > well as civil liberties for all Americans.
> >
> > --
> > ROAR!
> > The National Dance and Music Rights Alliance www.roargroup.org
> > 202-546-2128
> >
> >
> > Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net
> >
> > House Music 101:
http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
> >
> > "Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature,
nor do
> > the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is
no
> > safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a
daring
> > adventure or nothing."
> > -Helen Keller
> >
> > "Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the
wounded.
>It's
> > a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness
well
>can
> > we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real
when
>we
> > recognize our shared humanity."
> > -Pema Chodron
> >
> > "It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
> > -Dizzy Gillespie
> >
> > U

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.
It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well
can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when
we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U

Subject: [sfraves] nothing going on again nrr

--0-1275791392-1060117140=:92741
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

i love dr. phil when he asks, "where's the pay off?" to people who are truly involved with one another. i think real relationships are fun, that is why i have them and why i watch that particular show when i have time. i met an artist from africa yesterday. i did not mention this list to her though. i honestly did not think that she would find it entertaining or useful in any sense of the word, nor did i believe that she would have time for it anyway. she is on a world tour right now. i am excited to shop everywhere that i go with my friends, like i usually do. i would never make a world tour if there wasn't good shopping to be had or real friends. i am happy that i have never had to do anything that i didn't believe in nor work with anyone who i don't want to. i am also glad that i have never had to have a relationship with anyone i am not interested in, be that business or otherwise. if i believed that the imaginary were true, then for sure, i would not be here. you have to pay
 attention to what is really going on, because if you don't, you might get caught up in something where not only is there no pay off for you, but also, all you'll get is a bunch of really unsatisfying work. work is supposed to be fun and so are the people, and if someone needs to go to the doctor and doesn't want to, then you don't have to pick up the pieces for them or anything like that. you can just devote that energy to something that validates your experience here on earth while you have the time. :)

Subject: [sfraves] JAGAN.... WOW... Hello 2DAy>>I'm still Afterglowing!!

OK... so like last Saturday I was @ Jagan!!!  Ya know... it's hard 2 still describe how that underground was 4 me... 'cause I"m like still in this mondo haze of what a fuckin' Bad Ass night it was & I learned alota thing about myself that night that jus' totally came 2 surface throughout the course of the night (mentally anyway)

OK... I 1st wanna start off w/ the last set of the night!!  I was in the side room where ShezTek was spinning... there were several times when I would go in that room 2 dance my ass off 'cause oooooh man... orgasmic tunes from his vinyl.. yeah!!!  But what espt hit me more was during his last track when he spun Silence by Delirium feat. Sarah McLaLaLa (I know, sp) 'cause I mean... that songs total anthem & that song brought about this mondo energy in the room & it's like 1 of my all time favorite songs.. but man... the room went totally crazy & U can actually touch the energy in the room it was sooo damn thick!!  WHOA... I jus' got goosebumps thinkin' about it again!!  But yeah... it was So Dope 'cause every1 started huggin' each other & singing!!  

What really touched me the most is when I went up 2 ACME Dave & we gave each other this mondo hug that ooooh man... it's like I Love that guy 'cause he's been my Bro 4 soooo many years & that hug let me know that we were gonna be never ending Bros & we Loved each other soo much!!!  Then I started dancing somemore 'cause it was the perfect release from all the thing that built up in my during the party!!  I mean... it was Sooooo Awesome & I Thank U all 4 sharing that moment w/ me!!  It was jus' that Awesome Moment in time that I think we all needed & made us proud of who we are... 'cause 1 day Ravers will rule the world 1 dance step @ a time, 1 record @ a time, & the world will feel our vibe!  ShezTek... I Love Dude & Thank U 4 that sooo much!

OK...so like all the sets that night we so Awesome!  Lemme try 2 remember them sets!!!  Andrew Phelan & his homeboy on the keyboards totally blew me away!!  I mean... U can probably call it a replication of Dave & Sen Sei.. butno... it wasn't!!  Dave & Sen Sei are 2 of my really good friends & I Love them, but they're like more on the tribal side of they do but man... when Andrew Phelan & his HOmie bust out the live PA over Andrew's spinning, it was all about the funk!!!  Ooooh my Goodness!!  I Loved it!!  I mean... they created this Awesome magic w/ that set that took Deep Funky Chicago House 2 another level!! Seriously!

OK... 'cause I don't wanna make this post hella long... lemme tell ya that all the Moksha Tribe DJs who spun in the main room we fuckin' Awesome!!!  DV8 was weaving records together that came out w/ this Beautiful set!!  Seein' Homeboy dance while he spinning is also a + in my book!  Dilema Funk Doc was Dope!!  Shawn Allen totally worked me over when he spun!!  Loved those remixes!

Unfortunately... I got 2 the party after 12 & wasn't able 2 catch Marcine or Phaedrus's sets =(  Hmmmm... wonder if they were recorded so I could check them out??

Another set that impressed me was Les Elemental!!  I knew he spun Techno & Jungle... but Good Shit... that was the 1st time in the 3 years I've known him that I saw him spin House!!  It was like this kinda dark house stuff that I dunno how 2 describe or explain it... may a dark version of Tech HOuse w/ like dark melodies... but then I heard him spin in like a record or 2 of Techno... & then a house track that I think might of been a techno song originally... but oh man... he spun this 1 Acid Breakbeats track that fuckin' Floored me man!!! I Loved it!!

DFly got on & got the dark nrg/ Dark trance thing gon' on & she actually filled up the room 'cause I guess there were alota people waiting 4 her 2 spin... LoL... BUt I Loved it!!  I danced w/ Terri a while on the Floor during this set!!

When i 1st got there though, Apollo was on the decks & he WHOA man... I mean.. I know his set contained aota house.. Yummm,,, but I swear.. I heard him throw in some Breakbeats here & there (I think or maybe they were some breakbeat Breakdowns maybe) but man... I Loved it!!

OK... the Vibe was totally there man!!  I mean... it was Good vibes all around & U can feel the Love all throughout the party!!  I mean... if the vibe there only led up to that last set where U felt it the most... them yeah... Hello 2Day, it was jus' Amazing man!!

It's rare 4 1 of those life changing parties that happen when well... u like totally go 2 a party but leave as some1 different... ya know... that's what kinda happen 2 me & I didn't know I needed JAGAN that much... but it really set me strait which is alot 2 say 4 me 'cause I've experienced this b4, but not @ this level!!  

Thank U Miksha Tribe for that!!! Love U!

Take Care,

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) Quote of the Day

I just wanted to announce that I will be running for governor of California to replace Grey Davis  when he is 
recalled.  I don't have a platform, and my political experience consists of stuffing envelopes for the late 
night coalition.  Don't you want me?  I'm probably equally qualified to serve as many of the other 
candidates.

today ...

colony with those ugly things ... doesn't that remind you of yourself sometimes?)

whatever they say ... how can you send your kids to a Little League game when you live on a communal 
farm growing drugs?  It's awful ... and that's what my life is all about ... looking down on others."

- Jan Brown, Mother and Angry Vice City resident

There are 1 new jobs listed below

Special Events Assistant (ref. 2391)

Under the supervision of the Donor Services Manager, the 
Special Events Assistant plans and implements SFMOMA 
members' cultivation and benefit fulfillment events, and 
works as a team member in planning and implementing major 
development fundraising events, including auxiliary events, 
and curatorial dinners. The Special Events Assistant 
provides both administrative and event support to the 
Development department. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: · 
Assists in the planning and production of special events at 
SFMOMA. Works as a member of an events team on...
To apply online, click here:
http://sfmoma.snaphire.com/safelink=JSJDMM&O_p=711v3v1a1x16&


If you wish to contact us about this position, please click the link 
above and follow the online instructions. 

Thank you.
SFMOMA Human Resources

 
for dvd station:
 

      Retail Operations Manager

      Sr. Software Engineer / Web Developer

      IT Engineer / DBA

Retail Operations Manager
Background and Experience Required:
- 2 years minimum experience in Store Management
- 5 Years retail experience, Specialty store background a strong plus 
- Variety of industry experience preferred 
- Must be able to work weekends and evenings 
- Change agent in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment 
- Multiple store management exp preferred 
- IT / Computer savvy preferred (the savvier the better).

Job Description:

Ensure that each individual launch works within the context of the location. The retail locations will be varied, so a familiarity with multiple retailing environments is a plus. The Retail Operations Manager will both be responsible for the successful operations of each location, and for providing feedback for the market expansion plans for those environments. Create and maintain an atmosphere where the sales associates deliver on the value and service promise of DVD Station. Conduct initial training and periodic coaching sessions to communicate objectives, set goals and follow up on progress. Identify business issues and opportunities to DVD Station corp staff. This may include line extensions, new retail location opportunities, service improvement opportunities, and the like. Ensure that inventory control policies and procedures are followed. Perform periodic inventory check as required (largely automated). Monitor operations and ensure adherence to operational policies. Pursue
 and eliminate variances to policy. Facilitate the orientation and training of all new employees. Administer all training programs for customer service, system usage and operations. Develop staff excellence through coaching and direction. 

Back to Top





Sr. Software Engineer / Web Developer
Background and Experience Required: 
- Java/C++ programming experience (4+ years)
- PHP/Perl programming experience (2+ years)
- Experience with Postgres or other RDBS (3+ years)
- Good Object Oriented design and programming experience
- Previous development experience with JSP, Servlet, EJBs, SOAP, Application servers, Apache, SQL, XML, XSL,XSLT.
- Experience developing POS system will be huge addition
- Experience developing Bar code scanner program will be a plus 
- BS in computer Science or equivalent
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Ability to conceptualize solutions to business problems, and to implement them under pressure 
- Solid understanding of information architecture, user interface design, and visual design issues 
- Willingness to identify and propose optimal solutions to technical problems 
- Ability to meet tight project deadlines, provide accurate time estimates, and generally maintain a high level of personal organization 
- Ability to work with little direct supervision
- Must demonstrate excellent attitude and professional demeanor.
- Must have strong oral and written skills.
- Strong project management skills and ability to work in a team environment.



Back to Top





IT Engineer / DBA
Background and Experience Required:
- Experience with Linux/Gentoo, Redhat, Solaris, Apache, Security  SSL, Firewall, Shell Scripting.
- Some experience with Database administration using Postgres/Access will be a huge plus.
- Experience with Windows (XP/2000)
- BS in computer Science or equivalent
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Ability to conceptualize solutions to business problems, and to implement them under pressure 
- Solid understanding of information architecture, user interface design, and visual design issues 
- Willingness to identify and propose optimal solutions to technical problems 
- Ability to meet tight project deadlines, provide accurate time estimates, and generally maintain a high level of personal organization 
- Ability to work with little direct supervision
- Must demonstrate excellent attitude and professional demeanor.
- Must have strong oral and written skills.
- Strong project management skills and ability to work in a team environment.



Back to Top





Sr. Software Engineer
Background and Experience Required:
- Java/C++ programming experience (4+ years)
- VB/Activex programming experience (2+ years)
- Experience with Barcode Scanner and Card Reader.
- Good Object Oriented design and programming experience
- Previous development experience with JSP, Servlet, EJBs, SOAP, Application servers, Apache, SQL, XML, XSL,XSLT.
- Experience developing POS system will be huge addition
- Experience developing Bar code scanner program will be a plus 
- BS in computer Science or equivalent
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Ability to conceptualize solutions to business problems, and to implement them under pressure 
- Solid understanding of information architecture, user interface design, and visual design issues 
- Willingness to identify and propose optimal solutions to technical problems 
- Ability to meet tight project deadlines, provide accurate time estimates, and generally maintain a high level of personal organization 
- Ability to work with little direct supervision
- Must demonstrate excellent attitude and professional demeanor.
- Must have strong oral and written skills.
- Strong project management skills and ability to work in a team environment.



Back to Top





Marketing Communications Associate
Background and Experience Required:
- Bachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, English, or related field.
- 2 to 3 years previous work experience as a marketing communications or public relations professional 
- You must have 2+ years experience writing company press releases. 
- Demonstrated superior writing and editing skills 
- Understanding of and experience with communication disciplines such as graphic design, advertising, marketing and public relations. 
- Strong design eye, editing skills and attention to detail 
- Basic understanding of graphic design and page layout principles are needed. 
- Experience with print layout, pre-press and production. 
- Experience in marketing retail products  both in-store and for web-based products and services. 
- Excellent project management, communications, and interpersonal skills. 
- Ability to work with individuals from diverse areas and different levels within the company. 
- Proficient in MS Word, PowerPoint and Excel. 
- Experience with Photoshop and Illustrator a plus.
- Ability to understand and communicate DVD Stations business, marketplace and value proposition 
- Ability to work independently in a deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously 
- Knowledge of retail, media, and entertainment industries a plus



Job Description:

- Develop, write, edit and syndicate all corporate press announcements 
- Perform various writing assignments including internal and external publications 
- Manage and develop the corporate website including content, layout, messaging 
brand representation and positioning 
- Create and manage corporate marketing kit and development of other company collateral materials. 
- Maintain the corporate image and branding efforts, both internally and externally. 
- Ensure consistency and appropriate delivery of all public-facing messaging 
- Input traffic, user activity and subscription data into excel tracking spreadsheets. 
- Assist in implementing search engine optimization improvements with other functional groups. 
- Ensure accurate audience measurement by Comscore/Media Metrix and Nielsen/Netratings. 
- Effectively cross promote and drive traffic to DVD Station on new affiliate partners. 
- Manage various projects designed to increase membership rates. 


Back to Top

ShezTek's set was probably my favorite of the night.  He started it off with 
what sounded like a remix of "No Way Back" by Adonis (or maybe the track just 
sampled the bassline?), followed by Joey Beltram's "Energy Flash"--  !!! ---  
wow!  Hearing tracks like these made me feel a great joy that could hardly be 
described in words...  except for perhaps the words "Hello 2Day!!",  but I 
think this catch phrase has already been taken...  The rest of his set mixed 
breaks, techno, trance, house, electro-- awesome!! The spontaneous raver hug orgy 
and lip sync contest at the end was an added bonus. 

Thanks Moksha Tribe for another great party!

Love, 
     Chel-C Faith
      www.defsf.com

music to move your body and soul. This Thursday, we

special treat to celebrate my birthday :D ), and
following will be DJs SpinDriver, Memory, and Hans,
bringing you a fluid and mind-expanding journey
through progressive and ethereal trance dimensions.

thereafter. Come early for better parking and to give
me some feedback on my initiation into the world of
mixology. If you're a LEO too, come say hi and I'll
buy you a special birthday drink!

Subject: [sfraves] (bsp) attention monterey groovers - this weekends line-up

Hello fellow late nighter,

The summer is just trucking along,
and we are not about to stop the vibe
out in the garden.

1st: Things out for our first c o i n c i d e  last
thursday went smooth.
In time, we hope this event will be another
great nite for something abit different than
the usual weekend nites. We would like
to experiment more with other media.
Time will only tell.

2nd: Big thanks to all the new people who made it
out for the first time this weekend. We hope
this was an enjoyable evening for you?
Thanks to Jon, I:van, and Kelau for dropping
the tracks on us.

3rd: This week - friday santa cruz will be in the
house. Kikkoman ( who will be playing one
of his last sets for sometime. because he is
heading out of the country for a spell )
Wyze One back in the garden again, after his last
visit a few weeks back. Maybe the SC posse will
be in attendence that nite.


4th: Saturday we are having Alex B and first timer Rueben
getting down on the decks this nite.

So there is no excuses - weather is great and the
tunes will be even greater.

So invite a friend for an evening of music and vibes. Under the stars!

peace...
scientists of sound
