Subject: [sfraves] Jagan Review

------=_NextPart_000_0045_01C35BAA.DCE21D80
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Well who knows when my email server will actually post this to the list,
but I really wanted to write about Jagan!
 
This was an awesome party, and my friends had come up from LA and they
always look forward to going to parties up here. Although it took us
about 30
Minutes driving around trying to find the mappoint, giving up and
finally getting ahold of Audra, we got to the party! There was something
eerie about looking for an off-ramp and seeing the sign for it on an
overpass above you.
 
Anyways, the decorations were beautiful, signs were everywhere helping
to direct people and it was well-laid out. The 'bars' choice of RedBull,
Sierra and sake was interesting, but a cool idea. The crew as always was
helpful and friendly. They were on top of everything and always
patrolling the party hanging out. I *ahem* got a little intoxicated, and
put down my battery charger for my camera. Luckily, someone found it and
put it in lost and found and Terry brought it to me!
 
            The visuals, by Mr. Terry and the Viberation crew were
amazing as usual. The anime movies overlaid with the Animatrix were dope
and really added to the party. So many people were dressed up in
costumes and really getting into the theme of the party. The music was
great and every room had a good variety to it with people dancing all
throughout the night. All the DJs were just awesome and I found myself
moving from room to room trying to catch everything.
 
            This is one of those parties that everyone talks about
afterwards and I am really glad that I was able to be part of it. I met
many new people and saw a lot of old friends. Like I was saying to
Apollo, every Moksha party just seems to be getting better and better!
My only regret was having camera trouble and not finding the mappoint
easily. Hearing Delirium at the end at the party was definitely a
throwback to different days, and seeing the room fill up at 6 am with
energetic, happy people only served to remind me why I go to parties
like these.
 
            Thanks again to the Moksha Tribe crew and all the hard work
you put into this party. It was definitely well appreciated!
 
 
-          Buzz
 
 
 

------=_NextPart_000_0045_01C35BAA.DCE21D80--

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:Better Fun Party! Featuring Dj Van Dune!

Better Fun-draiser

On August 9th we are bringing you a party that will simply be Better Fun!
The Burning Man theme camp of Better Fun is preparing for their departure to
the Playa. This Fun-draising event has been organized to help raise few
dollars for necessary BM items (food, shelter, transportation), and to give
all of you a chance to party your ass off with us before we go!  We are
taking this out with an old-skool underground flavor and plenty of fun
things to embark upon- including The Wheel of Sin, a tantalizing Bake Sale,
pasty craft corner, and plenty of debauchery!

Your DJ's upstairs, bringing you some of the best 4 on the Floor the bay
area has to offer, will be:

Jay Walker (bfamily records)
Happy Kid Marty (Happy Kids)
Ian Vogel (Happy Kids)
MAC (NBC)
Ornette aka Logik (NBC)
Alex Van Dune (NBC/ACME/Pixelbisquet)


The downstairs Chill Room Environment hosted by The Ambient Mafia,
with trip-bass-breaky-funk sounds provided by:

Oracle (510junglists/Pangea)
and the Ambient Mafia's...
Speakeasy Ray
Boomerang Fidget
Drop
Redstickman
Harken


A few more reasons to come and check it out...
A great mixture of Bay Area underground Dj's!
Glow in the Dark performances!
New Black Light Art from Witco!
Last Chance to party with Robert & Sandra before they move north!
Hot Kostumes!
Because it's going to be Better Fun!

Party will go from 10 until 4:30
$10 @ the door  / $5 with tickets to Threshold
Water is $.50

Alcohol will not be sold at this event.




           Alex Van Dune

I am reminded of the immortal words of Socrates who once said
     "I drank what?"

I must pimp my husband's band, Ok I realy need some current and former punk rockers to show up and mosh with me, they are rock, which isnt really my thing, you know, so I told my husband I would dance if they wrote a punk song, and they did, it's called "All My Drugs."  I look really dumb moshing by myself, slamming into walls and such. Plus the Sushi is really good, and it is a fun little venue.
Hello Friends,
 
You are invited to Rock with Swaybone
next Friday, August 15 @ the Voodoo Lounge!
We are very excited about new songs we've added to 
the set, so come surge and swirl with us...
 
at 2937 Mission st. in San Francisco
 
Here's the lineup....
 9:00 Camaro Hair
10:00 Swaybone
11:00 Thought Crime
12:00 The Mediam
 
We'll see you, and we love you!!!
http://www.swaybone.com

Subject: [sfraves] .: New Mixes from Dirtbox Radio : Roundtable Crew, Dirtbox Kru :.

Boh.

This past Sunday's Dirtbox was a shitload of fun.  Baltimore's Roundtable
Crew rolled thru to take over the night, followed by Dirtbox Kru &
Partners in Crime ODJ, Jerel, and Hooligan on the Afterhours tip.  We had
a great time chillin with the Roundtable kids, drinkin brews, shootin
shit, and hearing some tight fuckin tracks.

If you'd like to check out any of the sets, they're linked down below, and
on the site (www.dirtboxradio.com/archives.html).  The ets are listed in
timeslot order, avaialable as 56k realMedia , and 128k mp3s.  Oh yeah -
longer mp3 sets are split up into hour chunks, for easy burning:)

Roundtable Takeover:

Simetra
56k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-Simetra.ram
128k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-Simetra.mp3

Hue-E
56k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-Hue-E.ram
128k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-Hue-E.mp3

Dimetrios
56k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-Dimetrios.ram
128k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-Dimetrios.mp3

Rev E
56k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-Rev_E.ram
128k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-Rev_E.mp3

J_Me
56k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-J_Me.ram
128k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Roundtable_Takeover-J_Me.mp3

Afterhours w/ the Dirtbox Kru:

Hooligan
56k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Afterhours-Hooligan.ram
128k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Afterhours-Hooligan.mp3

ODJ
56k - http://dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Afterhours-ODJ.ram
128k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Afterhours-ODJ.mp3

Jerel
56k - http://dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Afterhours-Jerel.ram
128k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Afterhours-Jerel.mp3

ODJ & Jerel
56k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Afterhours-ODJ+Jerel.ram
128k -
http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Afterhours-ODJ+Jerel-1of2.mp3

http://dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030803-Afterhours-ODJ+Jerel-2of2.mp3

And yeah, in case you're wondering - that's about 10 hours of drum 'n'
bass there:)

Enjoy.
Jackson (ODJ)

Subject: [sfraves] RE:BSP:Better Fun Party on Saturday night featuring DJ Van Dune! and co!

www.betterfun.org is the contact info, DOH!

Better Fun-draiser


On August 9th we are bringing you a party that will simply be Better Fun!
The Burning Man theme camp of Better Fun is preparing for their departure to
the Playa. This Fun-draising event has been organized to help raise few
dollars for necessary BM items (food, shelter, transportation), and to give
all of you a chance to party your ass off with us before we go!  We are
taking this out with an old-skool underground flavor and plenty of fun
things to embark upon- including The Wheel of Sin, a tantalizing Bake Sale,
pasty craft corner, and plenty of debauchery!

Your DJ's upstairs, bringing you some of the best 4 on the Floor the bay
area has to offer, will be:

Jay Walker (bfamily records)
Happy Kid Marty (Happy Kids)
Ian Vogel (Happy Kids)
MAC (NBC)
Ornette aka Logik (NBC)
Alex Van Dune (NBC/ACME/Pixelbisquet)


The downstairs Chill Room Environment hosted by The Ambient Mafia,
with trip-bass-breaky-funk sounds provided by:

Oracle (510junglists/Pangea)
and the Ambient Mafia's...
Speakeasy Ray
Boomerang Fidget
Drop
Redstickman
Harken


A few more reasons to come and check it out...
A great mixture of Bay Area underground Dj's!
Glow in the Dark performances!
New Black Light Art from Witco!
Last Chance to party with Robert & Sandra before they move north!
Hot Kostumes!
Because it's going to be Better Fun!

Party will go from 10 until 4:30
$10 @ the door  / $5 with tickets to Threshold
Water is $.50

Alcohol will not be sold at this event.

Located at the Oakland Noodle Factory (1255 26th St @Union - Oakland, CA), a
spacious warehouse near central freeways which includes 2 rooms of music, a
chill room, bathrooms, and a smoking area.

Please checkout the website Friday August 8th for better directions and
parking instructions. www.beterfun.org

Any questions or comments, please send them to whit@group114.com. Can't wait
to see you there...






           Alex Van Dune

I am reminded of the immortal words of Socrates who once said
     "I drank what?"

Subject: [sfraves] world of stereo 2


hey all,

I'm new to the list so this might have been beaten to death a million 
times..  World of Stereo 2..  good, bad, ugly?

I bought some what seem to be gray market 1210m3d's and a Stanton sa-8 
mixer from there.  The price was definitely right but there's a missing 
washer on the mixer and I also had to go back and get some missing parts 
for one of the decks (they forgot to include euro->american plugs, a 
rubber mat and the ep converter).  Everything seems to work ok though and 
it was *way* cheaper than anything else I've seen..

..

here's a pic of the rig:

http://brak.g42.net/patrick/turntables.jpg

--Patrick.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] world of stereo 2

I have a pair of "grey market" SL1210-M3D's (b). Everything came in the 
boxes just like they would if I had bought them from a Panasonic dealer in 
London... Nothing missing. I also got a great price and they included the 
Euro- American plugs for free.

I'm not sure about the retailer you picked them up from (I bought mine from 
Musicians Friend in OR), but the 1210's should be pretty much the exact same 
thing as the N. American SL1200-M3D's. Mine work great and even some people 
on this list have played on them. No ones had any isses with them.

AUDi,
Gavin

Subject: Re: [sfraves] world of stereo 2

On Thu, 7 Aug 2003, Rareform Recordings wrote:

> I have a pair of "grey market" SL1210-M3D's (b). Everything came in the 
> boxes just like they would if I had bought them from a Panasonic dealer in 
> London... Nothing missing. I also got a great price and they included the 
> Euro- American plugs for free.

I went back to the store and they gave me all the stuff that was missing, 
so it turned out ok so far.  The prices were amazing so I was a little 
nervous that it was almost too good of a deal.

> I'm not sure about the retailer you picked them up from (I bought mine from 
> Musicians Friend in OR), but the 1210's should be pretty much the exact same 
> thing as the N. American SL1200-M3D's. Mine work great and even some people 
> on this list have played on them. No ones had any isses with them.

>From what I can tell, the only real difference is the 220/110 V switch and 
the euro plugs.  They seem to work great, although my first forays into 
doing proper beat mixing again weren't exactly a pretty sight (or pretty 
to listen to), but I seem to be getting better.  It takes a little bit to 
shake off 6 years of rust.

--Patrick.

Date: Thu, 7 Aug 2003 09:57:18 -0700 (PDT)
From: Jessica McMahan <ceridwen_ruad@yahoo.com>
To: SFRaves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] [Politics] Take an active part - CA voter info (long)

Okay, people... since this recall election is coming up, this is the
time to take an active (or at least semi-active) part in your future
here in California. 

I have to say... I love California. Not only did the state actually
rally enough to get this recall election in motion (first time
nationally in 82 years and first time in California history), it's the
only place where the likes of comedian Gallagher, porn mogul Larry
Flynt, actors Gary Coleman and Arnold Schwarzenegger all run for
Governor. 

Personally, I'm finally to the point in my life where I actually do
care about the future of my government. So many things are just plain
wrong in our State and Federal Government. So many hardships are being
forced on the American people because of the politicians' fuck-ups.
It's time to become more involved. 

I encourage all of you, my friends, to register to vote if you haven't
already. And if you have, make sure your Voter Info is up-to-date! And
make it a point to be educated on your party's platform and the
platforms of the Gubernatorial (and in the upcoming future,
Presidential) candidates. 

Link to Online Voter Registration for California (VERY EASY!!):
https://ovr.ss.ca.gov/votereg/OnlineVoterReg

Also, if you don't have a political party, this may be the time for you
to take a look and think about it. There are 8 different parties listed
on the California Voter Registration, along with a "decline to state"
and "other" decision. 

Listed California Political Parties:
- American Independent: http://www.aipca.org (state),
http://www.constitutionparty.com (national)
- Democratic: http://www.ca-dem.org (state), http://www.democrats.org
(national)
- Green: http://www.greens.org/california (state),
http://www.greenpartyus.org (national)
- Libertarian: http://www.ca.lp.org (state), http://www.lp.org
(national)
- Natural Law: www.natural-law.org/states/California.html (state),
www.natural-law.org (national)
- Peace and Freedom: http://www.peaceandfreedom.org (state)
- Republican: http://www.cagop.org (state), http://www.rnc.org
(national)

I'm still making my party decision (it's tough!) and yes, I declined to
state my party on my registration. 

In looking at some of the more prominent Gubernatorial candidates, the
only candidates to really stand out to me so far are:
- Arianna Huffington (I): http://www.AriannaForGov.com
- Georgy Russell (D): http://www.georgyforgov.com - Local East Bay
candidate!

There are also (these are candidates w/ websites):
- Audie Bock (D): http://www.audiebock.com
- Larry Flynt (D): http://www.larryflynt.com
- Joe Guzzardi (D):
http://www.americanpatrol.com/CALIFORNIA/ELECTION/2004/GUZZARDI/GuzzardiForGovernor030725.html
- Darrell Issa (R): http://www.issaforgovernor.com
- Arnold Schwarzenegger (R): http://www.arnold4gov.com
- Jason Gastrich (I): http://www.jasongastrich.com
- Ron Gulke (AI): http://www.gulke.com
- Dale Ogden (L): http://www.dalefogden.org

Recall Election info from CA Sec of State's site:
http://www.ss.ca.gov/elections/recall.htm

Again, even if you don't take a part in a candidate's campaign or heavy
political activism, AT LEAST register to vote and check out the
candidates' platforms. Make an INFORMED DECISION! This is your future
we're working on here.

Okay, I'll get down from this lovely soapbox and go back to my daily
business. 

Jessica

Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Date: Thu, 7 Aug 2003 12:28:39 -0700
Message-ID: <20030807.122839.-1084785.0.teknobuddha@juno.com>
X-Mailer: Juno 2.0.11
X-Juno-Line-Breaks: 2,7,11,22,33,35,39,41-42,57-58,64-67

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
From: max phillips <teknobuddha@juno.com>
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] [Politics] Take an active part - CA voter info (long)

 Actually, I was ambivalent about the recall effort. It had it's positive
and negative sides to it and it was hella hard to decide whether to jump
on board. 
 What eventualy turned me off from the recall was mostly who was pushing
it. Not that I like Gray Davis, he's pretty much incompetent, corrupt and
making the poor suffer the most from the budget cuts, but a potential
Issa or Simon governorship to me would haven been even a worse
alternative. 
 True, there were some progressives out there helping the recall, but I
feel they were being used by the radical right to help steal another
election (remember Florida?) and do to Californians on a more local level
what Bush is doing to the rest of the country.
 The recall effort was mostly a hard right affair. When I watched the
recall rally in Sac the other week on C-Span, the crowd was 95% white,
the speakers were mostly right wing talk show hosts, spewing out one
racist, anti immigrant, homophobic remarks after another. I felt like I
was watching a KKK rally without the hoods. If this had really been a
real people's recall effort, not paid for by Issa, then I might have been
more inclined to join in. To ask me to sign a recall petition by a person
screaming "save the family and marrage (from the scourage of
homosexuality)"! "Save (white) California from being overrun by Mexicans
and immigrants!" would have asked too much from me and other more
tollerent Californians.
 But be as that may, it's done and we are facing a recall anyway. I
actually do favor one or Davis's efforts (the rest of his efforts are
silly) to postpone the recall for a couple of months: one, the counties
won't be ready and there will not be enough polling places to vote. When
the decisons have to be made to where to set up limited polling places,
where do you think they are going to be placed? In poor places? In places
that are more liberal? In places where people of color live? Voting will
be very difficult and that will disfranchize alot of people, mostly
people who will not normaly vote for a Republican. You will see plenty of
polling places and better machines in Orange County and Modesto, but
places like San Francisco and Oakland will be a different story.
 Two, most of the machines that will be used will be antiquated and the
temptation to cheat will be too strong.
 Three, this election will be too costly and if we can wait a few months,
we can get it done far cheeper, with more polling places up, have better
machines up and running and have more poll workers to run them and give
more people a chance to vote. 
Unless we have more time, I see this election as riged for the
Republicans to win.
 
 Who to vote for? I will vote NO for the recall as stated before, but may
vote for Arriana Hufffington or the Green Party candidate, not sure yet.
Bustamomte has jumped Davis's ship and is in and that changes things too.
Arnold Schwarzenegger isn't all that bad, he's for gay marriages, pro
choice and so forth, but I'm not convinced he will be taken serious
enough and is competent to be governor of a state of 33m people. Why is
he a Republican anyway? The Republicans absolutely hate him and will try
to sabotage his candidacy, and that is one big reason I may actually
consider voting for him. People like Gary Coleman, Larry Flint and
Gallenger add a European flavor to the election, but are not serious and
this election is serious. Again, the Republicans don't mind all this. The
people who may cast votes for the sarcastic candidates don't vote
Republican anyway, so more votes for the comics and porn publishers mean
more votes for the Republicans. Remember, who ever has the most votes
wins. There is no run off!

 But definitly yes, make sure you vote and register if you haven't. One
big effort I do ask of people to make this election more fair and not let
it become a coup for the Republicans is to make sure everyone has a right
to vote. Fight to make sure polling places are distributed fairly and
that the poor and people of color won't get shafted like they were in
Florida.

 Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^

pro=B7gres=B7sion n.

The process of progressing; progress.=20
Movement from one member of a continuous series to the next.=20
A continuous series; a sequence.=20

As unique as the progressive genre itself, enuriye productions launches =
'Progression'. This is an exclusive Sunday experience that will entail =
some serious tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks at one of the=20
best, most intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.=20

This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory =
experience built around sound and dance. We are putting out a call for =
the masses to join our party, a temporal community where an attitude of=20
acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of our =
underground movement, with its roots founded on electronic music and our =
personal desire to expose it to everyone.

Join our family and experience what an awesome year it has been =
musically for our DJ's of this up-and-coming progressive collective.

Next Event is August 17th, 2003

Subject: [sfraves] Re: Mastering? SRR

At 02:13 AM 7/31/2003 +0000, you wrote:
>A chum of mine up in canuckia wants to have some hiphop tracks
>professionally mastered/equalized . Can any of you suggest anyone
>particularly reliable and fairly priced?

Well... I just got back the test pressing of my 1st record; it's hard 
techno. My label is called EGR Records and I'll have a web site up soon 
once the full order arrives. I produced 2 tracks on it and the other 2 were 
split by producer friends of mine (Nadon & Hedmess). I engineered/mastered 
the tracks and sent them through the entire record creation process.  The 
results are on par with new records coming out for hard techno, so I'm very 
pleased. I'll be posting my set from Defcon that has the 3 tracks in the 
mix soon.

I am getting test pressings out to the appropriate DJs in the local area 
and beyond. I should have the first full run in a couple of weeks.

I have access to a fully loaded professional studio (Bloody Angle Compound 
/ Asphodel) which I have been working in for over a year. See 
http://audio.egregious.net/  for more info.

Currently, I'd be glad to assist other independent producers who want their 
tracks on vinyl. I'm down to do the mastering for free as long as the 
producer(s) go through with the entire process (lacquer, stamper, and small 
run of 300+ units) with the lacquer engineer/press I am working with at the 
moment.  I'm offering this opportunity for 20-30 records in order to build 
up my credits list, fine tune my engineering/mastering for vinyl for all 
genres, and to make contact/help other independent producers across all genres.

If this is of interest to anyone here do get in contact. I'd be glad to 
discuss the lacquer/pressing costs and other concerns. This is a "word of 
mouth" offer and only applies to producers interested in making records. I 
am not posting this offer on my audio web site 
(http://audio.egregious.net/). If you visit my mastering page you will find 
my standard rate.

A quick hint... Consider working with 2 to 3 producer friends to create an 
EP and split the cost 2 to 4 ways; with the deal I am offering this makes 
it within reach of pretty much anyone producing out there. Take the reins 
into your own hands and don't wait (and wait) for someone else to release 
your music! DIY!

Best,
--Mike

Egregious
"Spiritual renewal through music for those outside the heard."
http://www.egregious.net/

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Message-ID: <20030807.222446.-1084785.0.teknobuddha@juno.com>
X-Mailer: Juno 2.0.11
X-Juno-Line-Breaks: 1-2,4-6,8-9,11,13,17-18,20-23,25-26,29,31,33-34,37,39-41,43-49,52-54,56-57,59-60,62-68,70,72-81,83-87,89-90,92-98,100-106

From: max phillips <teknobuddha@juno.com>
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] ***~~*ATTENTION RAVERS!!!*~~*** We have a chance to make OuR vOiCe KnOwN!!!!!!!!!

I just heard today that the California Supreme Court upheld the recall
election. 
So it's officially on! 
With all these candidates running, everyone will be looking for every
vote they can get.
So what does this mean for the rave scene?
Fuck yeah...you got it! 
It means that we have a golden opportunity to make our voice as ravers
known!

With my calculation, there are potentially 150k ravers in the state of
California and that means at least 100k of us can vote.
It hasn't hit us yet that we are potentially a good block or votes that
could make a candidate win or loose the election.
If we were to organize as one block of votes and could deliver a
candidate a hella lot of them, we will be taken speciously as a valuable
"special interest group" and would be listened to when we approach a
candidate with our issues.
100k potential votes? You bet we will be listened to! 
Not only that, but I bet the candidates will be after us to be listened
to!

So here's my idea.
We need to move fast on this and get organized,
and I propose that we have a meeting ASAP and stratigize what we can do
to get organized.
Who can be on this?
Promoters, producers, DJ's, organizations like Dance Safe, SFLNC, ROAR
and every day ravers who care about their scene and want to defend our
right to dance!
I believe with everyone doing their part and utilizing our talents,
contacts, and recourses as one big effort, 
we can become a big voting block that will make us noticed and listened
to.

If I, as one raver in Oakland tries to get the attention of candidates
like Schwarenegger or Arianna Huffington, chances I will not be listened
to.
But if they were approached by a voting block that represents 100k
potential votes, I and 99,999 other ravers will get their ears.

This doesn't have to be complicated or cost allot of money,
all that needed to be done to make this happen is for people to lay down
the drama, burry the hatchet with other ravers,
become one and think about the WHOLE rave community
and not just about ourselves and our own interests in the scene.

Our intent is to not officially endorse a particular candidate.
Our issue is the right to dance,
nothing else. 
Our intent is to bring to the rave community the positions candidates
have made on the right to dance and what they will do for us if elected
as governor.

They will have a position on us,
because 100k organized potential voters will make them have a position on
the right to dance. 

And from their position, we can inform the rave community who is the most
friendly toward us, 
and who is not.
And from that, ravers who make the right to dance one of their top 3
issues that will influence their decision on who to vote for 
will have important information that will help them make their decision,
no matter who that candidate may be.

My suggestion is to start local here in the Bay Area,
that can include Sac and the Central Valley as well.
Start our first organizational meeting here,
and then, with what we have put together, and who we have contact with
state wide,
organize state wide meetings and get this pushed quickly as one state
wide organization.
Timing is essential here!

If you think this is a good idea and want to participate,
hit the list with a good day to meet
and let's set our first organizational meeting no latter than one week.
If your on other lists,
PLEASE forward this idea to them
and let's get this going!

Hey, with what we have as far as smarts, creativity, tallents, contacts,
influences and numbers,
we can make a hella BIG influence on this election!
YES WE CAN!!!!!
We have the best oppertunity EVER given to us to make our voice known.

True, the anti rave bull shit is a federal issue and a governor can't
undo federal law,
BUT....
a governor of the most populated and influential state in the union being
on our side and speaking for us 
can be a powerful influence to not only resend the present anti rave law,
but keep the newer and more Draconian version from being passed.

California is always a trend setter.
Let's use our national influence to defend the right to dance 
from Portland Oregon to Portland Maine.
And we start by helping to elect a governor who will defend our right to
dance
>From San Diego to Ukiah first!
And as the Confucianist saying goes;
"a journey of a thousand miles starts with one step".
Let's begin the first step NOW!!!!!!

Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: Mastering? SRR



I think mastering for vinyl and CD are two very different things.  Make
sure you know which media you are targeting before you make you decision.

On Thu, Aug 07, 2003 at 09:50:32PM -0700, Catharsis wrote:
> At 02:13 AM 7/31/2003 +0000, you wrote:
> >A chum of mine up in canuckia wants to have some hiphop tracks
> >professionally mastered/equalized . Can any of you suggest anyone
> >particularly reliable and fairly priced?
> 
> Well... I just got back the test pressing of my 1st record; it's hard 
> techno. My label is called EGR Records and I'll have a web site up soon 
> once the full order arrives. I produced 2 tracks on it and the other 2 were 
> split by producer friends of mine (Nadon & Hedmess). I engineered/mastered 
> the tracks and sent them through the entire record creation process.  The 
> results are on par with new records coming out for hard techno, so I'm very 
> pleased. I'll be posting my set from Defcon that has the 3 tracks in the 
> mix soon.
> 
> I am getting test pressings out to the appropriate DJs in the local area 
> and beyond. I should have the first full run in a couple of weeks.
> 
> I have access to a fully loaded professional studio (Bloody Angle Compound 
> / Asphodel) which I have been working in for over a year. See 
> http://audio.egregious.net/  for more info.
> 
> Currently, I'd be glad to assist other independent producers who want their 
> tracks on vinyl. I'm down to do the mastering for free as long as the 
> producer(s) go through with the entire process (lacquer, stamper, and small 
> run of 300+ units) with the lacquer engineer/press I am working with at the 
> moment.  I'm offering this opportunity for 20-30 records in order to build 
> up my credits list, fine tune my engineering/mastering for vinyl for all 
> genres, and to make contact/help other independent producers across all 
> genres.
> 
> If this is of interest to anyone here do get in contact. I'd be glad to 
> discuss the lacquer/pressing costs and other concerns. This is a "word of 
> mouth" offer and only applies to producers interested in making records. I 
> am not posting this offer on my audio web site 
> (http://audio.egregious.net/). If you visit my mastering page you will find 
> my standard rate.
> 
> A quick hint... Consider working with 2 to 3 producer friends to create an 
> EP and split the cost 2 to 4 ways; with the deal I am offering this makes 
> it within reach of pretty much anyone producing out there. Take the reins 
> into your own hands and don't wait (and wait) for someone else to release 
> your music! DIY!
> 
> Best,
> --Mike
> 
> Egregious
> "Spiritual renewal through music for those outside the heard."
> http://www.egregious.net/

Subject: [sfraves] "DETROIT" this Sunday night at the Skylark (bsp)

"DETROIT, WHERE THAT PARTY AT? RIGHT HERE!"

Sup folks! We're kicking the funk for you this Sunday night like every Sunday with Motor City mavens Baby Daddy (Rob Goppold) and 12 Mile (Brian Stein) rolling out a soulful and brisk mix of everything Detroit from underground electro bleeps to classic Motown ditties. 

Big thanks to Domingo Yu for his awesome set last week- keep a look out folks as we're sure to have him back soon.

Detroit is free, and starts at 9 every Sunday night at the Skylark, 3089 16st., San Francisco.

Thanks - The Woodward Posse

OTHER UPCOMING EVENTS: Check out Baby Daddy wrockin' it with Bfamily cohorts Joe Encarnacion & Jon Schatz AKA The Lord Of the Bling as they team up with Felix the Dog and Ms. Throwdown for a (((THUMP))) Radio production this Saturday night in the Lounge at DNA. More info here: http://bfamilyrecords.com/gigs/index.htm

ALSO: Are you an Urban Cowboy? Check out Pirate Radio next Friday night August 22 at Club Galia. More info here: http://www.rumpshaker.net/pirateradio.php

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Cine-Lounge tonight, and a lineup change.

Frogs will transform into the VF Cine-Lounge, an awesome place to relax,
have a drink, be social & enjoy a movie. Enjoy a movie?!?! That's right
from 6-8 we will be showing a film for all you lounge cats to enjoy and
our dj's will start the music flowing immediately following.  Dancing is
optional =)


The movie will be "SWINGERS" Starring Vince Vaughn, John Favreau &
Heather Graham. Seating for showing will be limited so early arrival is
recommended.

Whether you're planning to start your night with us or finishing it
off... this is one event you won't want to miss!

The VF Cine-Lounge is also WI-FI friendly with free connections for all
users.

Location: VF Cine-Lounge(inside Venture Frogs) www.vfrog.com
1000 Van Ness & O'farrell
Date & Time: Fri Aug 8th 6pm - ???
Cover: Free
Ages: 21+
Dress: Casual (no sports attire)
Music: House & Breaks
Dj's: Koroma, J.C. & Floorcraft

Drink Specials:
$4 Martini's 6-8pm (during the movie)
$3 Cosmo's & Kamikazes 8-10pm

Specials and priority seating reserved for those who RSVP. Seating is
extremely limited for movie only. RSVP by emailing events@aurasf.com .

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:Only one more day till BETTER FUN!Saturday!

Forgive me for inundating you with this spam, but this is what happens when 
gigs are far and few between, I get all excited, like when I am on the 
decks, spinnin what I love to spin, oh just come on down and through little 
pickles at me, might cool me off. Not whole pickles this time, the deli 
sliced kind with the little ridges, guess I get whats I get! Read on!

Better Fun-draiser

On August 9th we are bringing you a party that will simply be Better Fun!
The Burning Man theme camp of Better Fun is preparing for their departure to
the Playa. This Fun-draising event has been organized to help raise few
dollars for necessary BM items (food, shelter, transportation), and to give
all of you a chance to party your ass off with us before we go!  We are
taking this out with an old-skool underground flavor and plenty of fun
things to embark upon- including The Wheel of Sin, a tantalizing Bake Sale,
pasty craft corner, and plenty of debauchery!

Your DJ's upstairs, bringing you some of the best 4 on the Floor the bay
area has to offer, will be:

Jay Walker (bfamily records)
Happy Kid Marty (Happy Kids)
Ian Vogel (Happy Kids)
MAC (NBC)
Ornette aka Logik (NBC)
Alex Van Dune (NBC/ACME/Pixelbisquet)


The downstairs Chill Room Environment hosted by The Ambient Mafia,
with trip-bass-breaky-funk sounds provided by:

Oracle (510junglists/Pangea)
and the Ambient Mafia's...
Speakeasy Ray
Boomerang Fidget
Drop
Redstickman
Harken


A few more reasons to come and check it out...
A great mixture of Bay Area underground Dj's!
Glow in the Dark performances!
New Black Light Art from Witco!
Last Chance to party with Robert & Sandra before they move north!
Hot Kostumes!
Because it's going to be Better Fun!

Party will go from 10 until 4:30
$10 @ the door  / $5 with tickets to Threshold
Water is $.50

Alcohol will not be sold at this event.

Please checkout the website Friday August 8th for better directions and
parking instructions. www.beterfun.org

Any questions or comments, please send them to whit@group114.com. Can't wait
to see you there...


www.betterfun.org





           Alex Van Dune

I am reminded of the immortal words of Socrates who once said
     "I drank what?"

Subject: [sfraves] We have a chance to make OuR vOiCe KnOwN!!!!!!!!!

but, he's already beginning to fumble as a politician and I don't know if
he will make it in the real political world, no matter how rich and
popular he is.
But that's my opinion, 
and he is pretty much central on many issues,
pro gay rights, pro choice, pro education funding, etc.
The Republican Party absolutely hates him and that is the reason why Bill
Simon is running.
So if you are more liberal inclined, he's not all that bad.
Would you rather have Arnold or Simon as governor, speaking to the
progressives?
Being from Germany, he actualy might be way more receptive to us than
Simon.
Enough of that.

What I'm proposing is so simple, and if the rave community can come
together and pull our recourses in one effort,
WE CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE!
What will make this hard is complacency.

I love California, not only because of diversity, the cool summer weather
and red wood trees, but because we are the epicenter of culture and
trends. 
If I ever leave California, it's because it's time for me to travel,
not so much who is governor.
California is worth fighting for,
and what we do as ravers in this election
WILL REBERATE ALL OVER THE NATION!
IF WE LOOSE OUR RIGHTS HERE
THE REST OF THE NATION WILL FOLLOW
IF WE STAND UP FOR OUR RIGHTS HERE,
THE REST OF THE NATION WILL FOLLOW.
Think about it,
we are trend setters,
IT'S ABOUT TIME WE ORGANIZE
AND START STANDING UP FOR OUR RIGHTS!
We don't realize what our effort can do for raving all over the nation!
We need to realize that we do have influential power over who will be
governor,
Again, what will cause us to forfeit that influence is 
COMPLIANCY!

We only need three substantial things 
TO EXERT OUR RAVER POWER,
a web sight,
getting the word out about our web sight
and people getting together and making this happen.

The web sight will contain interviews we will have with the candidates on
their issues about the right to dance
and who we feel is our friend and who is not on this issue.
We will NOT endorse a candidate,
but inform and let the raver decide who to vote for.
Hell, this is something Jack Triumph, CPT Scarlet and someone like me can
work on together!

It can be something like this,
We approach a candidate and tell this candidate that we are from an
organization called something, say like "RTD" (right to dance).
We tell them that we have a well known and visited web sight that
represents 100k potential voters 
and that we would like to have an interview with them on the issue about
our right to dance.
100k voters.
With these candidates needing every vote they can get,
YOU BET WE WILL GET AN INTERVIEW!
You and I can't do it alone,
BUT "RTD" CAN!

This is NOT my idea.
It belongs to the rave community in California
and YOU are needed to make it happen!

Don't run, Galvin, 
help the rave scene!

Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^

Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 1497 invoked from network); 8 Aug 2003 20:56:51 -0000
Message-Id: <5.1.0.14.2.20030808124856.01c820a0@tyranny.loopfree.net>
X-Sender: catharsis@tyranny.loopfree.net
X-Mailer: QUALCOMM Windows Eudora Version 5.1
Date: Fri, 08 Aug 2003 13:56:59 -0700
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
From: Catharsis <catharsis@egregious.net>
In-Reply-To: <1060365074.9938.ezmlm@hyperreal.org>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Re: Mastering? SRR

At 05:51 PM 8/8/2003 +0000, you wrote:
>I think mastering for vinyl and CD are two very different things.  Make
>sure you know which media you are targeting before you make you decision.

I had this presumption as well before completing the process recently. The 
lacquer engineer I work with reassured me there is no "magic pixie 
dust";  "If it sounds good on CD it will sound good on vinyl".
IE there is no magic transform in the lacquer cutting process.  This 
certainly held true with my experience.

There are of course differences with the final medium. You have more leeway 
with a CD (digital sources) in regard to wild phase issues especially in 
the low end among other issues.  If you wanted to you could hard pan back 
and forth the bass kick or other heavy low end sources and it would come 
out fine on CD, but would not work so well (if at all) for vinyl.

When I master I check for many possible problems that might make the 
lacquer difficult to cut. If the mix I receive has issues that might 
prevent it from making a good record I'll be up front about it and discuss 
options on how it can be made better.

I also provide the option to mix & master multitrack projects; there are a 
lot of benefits to doing this as I have access to some top gear for the 
mixing process (focusing on single tracks/sub groups).

I do want to point out that I am not working with only software for 
mastering. I am working with thousands of dollars of top of the line 
hardware and a pro A/D/A converter. The majority of high profile mastering 
engineers are using the same equipment I am.

I did leave off my last post that I do provide a partial reference CDR 
before the vinyl order, so that the producer might approve of the 
mastering. This allows the producer to play it on a variety of systems to 
understand how it translates; not only to different sound systems, but how 
the vinyl will sound. However, all the tracks will have 30 seconds to a 
minute cut off each track, so the producer can not walk away with a digital 
master without completing the vinyl process.  I am not offering free 
mastering for CD. I am offering free mastering for those who want vinyl.

This _word of mouth_ offer will stand up to when I complete 20 to 30 
records.  I won't post again here about it until I complete/master at least 
10 records. This is a SRR topic and is a borderline BSP, so email off list 
with questions, so I can hold true to my last statement! I'll answer any 
questions raised on list though... ;)

Best,
--Mike

Egregious
"Spiritual renewal through music for those outside the heard."
http://www.egregious.net/



---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] GANJA RIGHTS: There is a little bit of hope.

 I've been watching off and on Lou Dobb's special reports on the drug
war. Today, he had John Walters, the drug czar, on saying how dangerous
marijuana was, kids naturaly being the argument. I can tell how he was
interviewing Mr. Walters that he thought the guy was an idiot. I loved
Lou Dobb's attitude when he asked him about the medicinal use of
marijuana. All Mr. Walters could say was how dangerous pot was to kids.
 Anyway, they had a poll asking the audience if they were for or against
the legalization of pot. I figured it would be somewhere around 65%
against and 35% for.
Nope, to my surprise it was 93% for and 7% against!
We do have some hope!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] GANJA RIGHTS: There is a little bit of hope.

Keep telling yourself that. When the government decides that they can make
more money off of it being legal, rather than illegal, maybe that will
happen...but considering that just last year over 575,000 people were busted
on personal possesion charges, and the average possesion charge makes around
$500-600 for the state ( that translates into $287,500,000 per year give or
take a few dollars, lol), the government sure as shit ain't gonna legalize.
In less than a 10 year period of time, our lovely country dumped over 214
BILLION dollars into anti-marijuana legislation. Not anti DRUG, that was
just for marijuana. This country is ass backwards when it comes to archaic
drug laws. Any time a political figure has a study done on mary jane and
it's effects, facts overwhelmingly point to it being more or less harmless
(the exception being carcinogenic effects if you smoke it as opposed to
eating it), yet it still remains illegal. How many states have lobbied to
legalize, and how many times has the federal government basically said "NO
EFFIN' WAY!"?

It ain't happenin' any time soon, and that has no bearing on how many people
do or don't want it legal.....

M-

From: "Freak Zone!" <freakzone@mindspring.com>
To: "sfraves" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Date: Fri, 8 Aug 2003 21:44:22 -0700
Message-ID: <FEENKFOEOMPHAPEIKEAOMEFNEOAA.freakzone@mindspring.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook IMO, Build 9.0.2416 (9.0.2910.0)
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1165
Importance: Normal
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR - In memory of Brian

My cat Brian was put to sleep yesterday. He developed kidney and pancreas
failure as a result of feline leukemia. The illness came about fairly
quickly. Last week he was fine and then on Monday he stopped eating and
seemed to be pretty miserable. On Wednesday my roommate, Karyn, took him to
the vet where we discovered that his illness was not treatable and the vet
suggested that he be euthanised so that he wouldn't spend his last days
suffering in pain. The vet was able to give him fluids intravenously so that
he could spend one last night at home with us. We tried to make his as
comfortable as could be and gave him lots of attention and love on his last
night with us. The next day we took him back to the vet to be euthanised. It
was probably one of the hardest things I've ever had to do but I knew that
it was for the best.

Brian was originally a stray cat who appeared in our backyard one day. Since
he was a stray cat, we started calling him Brian after Brian Setzer from the
band, The Stray Cats. We started leaving a bowl of food and water out for
him. He was skittish at first but he eventually began to trust us. I got a
cat trap from the SPCA and caught him so that I could take him in to be
neutered and given shots. I had no idea if he would stick around after I
brought him back to the backyard after his ordeal at the SPCA. Sure enough
he kept coming back and eventually after much effort, I was able to gain
enough trust to let me pet him. Things progressed fairly rapidly and he
realized that nothing bad would happen to him around us and he trusted us
completely eventually becoming the total co-dependant, loving lap cat. He
was always a good cat and never got into mischief.

Today we had a memorial for him and buried him in my back yard and planted a
lemon tree in his memory.
Most people say that Brian was lucky to have such kind owners but I think we
were lucky to have him in our life as long as we did. Brian was a good
friend and I'm going to miss him terribly.


Sean




---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

people then any other pet, and I understand what it's like to lose one. I
hope you do ok after this. Just remember, get another baby kitty that
reminds you of your cat....it'll come to you when you shop around....they
always come to you like they KNOW you're for them and vice versa. Your cat
will live on in memory and heart, and there'll be another to not take it's
place, but be there to take up where your cat left off. Chin up man....I
feel for you, but it'll get better.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Freak Zone!" <freakzone@mindspring.com>
To: "sfraves" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Saturday, August 09, 2003 12:44 AM
Subject: [sfraves] NRR - In memory of Brian


> My cat Brian was put to sleep yesterday. He developed kidney and pancreas
> failure as a result of feline leukemia. The illness came about fairly
> quickly. Last week he was fine and then on Monday he stopped eating and
> seemed to be pretty miserable. On Wednesday my roommate, Karyn, took him
to
> the vet where we discovered that his illness was not treatable and the vet
> suggested that he be euthanised so that he wouldn't spend his last days
> suffering in pain. The vet was able to give him fluids intravenously so
that
> he could spend one last night at home with us. We tried to make his as
> comfortable as could be and gave him lots of attention and love on his
last
> night with us. The next day we took him back to the vet to be euthanised.
It
> was probably one of the hardest things I've ever had to do but I knew that
> it was for the best.
>
> Brian was originally a stray cat who appeared in our backyard one day.
Since
> he was a stray cat, we started calling him Brian after Brian Setzer from
the
> band, The Stray Cats. We started leaving a bowl of food and water out for
> him. He was skittish at first but he eventually began to trust us. I got a
> cat trap from the SPCA and caught him so that I could take him in to be
> neutered and given shots. I had no idea if he would stick around after I
> brought him back to the backyard after his ordeal at the SPCA. Sure enough
> he kept coming back and eventually after much effort, I was able to gain
> enough trust to let me pet him. Things progressed fairly rapidly and he
> realized that nothing bad would happen to him around us and he trusted us
> completely eventually becoming the total co-dependant, loving lap cat. He
> was always a good cat and never got into mischief.
>
> Today we had a memorial for him and buried him in my back yard and planted
a
> lemon tree in his memory.
> Most people say that Brian was lucky to have such kind owners but I think
we
> were lucky to have him in our life as long as we did. Brian was a good
> friend and I'm going to miss him terribly.
>
>
> Sean

PARTY DETAILS:

PEACE MELON DAY PARTY
Saturday, August 16th: NOON - 7 p.m.
Cafe Cocomo
650 INDIANA STREET
$7

Please join Andrew, Christian, Cece, Lisa, Geneva & Michael, Zander, Tim & 
Megan, Veronica (Vee) & Bob, Maciek, Tim & Eric as we prepare for the playa.

What is Peace Melon?
Well, glad you asked. Peace Melon takes some of its spirit from those crazy 
Octane Parties. We decided that best of all we like to hang out with 
friends, and make new ones along the way. So, on the Playa we will be 
creating a little oasis full of shade for new and old friends to get 
together, and enjoy a little libation of watermelon, other fruits and alcohol.
Utilizing the power of the triangle, we will be creating a very large shade 
structure that if seen from the sky will resemble a butterfly; each 
individual part of the butterfly will look like a slice of luscious slice 
of watermelon. We will have decks and a long line-up of folks lending a 
hand to make for a fantastic musical and gastronomical feast.
Join us on the playa, when the shade runs long we will bust out our Melons 
to be passed around and enjoyed as one.

Featured Flavors of Music @ THE MELON DAY PARTY:
+ Ms. E (FutureBreaks, SisterSF)
+ Scott Carrelli (Satellite, Qool)
+ Samira (SisterSF)
+ KENichi (OnIce, Octane)
+ FauxQ (Noel C., Seed, Platform, DownNYurty)
+ F*Down (Maciek, 808Fell, DownNYurty)
+ Gabriel (Gabe, RippedNet)

Directions from the South:
101 TO 280 NORTH TO MARIPOSA EXIT. RIGHT ON MARIPOSA.
RIGHT ON INDIANA. 1/4 MILE ON RIGHT.

Directions from the North:
BAY BRIDGE TO 101. TAKE CAESAR CHAVEZ EAST EXIT.
1/2 MILE UNDER 280 FREEWAY OVERPASS.
LEFT ON INDIANA, 8 BLOCKS. BETWEEN 19TH & MARIPOSA

Link to Map:
http://maps.yahoo.com/py/maps.py?Pyt=Tmap&ed=zWIWCup_0ToG0i2Jg9JL.h9esYn5CcXeE.8_VO_5rDFQFtG7AoNWv7PRnzFX1Nc-&csz=CA,%2B94107&country=us


.  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .
p[e]Ace

PARTY DETAILS: <br><br>
PEACE MELON DAY PARTY <br>
Saturday, August 16th: NOON - 7 p.m. <br>
Cafe Cocomo <br>
650 INDIANA STREET <br>
$7<br><br>
Please join Andrew, Christian, Cece, Lisa, Geneva &amp; Michael, Zander,
Tim &amp; Megan, Veronica (Vee) &amp; Bob, Maciek, Tim &amp; Eric as we
prepare for the playa.<br><br>
What is Peace Melon? <br>
Well, glad you asked. Peace Melon takes some of its spirit from those
crazy Octane Parties. We decided that best of all we like to hang out
with friends, and make new ones along the way. So, on the Playa we will
be creating a little oasis full of shade for new and old friends to get
together, and enjoy a little libation of watermelon, other fruits and
alcohol.<br>
Utilizing the power of the triangle, we will be creating a very large
shade structure that if seen from the sky will resemble a butterfly; each
individual part of the butterfly will look like a slice of luscious slice
of watermelon. We will have decks and a long line-up of folks lending a
hand to make for a fantastic musical and gastronomical feast.<br>
Join us on the playa, when the shade runs long we will bust out our
Melons to be passed around and enjoyed as one.<br><br>
Featured Flavors of Music @ THE MELON DAY PARTY: <br>
+ Ms. E (FutureBreaks, SisterSF) <br>

+ F*Down (Maciek, 808Fell, DownNYurty) <br>
+ Gabriel (Gabe, RippedNet)<br><br>

RIGHT ON INDIANA. 1/4 MILE ON RIGHT.<br><br>

let's do leather pants boy first....if a really classy guy who dresses well, but never wears leather pants, suddenly showed up to dinner in leather pants, i'd be thinking that maybe he might want me to spank him, and i would probably ask him first if that was what he was looking for in the evening. :) :) hahaha, also, i was thinking about good parties back in the day, and i miss it when there was more than one party that i actually not only wanted to peek in on, but stay for, and there was this one night where i was at one party, and it was all warm outside, and i was with a lot of people i had just met who all liked to go to raves to dance and to socialize without loosing their minds, like a totally chill crowd, and i was hanging out with them and getting a really great shoulder massage from one of them who, incidentally was totally hot, which is never a problem, and then i recieved an invite to go to another gig that was taking place somewhere else, and i just couldn't resist,
 because i knew the music was going to just be bumping like mad, so i left the cute boy, and went off on a small trip and it was so great. :)

Tonight you have the record release party for Andy W. There is one hell =
of a line up in the world of techno going on in the EastBay. Now you've =
all seen me go off on techno and blah blah blah it's boring blah blah =
blah. Well some of it is, but the shit that I've heard from some of the =
people playing tonight I've totally gotton into. A casual reminder for =
those afraid of techno - Amalgamation - prime time slot - Chris Jackson =
upstairs with the whole place going off - Andy W downstairs tearing shit =
up and turning that floor into a sweaty mess. Guess you all liked what =
you heard. That said come to this party. Mike Migurski, Terry, and =
myself will be tag teaming visuals. I'm trying out the new Arkaos 3.0 =
application controlled with an Oxygen 8 using all new content I've been =
working on today. Should be a mindfuck if things go as I think they =
will.

Next party to stop by gives you a $5 discount if you come to Andy's =
party first. That's a $5 party folks featuring everyone except Oracle. =
He won't be playing in case no one heard that all week. =3D)  The party =
is called BetterFun and is a burningman camp benefit party to fund the =
fun on the playa that these girls have in store. The location is less =
than 5 minutes from Andy's record release party. Makes it damn easy to =
party hop and get the best of both worlds.

What's that all mean?=20

$15 // 2 parties. That's the cost of getting into a club tonight where =
you inevitably will spend another $40+ on drinks or your choice of party =
favors. That's a steal folks.

Come play in the EastBay tonight - ALL NIGHT !!


// Threshold -- August 9th.  Come get yer techno on. //

DJ's ::
mattholland

timxavier
andyw
therhythmist

415.273.1112

This is a record release party for Mutor's Threshold EP, released on =
Refined
Music USA and distributed by Prime UK.  Several copies will be given =
away so
come early!

// A Better Fun-draiser //

>From the same people who brought you the mud wrestling
ho-down, and weeks of kostume karaoke, comes the Better
Fun-draiser.  We are a group of artists, performers,
students, teachers, faeries, goddesses, and geeks who
have somehow gotten together and organized a bunch of
fun events this summer in order to fund our Better Fun
theme camp at Burningman this year. On August 9th we
are bringing you a party of diversity, FUN, and art!=20

With your DJ's:

Jay Walker (bfamily records)
Oracle (510junglist)
Happy Kid Marty (Happy Kids)
Ian Vogel (Happy Kids)
MAC (NBC)
Logik (NBC)
Alex Van Dune


Chill room and music being hosted by The Ambient Mafia.

time :: 10pm - 4:30am

water is $.50

Substance (Illformants) *Final Scratch Set, Frogger (Breakthru) *LIVE PA,
and opening dj set by Chaser (SAC). Come early! Our patio will be open
during the afternoon for bbq and beats. Stay to get free admission into
Heavyweight.

Saturday, August 9, 2003 ** Euphoria Dreams Presents: Euphoria **

Euphoria Dreams Presents: Euphoria @ Sno-Drift

Euphoria Dreams once again presents our second installment of Euphoria @
Sno-Drift.  Last months party was a great kick-off with all our old and
new friends creating a great vibe.  Raoul Kahn and Donovan are teaming up
this month to bring you another night of SF House. Mainroom: (HOUSE) Raoul
Kahn (raoulkahn.com) Donovan (donovansf.com) Stan Loh (euphoriadreams.com)

Saturday, August 9, 2003 ** Better Fun-draiser **

On August 9th we are bringing you a party that will simply be Better Fun!
We are taking this out with an old-skool underground flavor and plenty of
fun things to embark upon- including The Wheel of Sin, a tantalizing Bake
Sale, pasty craft corner, and plenty of debauchery! Your DJ's upstairs,
bringing you some of the best 4 on the Floor the bay area has to offer,
will be: Jay Walker (bfamily records) Happy Kid Marty (Happy Kids) Ian
Vogel (Happy Kids) MAC (NBC) Ornette aka Logik (NBC) Alex Van Dune
(NBC/ACME/Pixelbisquet).  The downstairs Chill Room Environment hosted by
The Ambient Mafia, with trip-bass-breaky-funk sounds provided by:
Speakeasy Ray Boomerang Fidget Drop Redstickman Harken. A few more reasons
to come and check it out... A great mixture of Bay Area underground Dj's!
Glow in the Dark performances! New Black Light Art from Witco! Hot
Kostumes! Because it's going to be Better Fun! Party will go from 10 until
4:30 Water $1. Alcohol will not be sold at this event. Please checkout the
website Friday August 8th for better directions and parking instructions.
www.beterfun.org

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D688

Sunday, August 10, 2003 ** In Touch Collective Presents Stand Up!
Shout Out!  *MASSIVE FREE RAVE-ACT PROTEST!! **

=2E..Brings you a different kind of dance in which we will be focusing
on the recent laws and bills that have been presented to us as we
take in refreshing beats of the DJs to help keep your mood. This will
be an activist dance in which we will be gaining not the attention of
average ravers or clubers but we will be demanding the attention of
those who do not know about the recent laws that have recently come
into play.

The gathering will be held at the San Francisco Civic Center
courtyard, outside under the beautiful sky from 12 noon until 8pm
that night. We are fully permitted with the City of San Francisco and
this will be a 100% free gathering as this is a 100% non profit
event. We have setup a donation to help us pay for the sound permit
which is costing us a chunk of change. We will be accepting donations
at the gathering and we also have setup a PayPal account online at
the following link. If we can even get $1 from each person it will
fully pay for the sound permits. 100% of the donations go to the
permits.

As mentioned previously we will also will have a great lineup of DJs
to help keep you enlightened throughout the day as well as public
speakers at the tops of the hour. Public Speakers TBA...

Corner 1: St John (Wild 94.9), Ghost (Ghostribe), Matt Frost, Paul
The Fanman (Audio Metamorphosis), Fury (Audio Metamorphosis), Atom
O.N.E. (National Entity Productions, kdvs 90.3fm, DiverCity Records),
Spective (In The Scene Magazine / Zero Magazine), Wavelength

Corner 2: Joey Mazzola (Soulmatic), Felipe Avelar
(djfelipeavelar.com/bigfloor traxx), Reckless Ryan
(recklessryan.com/BASSLINEfm 90.5 KSJS/Zero Mag) ,Carlos Alfonzo
(BayRaves/Deciblast). The Doctor (BayRaves/Deciblast), Jmarr
(BayRaves), Girle (lovetribe.net/space monkey/ultrasounz), James Dub
(BayRaves/Space Monkey). Doza (The Bounce)

Corner 3: Frank Nitty (Ghostribe), Tronic (Resistance Recordings, Liquid
Vinyl DJs, CHR Spain), Valerie Sparks (Resistance Recordings) Dragn'fly
(shaolin/lovetribe), Elz (Sister SF, DJElz.com), OrionZ, DJ TriXXX
(www.a10pro.com), Ryan Thomas (www.a10pro.com) Resistance
(www.a10pro.com/www.djresistance.com) Corner 4: Ron Reeser DJs for corner
4 will be up shortly. Where: San Francisco Civic Center Courtyard - FULLY
PERMITTED! Noon - 8pm

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** Max Graham @ Ten 15 Folsom **

Euphoria Dreams & Spundae Presents: Origin @ Ten 15 Folsom
Mainroom: Spundae Presents: Max Graham with opening set by Gianni
Bassment: Dead Dan Ismael Rodriguez Cyber Joe
VIP Lounge: Eladio Raoul Kahn Atimatik
Frontroom: Rafeal Fiero

In 2001, as Kinetic records announced they chose the relatively unknown
Max Graham to mix the fourth installment of the Transport mix CD, the
music industry listened.  That year saw Max hit #23 in the coveted DJ
Magazine Top 100 - the highest new entry. While Nick Warren proclaimed Max
was going to be a worldwide success after hearing just a taste of his
production work, Paul Oakenfold himself called and invited the artist to
join him on tour dates through the US to Ibiza after hearing him play just
once. Location: 1015 Folsom St., San Francisco Doors: 10pm-6am, 21+ w/ID
only Cover: $20 door/$15 presale Info: www.euphoriadreams.com;
415.431.1200

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D662 Sa=
n
Francisco California, USA

Saturday, August 16, 2003 ** FabFresh **

FabFresh hiphop, breakdance, housedance, capoeira, locking, popping,
altering, jazz... Saturday August 16th 2003 directions Punch Gallery 155
10th st. SF, Ca. 90sec. Dance Contest! Re-introducing the 90sec. dance
contest. It's all fun, step up and rock your body to your favorite
rhythms. You'll be amazed at how much
supercalifragilisticexpialidocious-dance-dancing can happen in 90 seconds.

Objective wow the crowd and win over the judges, what ever you got,
put it on show. You have 90sec. to take over the dance floor.

530pm: Dance Workshop (poster) with TeN, a unique class sharing
fundamentals from house,breaking, hiphop and raw urban movement, "I
like to develop your rhythm and natural movement, into dynamic moves
and creativity - Ten" urban dance is challenging, exciting and fun
art form (quadmag.com/ten)

Dance Performances: organized movement rhythmically enhanced with Bay
Areas top dance crews.7pm: Get your feet dancing music Hip Hop, Classics
and House sounds Kevin Koga (nulife sf), Infinit (Hawaii) & Chris Montel
(nulife sf). 7pm-2am | first 50 people in the door at $5 | $10 after so
get in early! pre-register email ten@flo-ology.com
info: ten@flo-ology.com | www.punchgallery.com | www.soullebrity.com
| www.flo-ology.com | www.quadmag.com

Sunday, August 17, 2003 ** Progression **

As unique as the progressive genre itself, enuriye productions
launches 'Progression'. This is an exclusive Sunday experience that
will entail some serious tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks
at one of the best, most intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.

This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory
experience built around sound and dance. We are putting out a call
for the masses to join our party, a temporal community where an
attitude of acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the
beginning of our underground movement, with its roots founded on
electronic music and our personal desire to expose it to everyone.

Join our family and experience what an awesome year it has been musically
for our DJ^=D2s of this up-and-coming progressive collective. Every 3rd
Sunday 26 Mix 3024 Mission St. San Francisco Ca. 94117 info:
enuriye@hotmail.com jack@jacktriumph.com 925-577-4311 510-697-7790. with
DJ's DJ Jack Triumph (enuriye, KZSU Radio, Frisky Radio, Qo=F6l DJ Mike War=
d
(enuriye, BoardStock, Paragon Lounge).

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D689 Sa=
n
Francisco CA. California, USA

Sunday, August 31, 2003 ** RCP West presents Free Day Party **

Carlos Alfonso - DJ OrionZ - DJ James Dub - DJ Sound Sorcerer, DJ
Felipe Avelar - DJ Frequency - Captain Nemo - DJ Molly Mush; More
performers expected, so check our webpage for updates!  This event
for all ages will last from 10 AM till Dusk at a Santa Clara Count
park with plenty of shade to help keep everybody cool. No concessions
will be sold at this party, so everybody is encouraged to bring their
food and drink, although there will be grills onsite for those that
want to BBQ--make sure to bring the charcoal and burgers! RCP West is
also collecting school supplies and new or used school age clothing
(in good condition) to benefit those in need as school nears. We feel
that this is a small but important gesture that we can make to help
insure that the children in this area have what they need to go to
school this year with confidence.

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D709

-------------------------------------------------
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

SFRaves serves the greater SF Bay Area, but reaches
beyond the local scene to all corners of the Terra Firma -
thanks to everyone whose support of and contribution to
the SFRAVES.org community - locally --> to both poles
---> to all points along the equator ---> as well as each
longitude and latitude perspective that makes this beautiful
place we know as Earth our home.

Please notify me regarding new events, event changes,
deprecated event information, or any other information
pertaining to events in the greater SF Bay Area and beyond.

I look forward to hearing from you @ karina@hyperreal.org

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

Faithfully yours,
-- Karina --
karina@hyperreal.org



---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Sunday, August 10, 2003 ** In Touch Collective Presents Stand Up!
Shout Out!  *MASSIVE FREE RAVE-ACT PROTEST!! **

=2E..Brings you a different kind of dance in which we will be focusing
on the recent laws and bills that have been presented to us as we
take in refreshing beats of the DJs to help keep your mood. This will
be an activist dance in which we will be gaining not the attention of
average ravers or clubers but we will be demanding the attention of
those who do not know about the recent laws that have recently come
into play.

The gathering will be held at the San Francisco Civic Center
courtyard, outside under the beautiful sky from 12 noon until 8pm
that night. We are fully permitted with the City of San Francisco and
this will be a 100% free gathering as this is a 100% non profit
event. We have setup a donation to help us pay for the sound permit
which is costing us a chunk of change. We will be accepting donations
at the gathering and we also have setup a PayPal account online at
the following link. If we can even get $1 from each person it will
fully pay for the sound permits. 100% of the donations go to the
permits.

As mentioned previously we will also will have a great lineup of DJs
to help keep you enlightened throughout the day as well as public
speakers at the tops of the hour. Public Speakers TBA...

Corner 1: St John (Wild 94.9), Ghost (Ghostribe), Matt Frost, Paul
The Fanman (Audio Metamorphosis), Fury (Audio Metamorphosis), Atom
O.N.E. (National Entity Productions, kdvs 90.3fm, DiverCity Records),
Spective (In The Scene Magazine / Zero Magazine), Wavelength

Corner 2: Joey Mazzola (Soulmatic), Felipe Avelar
(djfelipeavelar.com/bigfloor traxx), Reckless Ryan
(recklessryan.com/BASSLINEfm 90.5 KSJS/Zero Mag) ,Carlos Alfonzo
(BayRaves/Deciblast). The Doctor (BayRaves/Deciblast), Jmarr
(BayRaves), Girle (lovetribe.net/space monkey/ultrasounz), James Dub
(BayRaves/Space Monkey). Doza (The Bounce)

Corner 3: Frank Nitty (Ghostribe), Tronic (Resistance Recordings, Liquid
Vinyl DJs, CHR Spain), Valerie Sparks (Resistance Recordings) Dragn'fly
(shaolin/lovetribe), Elz (Sister SF, DJElz.com), OrionZ, DJ TriXXX
(www.a10pro.com), Ryan Thomas (www.a10pro.com) Resistance
(www.a10pro.com/www.djresistance.com) Corner 4: Ron Reeser DJs for corner
4 will be up shortly. Where: San Francisco Civic Center Courtyard - FULLY
PERMITTED! Noon - 8pm

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D712

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** Max Graham @ Ten 15 Folsom **

Euphoria Dreams & Spundae Presents: Origin @ Ten 15 Folsom
Mainroom: Spundae Presents: Max Graham with opening set by Gianni
Bassment: Dead Dan Ismael Rodriguez Cyber Joe
VIP Lounge: Eladio Raoul Kahn Atimatik
Frontroom: Rafeal Fiero

In 2001, as Kinetic records announced they chose the relatively unknown
Max Graham to mix the fourth installment of the Transport mix CD, the
music industry listened.  That year saw Max hit #23 in the coveted DJ
Magazine Top 100 - the highest new entry. While Nick Warren proclaimed Max
was going to be a worldwide success after hearing just a taste of his
production work, Paul Oakenfold himself called and invited the artist to
join him on tour dates through the US to Ibiza after hearing him play just
once. Location: 1015 Folsom St., San Francisco Doors: 10pm-6am, 21+ w/ID
only Cover: $20 door/$15 presale Info: www.euphoriadreams.com;
415.431.1200

Sunday, August 17, 2003 ** Progression **

As unique as the progressive genre itself, enuriye productions
launches 'Progression'. This is an exclusive Sunday experience that
will entail some serious tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks
at one of the best, most intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.

This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory
experience built around sound and dance. We are putting out a call
for the masses to join our party, a temporal community where an
attitude of acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the
beginning of our underground movement, with its roots founded on
electronic music and our personal desire to expose it to everyone.

Join our family and experience what an awesome year it has been musically
for our DJ^=D2s of this up-and-coming progressive collective. Every 3rd
Sunday 26 Mix 3024 Mission St. San Francisco Ca. 94117 info:
enuriye@hotmail.com jack@jacktriumph.com 925-577-4311 510-697-7790. with
DJ's DJ Jack Triumph (enuriye, KZSU Radio, Frisky Radio, Qo=F6l DJ Mike War=
d
(enuriye, BoardStock, Paragon Lounge).

Sunday, August 31, 2003 ** RCP West presents Free Day Party **

Felipe Avelar - DJ Frequency - Captain Nemo - DJ Molly Mush; More
performers expected, so check our webpage for updates!  This event
for all ages will last from 10 AM till Dusk at a Santa Clara Count
park with plenty of shade to help keep everybody cool. No concessions
will be sold at this party, so everybody is encouraged to bring their
food and drink, although there will be grills onsite for those that
want to BBQ--make sure to bring the charcoal and burgers! RCP West is
also collecting school supplies and new or used school age clothing
(in good condition) to benefit those in need as school nears. We feel
that this is a small but important gesture that we can make to help
insure that the children in this area have what they need to go to
school this year with confidence.

-------------------------------------------------
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

SFRaves serves the greater SF Bay Area, but reaches
beyond the local scene to all corners of the Terra Firma -
thanks to everyone whose support of and contribution to
the SFRAVES.org community - locally --> to both poles
---> to all points along the equator ---> as well as each
longitude and latitude perspective that makes this beautiful
place we know as Earth our home.

Please notify me regarding new events, event changes,
deprecated event information, or any other information
pertaining to events in the greater SF Bay Area and beyond.

I look forward to hearing from you @ karina@hyperreal.org

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

Faithfully yours,
-- Karina --
karina@hyperreal.org



---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

SFR PDA Calendar has been updated,
The SFR PDA Calendar is an Avant Go Channel that allows you to view the
SFR Calendar from your PDA device, Cell Phone or other device running the
Palm Operating System. This service is free and an added extension of the
SFR Calendar interface.

To add the SFR PDA calendar to your device, please create an AVANT GO
account and install the software on your device. To use the calendar, An
account is required to access AvantGo content on your handheld. If you
don't have an account, you can get one for free - go here:
https://my.avantgo.com/register/.

To ADD THE SFR PDA CALENDAR to your device:
http://avantgo.com/mydevice/autoadd.html?title=SFRaves.org%20Calendar&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sfraves.org%2Fcalendar%2Fsfrcalpda.txt&max=175&depth=0&images=0&links=0&refresh=always&hours=2&dflags=127&hour=0&quarter=00&s=00

Subject: [sfraves] .: Dirtbox Radio 8/10/03 : Kind Bass Inc : Shilow : Dirtbox Kru :.

boom chop boom ikita boom boom chop!

that's right.  y'all know what i'm talkin about.  tonight Dirtbox Radio
will be playin drum 'n' bass for all y'all punters and crazy junglists out
there.  you know how we do.  the Kind Bass Inc. crew will be taking over
the decks for the larger portion of the show, doin what they do best,
along wif an appearance by the veritable Shilow, who's been known to rock
decks like a bastard on crack.

check out the timeslots, just in case ya need that ishnishlle:

KBI Takeover:
07-08pm EST - Whighzeguy [liquid funk]
08-09pm EST - Miguel B (aka Mig-28) [liquid funk]
09-10pm EST - Bassmachine [hard dnb shiz]
10-11pm EST - illEffect [varied dnb wif some turntablism]
11-12pm EST - Direct Logic [hip-hop flavored dnb, and most likely a run of
breaks]

Dirtbox Afterhours:
12-01:30am EST - Shilow [dark, nasty dnb]
01:30-??am EST - ODJ, Jerel, and whomever else is here [variety of dnb,
with lots of nasty shizzle]

To tune in, go to http://dirtboxradio.com/listen.html, or click on one of
the links below:
64k mp3 - http://jungletrain.net/64kbps.pls
24k mp3 - http://jungletrain.net/24kbps.pls
webcam [10 sec refresh w/ a new angle] -
http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html
the world famous jungletrain chat - http://www.jungletrain.net/chat.htm

it's gonna be a good time, with some great music, so y'all tune in now, ya
hear!

if you'd like to play on Dirtbox Radio, or have us air your mix (for the
outta town cats), hit us up at bookme@dirtboxradio.com.  Send us a CD,
mp3, DVD, MD, tape, or real media link.  Don't matter, as long as it's
good:)

For up-to-date info, calendar of events, and those archive things, hit up
the site at http://dirtboxradio.com.  it's allllll there y'all.

See y'all tonight, goddammit!

Respect to the Real,
Jackson (odj)
[Partners in Crime, Dirtbox Radio, Trividual Productions, ALIAS]

Subject: [sfraves] [BSP] Estuary :: Mon Aug 11 :: Apollo (Moksha Tribe)

DON'T FORGET...

Estuary :: Open Deck Weekly 

Monday August 11, 2003
9:00 pm - 2:00 am 
Masse's Nightclub :: 21+ w/ID, Free
Featured Guest :: Apollo (Moksha Tribe)

Estuary :: (Noun) 1. Where the river blends with the sea. 
2. A place where all styles mix.

We've decided to change the format of the night. Now it's...

In the back room we have "first come first served" open deck slots. 

In the main room signups will be for the following week. At 10pm you
can put 
your name on the list of djs who want to spin the following week and we
will 
set the lineup. This allows for several things: 

1) We can group the genres together, which is more pleasing for the
audience than radically changing styles every 1/2 hour.

2) Starting the signups at 10pm gives you more time to get there,
especially 
for those coming from places like San Francisco and Marin County.

3) You will have a whole week to tell your friends exactly what time
you will 
be spinning, so that they can come and support you.

If you have no skills at all, but have some cool tracks that you'd like
to 
share, you are just as welcome as anyone else! 

* Please bring needles and headphones. If you don't have your own, find
a friend to share with! * 

This week's line-up:
9:00pm :: Steve Miguel (Hip Hop)
9:30pm :: Lewt (Jungle)
10:00pm :: Deveourn (Trance)
10:30pm :: Bert (Prog/Trance)
11:00pm :: DJMock (House)

Featured Guest:
11:30pm :: Apollo (Funky House)

12:30am :: DJ JacobB (Hard House)
1:00am- 2:00am :: Micah & Jagged Mettal O (Industrial Tag Team)

Added bonuses:
$2 STRONG Islands
FREE pool tables
Outdoor smoking patio
NO COVER CHARGE!!! WOOHOO!!
21+ up w/ ID, please

Masse's Nightclub
6180 Stoneridge Mall Drive 
Pleasanton, CA 
(650) 463-8181

Meteor Shower Approaching

Get your "Night Vision" ready!


  <http://www.borealis2000.com>

To see a star map and to learn more about Perseid meteor shower, check out 
http://science.nasa.gov/headlines/y2003/17jul_perseids2003.htm?list800083.

To see a gallery/slideshow of last year's Perseid meteor shower created by 
Dirk Obudzinski, link to 
<http://borealis2000.com/Perseid/pagesmap/Perseid10.htm>

For another perspective and clear viewing advice, go to:
<http://www.space-explorers.com/announce/perseid_pg2.php>

I'm thinking that, let's say Bush and the Republicans get their way about preventing gay "marriage" for religious reasons... but the discourse opens eyes to the sensibility of gay civil unions, which should logically be permitted under the 14th Amendment of the Constitution. That would be a big step, to get civil unions legalized. 
With social progress, it's great to make huge leaps, but the small steps add up, too. For example, not many years ago it was illegal in some parts of the US for different races to mix ("miscegenation") and now it's accepted (although with some sad pockets of resistance). 

:) 
John in Berkeley

all marriages should be considered a function of religion, not of =
government.

its jurisdiction." -Thomas Jefferson

I'd like to see California be the first state to pass a law disavowing =

example, a "Child and Spouse Responsibility" law; a law that would =
include the subset of current "Marriage" laws related to rights of =
Spouse' and Child Custodians and new rules that govern the ability of =
citizens to assign and revoke those rights to others.
