I agree with your idea, but not your words - the whole problem hinges on 
the actual word marriage - in many religions, marriage is the religious 
sacrament that's holy and designed to propagate - a test which homosexual 
unions naturally (but not necessarily socially) fail.  We should take the 
term "marriage" out of law completely, secularize unions, and make them 
open to any combination.


sarilion

Subject: [sfraves] Highest Entropy Beats:  MIT

--=====================_14756507==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Highest Entropy Beats

By Chris Blohm on August 8, 2003 01:59 PM

Who has enough time in the day to listen to all radio stations? MIT has set
up banks of computers to do the listening for us. They know what you really
want to hear. Eigenradio plays only the most important frequencies, only the
beats with the highest entropy.

If you took a bunch of music and asked it, "Music, what are you, really?"
you'd hear Eigenradio singing back at you. When you're tuned in to
Eigenradio, you always know that you're hearing the latest, rawest, most
statistically separable thing you can possibly put in your ear.

Eigenradio makes its optimal music by analyzing in real time dozens of radio
stations at once. When our bank of computers has heard enough music, it will
go to work on making more just like it. Since we listen to so much music all
the time, Eigenradio is always on and always live. What you hear on
Eigenradio is the best of the New Music, distilled and de-correlated. One
song on Eigenradio is worth at least twenty songs on old radio.

Visit the site to tune in at: http://eigenradio.media.mit.edu/



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

At 06:59 PM 8/11/2003, Apollo wrote:

>Highest Entropy Beats
>
>By Chris Blohm on August 8, 2003 01:59 PM
>
>Who has enough time in the day to listen to all radio stations? MIT has set
>up banks of computers to do the listening for us. They know what you really
>want to hear. Eigenradio plays only the most important frequencies, only the
>beats with the highest entropy.
>
>If you took a bunch of music and asked it, "Music, what are you, really?"
>you'd hear Eigenradio singing back at you. When you're tuned in to
>Eigenradio, you always know that you're hearing the latest, rawest, most
>statistically separable thing you can possibly put in your ear.
>
>Eigenradio makes its optimal music by analyzing in real time dozens of radio
>stations at once. When our bank of computers has heard enough music, it will
>go to work on making more just like it. Since we listen to so much music all
>the time, Eigenradio is always on and always live. What you hear on
>Eigenradio is the best of the New Music, distilled and de-correlated. One
>song on Eigenradio is worth at least twenty songs on old radio.
>
>Visit the site to tune in at: http://eigenradio.media.mit.edu/
>
>
>
>Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net
>
>House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

From: gregvp@comcast.net
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Date: Tue, 12 Aug 2003 04:35:47 +0000
X-Mailer: AT&T Message Center Version 1 (Jul 22 2003)
X-Authenticated-Sender: Z3JlZ3ZwQGNvbWNhc3QubmV0
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Review: SCORE (gay rave at sex club; wordy but interesting) DELETE if offended

Hmmm, all of you party people out there who are open-minded and like debauchery,
I checked out this monthly party at Club 220 in the trendyloin this weekend.

I have been to this spot before and liked the no-holds barred attitude,
something that appeals to me due to a repressed childhood as a preachers kid.
(You might see naughty bits every now and then).

The bouncer was a burly, intimidating fellow who asked me if I was a dancer. At
first I said No because I am not on the staff, but then I said, Yes because
I am a dancing queen.

He asked me what was in my gym bag, which actually contained extra underwear for
changing (they have lockers).  I was also carrying a small flask of Bourbon (Jim
Beam brand) to reduce my uptight tendencies. This was an underwear party and I
was ready to take off my pants, no sex intended. You all know how hot and sweaty
rave dancing can become.

I know some of these people from last year when they were trying to start a rave
event. Terrance, the venue owner, is so nice that he apologized to me for the
increase in nearby parking fees. I said, Hey, this is San Francisco, its lucky
just to have a place to park. Nevertheless, he was genuinely apologetic. This
is the Tenderloin, so they will escort you TO AND FROM your car at the corner
lot. I thought this was a nice touch, kind of like the way the way to treat a
lady, LOL.

Markie, one of the staff dancers, is a well-endowed, slim young guy with
bleach-blonde hair and a sweet personality. The older men really like his style
(its an oral attraction). Once, he told me that I was shy, which is genuine
when see someone that you like and everything is exposed. 

Markie likes the way that I dance, and he paid me heart-felt compliments that
night regarding my hair (spiked blonde style), trendy glasses (Im blind without
them), and overall appearance. I am slimmer now and it feels good to hear
personal comments from a local porn star. Markie is in some gay porn movies that
you can buy in the Castro.  He has flat abdominal muscles that comprise a
youthful appearance (he is cute).

The advertised headliner for the night was a major gay porn star (Matthew Rush)
from Falcon home video. He exposed everything for the event attendees during a
brief appearance on the stage. Talk about letting it all hang out. That was
quite a show of full frontal nudity (a rarity in the Texas bible belt, my home
state).

Earlier in the evening (if you consider 1 a.m. the evening), I started dancing
in white designer briefs and the blacklight made them look so cool. It was fun
to shake around the floor to the fluffy trance music. 

After a while, I switched to JOE BOXERs that glow in the dark with a happy,
smiley face. That was also an attention getter. I met an Asian TV (transvestive)
who flashed me, tried some frottage, and asked me if I liked her nipples. She
dragged me into a nearby video booth, but crotch rubbing with a TV is not a
turn-on for me. I dashed back to the dance floor, and she said, Come back when
you are hard.  The funny thing is that she followed me upstairs because when I
was dancing HARDer, I saw her sitting nearby, watching intently.

I also met a French guy who was really into ear lobes. Guess everyone has a
different twist on erotica, but it was nice to experience the gentle, masculine,
ear-lobe lick (talk about safe sex.)

These interpersonal reactions occurred downstairs at the sex club. When you get
tired of dancing you can cruise through a sleazy video arcade, stop by a
mini-theater with a big-screen TV playing gay porn, or surf the net
(uncensored) in a computer lounge. 

Yes indeed, the basement has gay sex club action and upstairs has
state-of-the-art sound systems and lighting for raving. Terrance spent some
money on upgrades here. Club 220 is a fun place to dance or score, as they
call it.

Greg VP

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] [Politics] Take an active part - CA voter info (long)

This was all planned back in 2001:
==================================
Aug. 11, 2003  |  Arnold's secret meeting with Kenny Boy

If you're compiling a list of public figures even less popular in 
California than Gray Davis, one name is likely to top it: former Enron 
chairman Kenneth "Kenny Boy" Lay. Voters in the Golden State are 
behaving like sheep these days, but even the dimmest of them can 
probably remember how Enron and the other corporate vultures descended 
on them during the electricity "crisis" of 2001.

What California voters may no longer remember, however, is that after 
the third wave of rolling blackouts hit their state, Kenny Boy quietly 
summoned a select group to the Beverly Hills Hotel on May 11, 2001. And 
they may also have forgotten that one of the prominent Republicans who 
showed up at Lay's request was Arnold Schwarzenegger.


On June 21, 2001, the Associated Press reported that "Lay met secretly 
with California Republicans at the Beverly Hills Hotel and pushed a plan 
that called for ratepayers to pay the billions in debt racked up by the 
state's public utilities. The plan contended that federal investigations 
of price gouging are hindering the situation." According to William 
Bradley, the L.A. Weekly's sharp political columnist who wrote about 
Enron for the American Prospect, the meeting revolved around Lay's plans 
to "preserve deregulation" in California. The L.A. Times noted that Lay 
was seeking the support of Schwarzenegger and the other GOP luminaries 
for even greater deregulation. Apparently Lay wanted help in saving a 
lousy system, squeezing the unfortunate Californians even more, and 
avoiding accountability for their plight.

Only those who were present -- including then-Mayor Richard Riordan and 
convicted junk-bond fraudster Michael Milken -- know exactly what 
happened at Lay's covert conference. The meeting briefly became an issue 
early in the 2002 governor's race, after Riordan opportunistically 
attacked Davis over the governor's telephone contacts with Lay during 
the crisis. "What is Gray Davis trying to hide?" he demanded. But then, 
instead of answering pointed questions about the Beverly Hills meeting, 
Riordan quickly backed off from the Enron angle.

http://salon.com/opinion/conason/2003/08/11/enron/index.html



Ride the Music

AndyTiedye


---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Special Information About
October 7, 2003
Statewide Special Election

You are welcome to use this web site to request a form to register to =
vote. However, please be advised that it can take up to 10 days to =
receive your computer-generated voter registration card.


Since the last day to register to vote for the October 7th Statewide =
Special Election is September 22nd, we recommend that September 12th, is =
the last date you should use this website to register to vote for the =
October 7th election.


After September 12th, to register to vote for the October 7th election =
you should use the link below to contact your county elections official =
to obtain a voter registration card.

Subject: [sfraves] THRESHOLD was So Dope!

I mean... he even spun this "Salsa" Techno track (yeah... Salsa Techno... LOLOLOLOLMAO)!!  I mean... it was a Mondo Groovy set!! Oh yeah... it was also Groovy hangin' out w/ Tim Xavier 'cause he's so chill man!!!  I mean... he's like Hella funny 2 talk 2 & 1 of my Groovy moments of the night was when HIm & Andy were talkin' about producing tracks & all that producer talk gargin stuff... I Loved It!! Oh Gosh man... I think this was the 1st set of Andy's, in a while, that I didn't see his lap top comp hooked up 2 the decks & he strait spun records... right???  But Fucki'n A man... Andy... you're set totlly gave me goosebumps Dude!

Then Matt Holland went on next... he got in w/ the Techno 4 a while & well... I mean... it was like soooo quick when he did that like switch off I guess... I dunno!!

I didn't get 2 dance as much as I wanted 2 'cause I 4got my earplugs, so to compensate... I would dance in like various parts of all the sets in the back or sometimes like in the front when I could stand it!

Yeah... the vibe was pretty thick!!  I mean... it was a total family affair & it was sooooo Dope seein' every1 who showed up!!!  Hello 2Day...I finally got 2 hang out w/ Jbot 4 more than 5 minutes this time around!!! Oh oh oh... & it was Dope hangin' out w/ Clarity after hella daze!!!

Subject: [sfraves] .: Live Sets from Dirtbox : Kind Bass Inc : PiC :.

Biggidy Boh!

This Sunday's Kind Bass Inc Takeover was another successful night,
featuring many a bad ass tune played by many a bad ass DJ.  Whighzeguy &
Miguel B opened up the night with some liquid funk action, followed by
Bassmachine with some darker tunes, IllEffect went straight for the
jugular with his special brand of turntablism-spiced jungle action, Direct
Logic gave us a special dose of Breaks, and Partners in Crime ODJ,
Hooligan, and Jerel closed the night off with yet another wide variety of
quality drum 'n' bass muzak.

All in all it was a good time, and most worthy of a re-listen (cos y'all
were all tuned in, right?).  Sets are below, in 56k realmedia and 128k mp3
formats.

Whighzeguy:
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-Whighzeguy.ram
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-Whighzeguy.mp3

Miguel B:
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-Miguel_B.ram
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-Miguel_B.mp3

Bassmachine:
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-Basmachine.ram
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-Basmachine.mp3

illEffect:
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-illEffect.ram
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-illEffect.mp3

Direct Logic:
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-Direct_Logic.ram
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030810-KBI_Takeover-Direct_Logic.mp3

PiC [Jerel, Hooligan, and ODJ]:
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/DirtboxRadio-20030810-Afterhours-PiC.ram
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030810-Afterhours-PiC-1of4.mp3
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030810-Afterhours-PiC-2of4.mp3
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030810-Afterhours-PiC-3of4.mp3
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/mp3/DirtboxRadio-20030810-Afterhours-PiC-4of4.mp3

Anywho, hope y'all enjoy the music!

Eazy,
Jackson (ODJ)
Partners in Crime, Dirtbox Radio, Trividual Productions, ALIAS

Subject: [sfraves] (bsp) atten: monterey - santa cruz // this weekends line up

Hello all,

Well,  we just rolled thru another great weekend of music.
First off, last thursday was a night to remember. Being
that nite was only our 2nd c o i n c i d e at this location
it was one of the best to date. The vibe, the great people,
the djs, and the art were more than we figured.

Thanks going out to Mubali, Per ski, Kelau, and Josie
for providing us with the great music and art. Thanks to
all of you that made it out for the first time too.
out.

Our weekends entainment was also wonderful. Much respect
going  out to Kikkoman ( have a safe trip ), Wyze one for dropping
the grooves, and Alex and Reuben for housin us out on sat.

Well the beat must go on! This thursday's coincide will be hosting
djs: Matt Uchida and Ivan + Khambrel showcasing his art pieces.
Come out and support our  local artists!

Friday will be us regulars + Erik B. spinning some house flavor
Saturday will another great lineup with djs:
Drew, Blink, +  Tim Mcknew and Deaks ( cloudfactory)

So roll out for another great weekend of music, under the stars!!!


peace...
scientists of sound

OVERLOAD 3 will be 2 Nights of dancing, camping, great music, good friends, 
and of course that awesome OVERLOAD vibe you've all come to know and love.. 
celebrated under the full moon and stars!

VERY LIMITED $1 Presale Tickets go onsale Thursday, August 14th at the 
following outlets:

SKILLS DJ WORKSHOP-BERKELEY: 510.704.9876
SOLID GROOVES-SANTA CLARA: 408.248.6399
FREQUENCY 8-SAN FRANCISCO: 415.221.4142
STRAIGHT HITS-FREMONT: 510.745.7843

or get 'em ONLINE: http://www.spinfoil.com


We FULLY expect for those $1 Presale Tickets to sell VERY VERY QUICK! Why? 
Well, because tickets for shows like this usually aren't that cheap. So get 
those $1 Presale Tickets QUICK before they sell out!

After those $1 Presale Tickets sell out, we will have more tickets for $5, 
then after those $5 Presale Tickets sell out we'll have $10 Presale Tickets. 
Get your tickets early and save some cash! All prices INCLUDE BOTH NIGHTS of 
the event!! If you make the mistake of not getting a presale ticket.. not to 
worry. We will have door tickets available throughout the weekend for your 
OVERLOAD party needs!

OVERLOAD 3 will be an ALL AGES event, FULLY PERMITTED and Centrally Located 
in Northern California. Be prepared to campout.. bring tents, sleeping bags, 
water guns, water balloons, toilet paper, sunscreen.. anything you might 
need to make yourself feel more comfortable. We will have food and drinks 
being sold on the premesis.. so bring some extra spending cash with you for 
the great food we have to offer!!


Sound of OVERLOAD:

HARDSCIENCE / SWAT SOUND / GRAVITY CREW SOUND


Sights of OVERLOAD:

L7VJ : CONNECTED SYSTEMS // ROCKIN' YOU UNDER THE FULL MOON & STARS!


We are very excited to be bringing this event to you, and we hope you all 
are as excited about it! If you've ever been to any of our other events- 
Happy Together, Happy Together 2, Overload, Overload 2, Summer Rockin, or 
Get Up!.. you know what to expect! Nothing but a great party and a lot of 
fun.. and with this one you get 2 nights!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Cyberfest, no Kraftwerk?

Hi, this has been discussed to death but with many tangents. It sounded to me like Bartos is allowed by the current members of Kraftwerk to perform as "Kraftwerk" -- is that right? Whether this is worth seeing, i don't know. 

Massives and big names ... remember a couple years ago when "Eminem's D12" was supposed to be at Metropolis? Eminem was in D12 but they were also "presented BY" Eminem ... So would we see Eminem or not? As things turned out, D12 got kicked off the tour anyway, just as well. 

I would say, at one of these stadium type massives, don't go because of any one performer. Go for the whole experience, which includes checking out whatever sounds good, wandering around and talking to people, and maybe even missing somebody you intended to hear. 

I got my first Kraftwerk record in 1977! Is that old school or what?   :)
John in Berkeley

holy crap, you mean people still check INVIBE???

you know, i made that site back in 2000 after i got canned from an internet 
startup.  i designed the entire thing and would update it religiously every 
week with events and djs and ad banners and graphics...and i kept that up 
for a good year or so until it just became too much.  i got another job and 
slowly, the updating became less regular to the point where i only added 
photos.

however!  there are plans to relaunch the site with the help of some friends 
so...all i can say is be on the lookout for a new site later this year.

and thanks to anyone who actually used to visit the site.  it was labor of 
love.  peace out.

felt so contrived.  "doing this for the money"-meme

costs for anything there, but something was missing
from the atmosphere - an intimacy, or a closeness. Or
even a connection with the music.  It seemed like an
industry showcase for A&R ppl who really were looking
for product.

that Kraftwerk was on the bill, but I guess not,
thanks for clearing it up!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Re: NRR Go vote!



On Mon, 11 Aug 2003 13:40:58 -0700 kdb@technolounge.org writes:

 "He has my vote.... GOP FOREVER... JESUS SAVES! "
KDB
   
Correl, a gay talk show host on KGO, recently commented on a story about
a Indian man and his wife being held by airport security for unusual
behavior and is suing for the "horror of being contained". 

True, security may have gone a little overboard, but Correl made the
point that as humiliated this man and his wife were, they don't know the
real horror of waking up each day and having your existence being polled.
  
You want to expirence a real horror? Whether I will be able to walk down
a street, even in the liberal bubble of the Bay Area, and not get beat up
today depends on the daily poll. If we can keep general acceptance at
50/50, I have a 50/50 chance I can go through a day  without experiencing
some form of homophobia. If the polls go down against tolerance, life
could become a potential real horror show, nothing like this Indian
couple went through. Gays and lesbians know all too well how this game
works.

I mean, were in the 21st century and you would think that we should, as a
society, be so done with the 19th century over homosexuality and that gay
rights and gay marriages should be so "what ever!" But we do live in a
society still hooked on religion, especially the fundamentalist type, and
naturally that not only explains our appalling ignorance about sex in
general, but why we as Americans can't accept the fact that homosexuality
is a natural phenomenon.

What we could see in the 2004 election, the Republicans running on a
diversion platform of defending traditional marrage and protecting
society from the "scourage of homosexuality". If they ran on their
economic and international record, they'd loose big time, especialy if
the truth about WMD's come out and people are still looking for jobs. But
if you can get people paranoid about homosexuality, people would rather
vote their fears rather than with their heads, and we could see a big
antigay back lash. 

The paranoia propaganda is starting in churches, and soon we will see it
hit society as a whole. Will Americans fall for it? When many Americans
learn about homosexuality from preachers, scandal tabloids, the Jerry
Springer Show and news about priests molesting boys (even though 90% of
child molestations are done by str8 men and in the traditional family
unit), I'm afraid they will. Gays in America are tollerated, not well
liked, and that tollerence, like ganja smoke is, poof... blowing away.
Were not, as a society, even secure about our sexuality, and one moment
so obcessed with it (most addicted to pornography), yet so punitive. You
can get a more draconian prision sentence for giving a 17 year old
consentual head than if you were to sell him crack or kill him. If were,
as a society, are so hypocritical and schizophrenic about straight sex, I
don't think gay society can expect better treatment.

We have remember when Hitler was democraticly elected, there was a open
and out gay scene in Germany at that time. Hitler tollerated it for a few
years, but within one year, gays and lesbians in Germany were suddenly
yanked from their gay clubs, beaches and bars, put in box cars and sent
off to consentration camps. We don't think it would happen here? The anti
gay propaganda machine is working overtime and I don't think we will know
what will hit us next year. The three big issuses of the Republicans in
2004:
war on terrorism
defending marrage and the family
stoping gay rights

Many Americans look on gays and lesbians as freak shows and people with
an incurable, infectious disease like TB. "We accept that you are gay,
but we have to keep you from infecting others, mostly kids, with
homosexuality". The only reason why Americans nominally accept gays and
lesbians is because we give good entertainment on the Jerry Springer Show
and that we live in sort of a don't ask and don't tell relationship with
society. With all these "victories" with sodomy laws being struck down,
potential legal gay unions and an election of a Episcopal bishop, we have
crossed the line of str8t comfortability and that's when 
the poll numbers will take a nose dive and our "rights" will be taken
away. We really don't have rights in America, but privileges, and because
were not playing by the rules and asking for too much, our privileges
will be taken away. Do you think gays and lesbians will fight back? They
didn't in Hitler's Germany, why will they here?

I said before that America will become the Nazi Germany of the 21st
century, and we're well on our way.
Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^

Subject: Re: [sfraves] flash raves?

Logistically, the tricky part is a sound system.

So it'd make sense for someone to bring an iPod or something with a 
short mix pre-loaded onto it, attach one of those low-range FM 
transmitters, and pump out the music from several battery-powered 
boomboxes clustered together in close proximity to the 'pod.  Several 
people can carry the boomboxes and converge onto the center and then 
take them with them when they disperse, ensuring that no one has to 
conspicuously show up with a shopping cart with a car battery and 
speakers hanging off of it.. :)

                      08/12/2003 08:42                                                                     
                      PM                                                                                   
                                                                                                           
                                                                                                           




Logistically, the tricky part is a sound system.

So it'd make sense for someone to bring an iPod or something with a
short mix pre-loaded onto it, attach one of those low-range FM
transmitters, and pump out the music from several battery-powered
boomboxes clustered together in close proximity to the 'pod.  Several
people can carry the boomboxes and converge onto the center and then
take them with them when they disperse, ensuring that no one has to
conspicuously show up with a shopping cart with a car battery and
speakers hanging off of it.. :)

  - o

Autos...perhaps...depending on what you want to accomplish.  Leap into 
Market Street, have the cars block traffic, and so on.  Risky for the 
people with the cars.

A friend of mine recently joined some folks who went to a shopping mall 
and, at a pre-arranged time, dropped quarters on the floor and moved 
on.  Mind bending.  Fair number of these events happening lately.

There are any number of decent portable sound systems that could be used 
for a flash rave, including backpacks with integrated audio.

Love,

Apollo

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

 Arianna Huffington is coming to town, so here's our chance

>From her e-mail:
Arianna Huffington is coming to the Bay Area tomorrow,
as she continues her inspiring campaign to become the
first independent, progressive and female governor of
the state of California. Tomorrow is her Bay Area debut.
And it is your first chance in the Bay Area to show your
support for Arianna in a public way! Plus, you have a
chance tomorrow to stand - alongside her - with Oakland's
youth who are fighting for their rights! 

We hope that you will come out. Arianna is the only prominent
candidate raising the need for: comprehensive campaign
finance reform, protecting and restoring the environment,
taxing the corporations and investing in schools (not
jails). She deserves your support. 

This will be a VERY short campaign. Every opportunity
to show your support will make a BIG difference in the
media and in Arianna's heart. So please, please come out!

Here's Arianna's schdule.  

WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 13 (TOMORROW!!!) 

Oakland "Kids First" Rally  
Noon - 1 pm  
Oakland Tech High School, 4351 Broadway (at 45th Street)
 
Due to state budget cuts, "free bus passes" for Oakland
kids have been eliminated from the budget. Now Oakland's
low-income youth will have to pay to get to and from school,
everyday - forcing many to drop out. Oakland's youth,
led by Kids First and Youth Together, are protesting this
awful decision - which amounts to a big tax on poor kids.
Meanwhile, California's corporations aren't paying anywhere
NEAR their fair share during this crisis. Arianna will
be at the youth rally to ask, "How can we be giving a
free ride to corporations in this crisis, when we can't
even give our kids a free ride to school?" Please come
out to show your enthusiasm for Arianna's campaign - and
to show your support for Oakland's youth. 

San Francisco Pep Rally for Arianna  
4 - 4:30 pm  
16th & Mission Street  
WE REALLY NEED YOU TO COME OUT FOR THIS! AND PLEASE BRING
YOUR FRIENDS! We are encouraging you to forward this announcement
widely. We will be conducting a short pep rally for Arianna,
encouraging her to keep fighting and speaking out for
what she believes in. (We want to surprise her with a
big turn-out, just to keep her inspired in between those
tough, grueling media interviews). We will ask her to
address the crowd briefly, and then we will turn the mike
over to her supporters. We want Arianna to know that people
in the Bay Area deeply admire her - and that we admire
the guts that she has shown by jumping into this race.
Also, there will be a LOT of media there, so it is our
first chance to let the WHOLE WORLD know that progressives
and independents are excited about Arianna and the issues
she is raising in this campaign. Please come! 

THURSDAY, AUGUST 14  
First Volunteers Meeting  
7 - 9 pm  
In SF, location TBA  
This will be your first opportunity to meet all the other
Arianna supporters in an official way, and to get plugged
into the campaign. You will be able to join committees,
get your questions answered and take on work assignments.
(We are still looking for a site, and will let you know
tomorrow where it will be.) It is very important for you
to come, and to bring your friends to the meeting. We
have a short period of time to elect Arianna. Let's make
it happen! 

If you can, please support Arianna's campaign by making
a donation at http://www.ariannaforgov.com/donate.html

For more information, check out the NEWLY RELAUNCHED website
at http://www.AriannaForGov.com (it's HOT!!!). Or you
can call 415.596.2695. 

-------------------------------------------------- 

Helping Arianna reach your friends is easy! Use this page
to tell them Arianna is coming to town. 

http://ga3.org/join-forward.html?domain=truthinvictory&r=2pzMB561huDv

If you received this message from a friend, you can sign
up for AriannaForGov.com at: 

http://ga3.org/truthinvictory/join.html?r=2pzMB561huDvE 

-------------------------------------------------- 

If you would like to unsubscribe from AriannaForGov.com,
you can respond to this email with "REMOVE" as the 
subject, or you can visit your subscription management
page at:  
http://ga3.org/truthinvictory/smp.tcl?nkey=xbkddgrl7838iw

Member Relationship Management Solutions 
That Recruit, Engage, and Retain (tm) 
http://www.getactive.com

> candidate raising the need for: comprehensive campaign
> finance reform, protecting and restoring the environment,

> low-income youth will have to pay to get to and from school,
> everyday - forcing many to drop out. Oakland's youth,
> led by Kids First and Youth Together, are protesting this
> awful decision - which amounts to a big tax on poor kids.

You know, the entire time I was reading your post, I was thinking not of what
SCORE might have been like.  I was having flashbacks to that one time, as that
last Happy Kids party at Army and Co. was getting busted, that Justin (aka. JJ)
sent a huge pack of candy ravers over to 220, saying that there was an
afterparty there.

Now *THAT* is a clash of cultures that makes me wish that there were pictures
on one of the rave pictures websites.  Hell, I almost wish I had gone myself. 
But a friend of mine was in no shape to drive, and Marty was kind enough to let
us stay and "help clean up".  And besides, Marty just got the party started
again right there at Army and Co., anyway.

Ah... fun times.

-----Original Message-----
From: max phillips [mailto:teknobuddha@juno.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, August 12, 2003 7:22 PM
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: RE: [sfraves] flash raves?

 Arianna Huffington is coming to town, so here's our chance

>From her e-mail:
Arianna Huffington is coming to the Bay Area tomorrow,
as she continues her inspiring campaign to become the
first independent, progressive and female governor of
the state of California. Tomorrow is her Bay Area debut.
And it is your first chance in the Bay Area to show your
support for Arianna in a public way! Plus, you have a
chance tomorrow to stand - alongside her - with Oakland's
youth who are fighting for their rights! 

We hope that you will come out. Arianna is the only prominent
candidate raising the need for: comprehensive campaign
finance reform, protecting and restoring the environment,
taxing the corporations and investing in schools (not
jails). She deserves your support. 

This will be a VERY short campaign. Every opportunity
to show your support will make a BIG difference in the
media and in Arianna's heart. So please, please come out!

Here's Arianna's schdule.  

WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 13 (TOMORROW!!!) 

Oakland "Kids First" Rally  
Noon - 1 pm  
Oakland Tech High School, 4351 Broadway (at 45th Street)
 
Due to state budget cuts, "free bus passes" for Oakland
kids have been eliminated from the budget. Now Oakland's
low-income youth will have to pay to get to and from school,
everyday - forcing many to drop out. Oakland's youth,
led by Kids First and Youth Together, are protesting this
awful decision - which amounts to a big tax on poor kids.
Meanwhile, California's corporations aren't paying anywhere
NEAR their fair share during this crisis. Arianna will
be at the youth rally to ask, "How can we be giving a
free ride to corporations in this crisis, when we can't
even give our kids a free ride to school?" Please come
out to show your enthusiasm for Arianna's campaign - and
to show your support for Oakland's youth. 

San Francisco Pep Rally for Arianna  
4 - 4:30 pm  
16th & Mission Street  
WE REALLY NEED YOU TO COME OUT FOR THIS! AND PLEASE BRING
YOUR FRIENDS! We are encouraging you to forward this announcement
widely. We will be conducting a short pep rally for Arianna,
encouraging her to keep fighting and speaking out for
what she believes in. (We want to surprise her with a
big turn-out, just to keep her inspired in between those
tough, grueling media interviews). We will ask her to
address the crowd briefly, and then we will turn the mike
over to her supporters. We want Arianna to know that people
in the Bay Area deeply admire her - and that we admire
the guts that she has shown by jumping into this race.
Also, there will be a LOT of media there, so it is our
first chance to let the WHOLE WORLD know that progressives
and independents are excited about Arianna and the issues
she is raising in this campaign. Please come! 

THURSDAY, AUGUST 14  
First Volunteers Meeting  
7 - 9 pm  
In SF, location TBA  
This will be your first opportunity to meet all the other
Arianna supporters in an official way, and to get plugged
into the campaign. You will be able to join committees,
get your questions answered and take on work assignments.
(We are still looking for a site, and will let you know
tomorrow where it will be.) It is very important for you
to come, and to bring your friends to the meeting. We
have a short period of time to elect Arianna. Let's make
it happen! 

If you can, please support Arianna's campaign by making
a donation at http://www.ariannaforgov.com/donate.html

For more information, check out the NEWLY RELAUNCHED website
at http://www.AriannaForGov.com (it's HOT!!!). Or you
can call 415.596.2695. 

-------------------------------------------------- 

Helping Arianna reach your friends is easy! Use this page
to tell them Arianna is coming to town. 

http://ga3.org/join-forward.html?domain=truthinvictory&r=2pzMB561huDv

If you received this message from a friend, you can sign
up for AriannaForGov.com at: 

http://ga3.org/truthinvictory/join.html?r=2pzMB561huDvE

-----Original Message-----
From: max phillips [mailto:teknobuddha@juno.com]
Sent: Tuesday, August 12, 2003 7:22 PM
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: RE: [sfraves] flash raves?

 Arianna Huffington is coming to town, so here's our chance

>From her e-mail:
Arianna Huffington is coming to the Bay Area tomorrow,
as she continues her inspiring campaign to become the
first independent, progressive and female governor of
the state of California. Tomorrow is her Bay Area debut.
And it is your first chance in the Bay Area to show your
support for Arianna in a public way! Plus, you have a
chance tomorrow to stand - alongside her - with Oakland's
youth who are fighting for their rights!

We hope that you will come out. Arianna is the only prominent
candidate raising the need for: comprehensive campaign
finance reform, protecting and restoring the environment,
taxing the corporations and investing in schools (not
jails). She deserves your support.

This will be a VERY short campaign. Every opportunity
to show your support will make a BIG difference in the
media and in Arianna's heart. So please, please come out!

Here's Arianna's schdule.

WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 13 (TOMORROW!!!)

Oakland "Kids First" Rally
Noon - 1 pm
Oakland Tech High School, 4351 Broadway (at 45th Street)

Due to state budget cuts, "free bus passes" for Oakland
kids have been eliminated from the budget. Now Oakland's
low-income youth will have to pay to get to and from school,
everyday - forcing many to drop out. Oakland's youth,
led by Kids First and Youth Together, are protesting this
awful decision - which amounts to a big tax on poor kids.
Meanwhile, California's corporations aren't paying anywhere
NEAR their fair share during this crisis. Arianna will
be at the youth rally to ask, "How can we be giving a
free ride to corporations in this crisis, when we can't
even give our kids a free ride to school?" Please come
out to show your enthusiasm for Arianna's campaign - and
to show your support for Oakland's youth.

San Francisco Pep Rally for Arianna
4 - 4:30 pm
16th & Mission Street
WE REALLY NEED YOU TO COME OUT FOR THIS! AND PLEASE BRING
YOUR FRIENDS! We are encouraging you to forward this announcement
widely. We will be conducting a short pep rally for Arianna,
encouraging her to keep fighting and speaking out for
what she believes in. (We want to surprise her with a
big turn-out, just to keep her inspired in between those
tough, grueling media interviews). We will ask her to
address the crowd briefly, and then we will turn the mike
over to her supporters. We want Arianna to know that people
in the Bay Area deeply admire her - and that we admire
the guts that she has shown by jumping into this race.
Also, there will be a LOT of media there, so it is our
first chance to let the WHOLE WORLD know that progressives
and independents are excited about Arianna and the issues
she is raising in this campaign. Please come!

THURSDAY, AUGUST 14
First Volunteers Meeting
7 - 9 pm
In SF, location TBA
This will be your first opportunity to meet all the other
Arianna supporters in an official way, and to get plugged
into the campaign. You will be able to join committees,
get your questions answered and take on work assignments.
(We are still looking for a site, and will let you know
tomorrow where it will be.) It is very important for you
to come, and to bring your friends to the meeting. We
have a short period of time to elect Arianna. Let's make
it happen!

If you can, please support Arianna's campaign by making
a donation at http://www.ariannaforgov.com/donate.html

For more information, check out the NEWLY RELAUNCHED website
at http://www.AriannaForGov.com (it's HOT!!!). Or you
can call 415.596.2695.

--------------------------------------------------

to tell them Arianna is coming to town.

http://ga3.org/join-forward.html?domain=truthinvictory&r=2pzMB561huDv

If you received this message from a friend, you can sign
up for AriannaForGov.com at:

http://ga3.org/truthinvictory/join.html?r=2pzMB561huDvE

> >
> > Due to state budget cuts, "free bus passes" for Oakland
> > kids have been eliminated from the budget. Now Oakland's
> > low-income youth will have to pay to get to and from school,
> > everyday - forcing many to drop out. Oakland's youth,
> > led by Kids First and Youth Together, are protesting this
> > awful decision - which amounts to a big tax on poor kids.
> > Meanwhile, California's corporations aren't paying anywhere
> > NEAR their fair share during this crisis. Arianna will

> > free ride to corporations in this crisis, when we can't
> > even give our kids a free ride to school?" Please come

> > over to her supporters. We want Arianna to know that people
> > in the Bay Area deeply admire her - and that we admire

	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hardcore for the People and Hardscience are proud to invite you to our 1 =
year aniv party. One year ago we started this crew with the intention of =
helping a few of our friends get some more bookings. Well you all know =
what it has turned into! So come out and help us kick of year number two =
for $8 bucks. We will have plenty of more surprises in store for this =
event so stay tuned. Thanks for helping make this past year just =
absolutely amazing!!=20

Cloudskipper (Liquidvinyldjs/Raw Elements)=20
Since his return to the bay area Cloudskipper has been delighting crowds =
every weekend with his hardbeats and clean mixing. Expect nothing but =
the newest most upfront hardcore.=20

Tronic (Resistance Recordings, liquidvinyldjs)=20
The bay areas very own US Hardhouse master mind will be dropping some of =
the hardest hitting shit your ears have heard. Get ready to rock when =
Tronic hits the decks!=20

Michael Liu (Illumination Records)=20
The psy-trance master is back once again to show the bay why he is Ca #1 =
psy-trance dj. Michael will be in full effect with some of the best psy =
you will ever here. Expect nothing more than a heard pounding, earth =
shaking mind blowing set.=20

MollyMush (Hardcore For The People)=20
Our very own Molly has been moving dance floors every weekend and =
earning quite a name for her self. Her unique blend of hardcore flavor =
will have the crowd pumped and dancing from begening to end of her set.=20

Leon Cook Vs Peter Go-Zania (HardScience/HCFTP)=20
The bald one and dumbo are going to have you rocking hard with a new =
style hardcore set. So get ready for the pit when these fools step up to =
the deck. This shit is gona get hard real quick!!=20

The Doctor vs Yagi (BayRaves, DeciBlast / HCFTP)=20
The Doctor has been building quite a name for himself over the past year =
and is ready to get this crowd moving. Expect nothing more than the best =
jungle has to offer when yagi and the doctor step up to the plate and =
crush the one out of the park.=20

Paul Riley vs DvS Clevvy (core:NRG,DvS, HCFTP/ DvS Minds)=20
The two dvs ones are coming out ready to rock you. Get ready to dance =
when these two drop one of the most energetic sets of the night.=20


Safe and Secure Bay Area Location with a ZERO DRUG TOLERANCE!=20
ALL AGES!=20
$8 PRESALES / $10 @ the DOOR=20

Nick
-http://www.hardcoreforthepeople.com
We're hardcore so you don't have to be!

----- Original Message -----
From: <legba@roargroup.org>
To: <ElectroFunk138@hotmail.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 13, 2003 12:07 PM
Subject: FIGHT ANTI-MUSIC LAWS::NATIONAL PROTEST/PARTY 9/6/03


>
> ROAR!
> THE NATIONAL DANCE AND MUSIC RIGHTS ALLIANCE
> WWW.ROARGROUP.ORG
>
> ::POWER TO THE PEOPLE WHO PARTY::
>
> SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 6, 2003
> NOON TO MIDNIGHT
> DEMONSTRATION AT THE US CAPITOL
> AGAINST ANTI-MUSIC LAWS
>
> THE RAVE ACT HAS PASSED!
>
> Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean everyone's not out to get you.
>
> It's been a crazy couple of years for the Electronic Dance Music scene. On
top
> of the last decade of being targeted with raids, arrests, harassment,
> intimidation and smear campaigns, last summer saw the introduction of the
now-
> infamous RAVE Act. Passed in the spring, the law can fine promoters,
managers,
> or employees up to $500,000 and/or imprison them for 20 years for holding
an
> event where even a single person is arrested for narcotics--potentially
> shutting down events everywhere. This year, we are facing the CLEAN-UP Act
and
> the Ecstasy Awareness Act, both of which would impose far harsher
penalties.
>
> Last summer, well over a thousans descended US Capitol for ROAR! and
America's
> first ever party-as-protest. Other events have popped up in cities all
over the
> country--Seattle, NYC, LA, SF, Austin, Albequerque to name a few--marking
the
> start of an entire movement and bringing a whole generation to power.
>
> This summer join ROAR! and let's bring thousands to the US Capitol for a
free
> outdoor festival and protest against the continuing assault on music,
dancing
> and civil liberties. We will display the force and unity of our culture
through
> performances by international headlining talent, speakers from major
industry
> groups and politically influential organizations.
>
>
> EVENT INFORMATION
>
> UPPER SENATE PARK, US CAPITOL, WASHINGTON, DC
> Constitution Ave between New Jersey NW and Delaware Ave NE
>
> METRO ACCESSIBLE, 2 BLOCKS FROM UNION STATION. FOR BUS OR OTHER TRAVEL
INFO
> PLEASE EMAIL OR CALL!!
>
> For detailed directions and lineup times, please visit our website.
>
> www.roargroup.org :: info@roargroup.org :: (202) 546-2128 ext. 1
>
> ARRIVE EARLY!
>
> Junior Vasquez - Junior Vasquez Music - NYC
> SPINNING AT 6PM
>
> Craze - Six Time World Champion DMC//The Allies//Cartel - Miami
> D:FUSE - People:2 (2xCD) Out on System Recordings Now!
> Polywog - Just Say Agency//The Movie//SisterSF - SF *FIRST DC APPEARANCE*
> Jesse Saunders - King Street//Broken Records, Sony Music - Chicago, LA
> Reid Speed - Breakbeat Science//Direct Drive//NYC 2 Step - LA
> Huda Hudia - Kaleidoscope - FL
> The Zelch Brothers - Twin Prod.//Fused//412groove.com - Pittsburgh
> Apple - Odds and Ends//Lowdown//Natural Selection - DC
> Proxxy - Instinctive Grooves - MD
>
> WITH A SPECIAL CLOSING SET BY
> Scott Henry - Ultra Records//Buzzlife - DC
>
> INVITED SPEAKERS - SPEAKERS ON AT 5PM:
> Douglas Rushkoff - author of "Ecstasy Club", New York University
> Graham Boyd - American Civil Liberties Union
> Ira Glasser - Drug Policy Alliance
> Eric Silver - System Recordings
> Shawn Heller - Students for a Sensible Drug Policy
> Sam "The Man" Burns - Red//DJ Hut, DC House Legend
> Legba Carrefour - ROAR!

----- Original Message -----
From: "Niels P. Mayer" <npm@mail.netwiz.net>
To: "sfraves" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Thursday, July 31, 2003 1:29 PM
Subject: [sfraves] seb fontaine at sno drift last night


> Seb Fontaine played an amazing set last night at Sno Drift. Totally unlike
> what I expected to hear him play. The vibe was, well, usual for Sno Drift.
> Nothing worth writing about. Fortunately, every once in a while they get a
DJ
> that really knows how to work it. Last night, IMHO, was such a night.
>
> I expected trancier pop mainstreamy stuff with some good crowd-working
> going on, inna UK style. But instead he played some pretty heady, groovy,
> dubby tribal stuff that was still hard as nails. It was cool. You could
> bug-out to it. It was less dark than, say, a Danny Tenaglia set, but kinda
in
> the same vein of being deeply embedded in a humid, sexy jungle of beats,
with
> occasional wafts of cool dub-fog to help  that last little bead of sweat
on
> your forehead to not eruct all over the dancefloor.
>
> Anybody got the proper term for the style he was playing last night? Was
> it just "i'm going to play a bunch of underground shit for all the heads
> in SF?"
>
> Anybody got a DAT or some MP3s online of his set??
>
>

in
> |celebration of Mason from Thump Radio's birthday!

right wing PC, she is automatically called something like a "hippie
feminist bitch" or "whore" or something like that. Deleted dank's
original mail.
 This attitude is what makes me have a (perceived) pessimistic future or
America. Not that I'm actually pessimistic but being real. 
It's not about disagreeing anymore, it's about Ann Coulter (who preaches
defending Christian morality while wearing a mini skirt) style name
calling and character assassination to win your point. In a land of hate
talk radio, I call hate talk radio neo-Hitler style propaganda  (and I
believe that if Hitler was alive today, he would use talk radio to
espouse his Nazi views, Himler would have been so thrilled if they had
this technology back then!), we are devolving into such a mean, vengeful
and violent, mob justice society. No we haven't gone to the point where
we shove people in a colosseum and watch people kill each other or watch
enemies get eaten by lions, but were getting pretty close to it. Whether
we kill someone with words or with a sword, it's all the same mentality.
And because so many people fall for it, we're wide open to becoming a
fascist society. And most or us know what happened to societies that went
down that path.

I don't know, when someone talks about our school budget cuts, campaign
reforms, fair taxation and creating jobs, and they are called a hippie
feminist bitch for it without reading what she says, that make's me
wonder about the future or this country. No, It's not disagreeing with
her solutions, it's about calling someone a bitch as a rebuttal to her
policies, not only her, but anybody who doesn't tote the right wing PC
line.
 Being conservative is supost to be the "in" thing today, and Objectivism
is the latest hip philosophy, but like I say about super hip looking
Christian concerts with bands and rappers that sound like their secular
counterparts, it's all the same 'ole guilt ridden, fun hating, narrow
minded religion of our Puritan ancestors, just dressed up in modern
clothes. 

Yeah, liberalism has it's flaws, like all philosophies, and no, people
like Stalin were not real liberals but conservatives, but conservatism
has a sad past of downtrodding common people and defending, at the point
of a gun, the elite to rule and suppress the poor. When the common people
feel suppressed, who do they turn to for help? No, not the conservatives
who are usually the suppressors, but to liberals. Liberals are usualy the
people who clean up the financial and international messes conservatives
cause. When capitalism leaves people statving, it's the liberals who
fight for food. When people were getting slaughtered in the streets for
unions and worker's rights so we can have today unemployment insurance,
40 hour weeks and overtime pay, and guess who wants to take this all
away?, the only conservatives out in the streets were the ones who did
the slaughtering. Who was out there back in the day fighting for civil
rights, women rights and gay rights? Who is defending the right to dance?
Who is trying to supress it? What kind of government in Germany supports
a dance festival called "Love Parade"? What kind of government in Holland
supports a medical/safe approach to drug use? Tell me, how many pioneers
and innovators of the rave movement were hard line
Hannely/Coulter/Limbaugh KSFO conservatives?
No, I don't think conservatism is a cool, hip philosophy to follow!
Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^

On Wed, 13 Aug 2003 03:11:46 -0400 (EDT) dank@countercultured.net writes:

>duh

NEWS   =20
   =20
Deep and Dark Recordings Upcoming Release by Neurotron - Texture of you will=
=20
be hitting stores near you in September. This release is one of the most=20
anticipated albums as it being the first release of Deep and Dark Recordings=
 USA.=20
If you would like more information on the release please visit <A HREF=3D"ht=
tp://www.neurotron-music.com/releases.html">
http://www.neurotron-music.com/releases.html</A>  or <A HREF=3D"www.deepandd=
ark.com">www.deepanddark.com</A>.  If you would like to=20
buy the CD please send all inquiries to monk7923@aol.com. This CD is going t=
o be=20
must have for anyone.=20
Sept 2003

<A HREF=3D"http://www.neurotron-music.com/releases.html">DeepGer001</A>
Neurotron-Texture of you
full length album      =20
       =20

Neurotron

The heads of Neurotron, Axel Schuh and Andr=E9 Kroenert were born in 1978 in=
=20
Guestrow, a small very old city in the north-east of Germany. Since school t=
hey=20
hung around together and developed their love for electronic music by hearin=
g=20
EBM, Industrial, Experimental and Acid-House. After many great and wonderful=
=20
partys and moments with this music they decided to produce such music by=20
themselves. In 1995 Andre started to work as DJ Phrase. Later he brought the=
=20
self-made sound to the dance floors outside the live acts of Neurotron as Le=
 Dub=20
Dwell. In 1995/96 they bought a Roland MC-202 and a 606. Little later a 909=20=
and a=20
whole depot of synthesizers, effect tools and samplers and started to perfor=
m=20
live acts as Yakusa in Guestrow, Rostock and Kiel. At first the sound was=20
realy hard grooving Detroit-Techno, influenced by artists like Plasticman, U=
R,=20
Cybotron, Stacey Pullen & Aphex Twin. Later they begun to use laptops and=20
combined this with the hardware in their studio. By increasing influences by=
 labels=20
like Force Tracks, Raum Musik , Basic Channel or Poker Flat and Kompakt thei=
r=20
sound became more dubby, deep and minimal. In this time they got to know Eri=
k=20
Klingbeil from Berlin. He is a very talented designer, who creates flyers,=20
videos and covers with his artworks <A HREF=3D"http://www.cubelab.de/">(www.=
cubelab.de)</A> for Neurotron since that=20
time. With the change of their sound, their attitude of life and of music th=
ey=20
changed their name as well. Neurotron was born. The harmonious connection be=
tween=20
human nerves and electronic physics. The result : a positive change of=20
perception by electronic. Live this is reflected by both and transferred to=20=
the=20
audience. DJ Phrase changed his name. In 2001/2002 they released their first=
 music=20
on Thinner Records. After this they start to produce for more and more=20
projects. Since 2002 Le Dub Dwell is supporting the whole and cares for the=20
spreading of this attitude outside live acts with his deep and groovy sets.=20=
In 2002=20
they got to know Timothy Dorsey of <A HREF=3D"http://www.deepanddark.com/">D=
eep & Dark Recordings(us)</A> and Alexandra=20
Konka of <A HREF=3D"http://www.deepanddark.de/">Deep & Dark Recordings(ger)<=
/A>. This was the start of a very great=20
friendship and musical cooperation and they made many remixes and production=
s for D&D.=20
After the summer 2003 they released their full length Album Neurotron: Textu=
re=20
of you on Deep&Dark Recordings. In the middle of 2003 they start their own=20
label <A HREF=3D"http://www.night-drive-music.com/">Night-Drive-Music</A>. T=
he sound is very deep, minimal and harmonic with=20
internationl Acts. Like a beautiful nightdrive.=20

   =20
Neurotron presents - Texture of you (full lenght album)

DD001-2 V=D6: Sept 2003


<A HREF=3D"http://www.neurotron-music.com/neuro/sound/neurotron/leading.mp3"=
>1. The Leading Edge</A>
<A HREF=3D"http://www.neurotron-music.com/neuro/sound/neurotron/real.mp3">2.=
 Realitaetverstaerker</A>=20

3. Puzzle 12- remix </A>(original produced by Steve Nails)=20

. The Coast Of Living</A>=20

 Deep Impact - remix </A>(original produced by Hoffman)=20

ml">K=E9li</A>)
<A HREF=3D"http://www.neurotron-music.com/neuro/sound/neurotron/puru.mp3">7.=
 Purusha - remix </A>(original prodused by Purusha)=20

 Texture Of You </A>(produced by <A HREF=3D"http://www.neurotron-music.com/n=
eurotron.html">Neurotron</A> & <A HREF=3D"http://www.neurotron-music.com/nik=
ki.html">K=E9li)=20

old city in the north-east of Germany. Since school they hung around togethe=
r and developed their love for electronic music by hearing EBM, Industrial,=20=
Experimental and Acid-House. After many great and wonderful partys and momen=
ts with this music they decided to produce such music by themselves. In 1995=
 Andre started to work as DJ Phrase. Later he brought the self-made sound to=
 the dance floors outside the live acts of Neurotron as Le Dub Dwell. In 199=
5/96 they bought a Roland MC-202 and a 606. Little later a 909 and a whole d=
epot of synthesizers, effect tools and samplers and started to perform live=20=
acts as Yakusa in Guestrow, Rostock and Kiel. At first the sound was realy h=
ard grooving Detroit-Techno, influenced by artists like Plasticman, UR, Cybo=
tron, Stacey Pullen &amp; Aphex Twin. Later they begun to use laptops and co=
mbined this with the hardware in their studio. By increasing influences by l=
abels like Force Tracks, Raum Musik , Basic Channel or Poker Flat and Kompak=
t their sound became more dubby, deep and minimal. In this time they got to=20=
know Erik Klingbeil from Berlin. He is a very talented designer, who creates=

e/">(www.cubelab.de)</A> for Neurotron since that time. With the change of t=
heir sound, their attitude of life and of music they changed their name as w=
ell. Neurotron was born. The harmonious connection between human nerves and=20=
electronic physics. The result : a positive change of perception by electron=
ic. Live this is reflected by both and transferred to the audience. DJ Phras=
e changed his name. In 2001/2002 they released their first music on Thinner=20=
Records. After this they start to produce for more and more projects. Since=20=
2002 Le Dub Dwell is supporting the whole and cares for the spreading of thi=
s attitude outside live acts with his deep and groovy sets. In 2002 they got=
 to know Timothy Dorsey of <A HREF=3D"http://www.deepanddark.com/">Deep &amp=
; Dark Recordings(us)</A> and Alexandra Konka of <A HREF=3D"http://www.deepa=
nddark.de/">Deep &amp; Dark Recordings(ger)</A>. This was the start of a ver=
y great friendship and musical cooperation and they made many remixes and pr=
oductions for D&amp;D. After the summer 2003 they released their full length=
 Album Neurotron: Texture of you on Deep&amp;Dark Recordings. In the middle=20=
of 2003 they start their own label <A HREF=3D"http://www.night-drive-music.c=
om/">Night-Drive-Music</A>. The sound is very deep, minimal and harmonic wit=
h internationl Acts. Like a beautiful nightdrive. <BR>

I am looking for people to join the ranks of Deep and Dark Recordings 
promotional team. We are expanding rapidly and need help with promotions.  Perks will 
include VIP status at all Deep and Dark events and earn some free music in 
the process. Great opportunity to work in the music industry.  If you would be 
interested in being a vital team member with us please send me a e-mail at 
monk7923@aol.com with : Street Promotions in the title.  Also Please check out <A HREF="www.deepanddark.com">
www.deepanddark.com</A> and see what we are about and weather or not you would like 
to become a member of our team.  

Sincerely, 

Tony Da Tiger Russo

Subject: Re: [sfraves] boo!

... and here I thought that Bay Area Trance was in something of a downswing. I agree with Sean; you can find a lot of different kinds of music if you hit the right club on the right night. But as far as Friday and Saturday parties go, I hear a lot of house, NRG, hardcore, happy hardcore, and not as much trance as in the past. 
But anyway ... one of the funnest things, for me, about partying is wandering around and enjoying what's in the different rooms. I love drum & bass ... love trance too ... love a lot of house music (but not all types) ... lots of great stuff to listen to. 
I don't say "boo!" to any of the styles cuz there's plenty of room for all of them. 
how about "MORE OF" some styles, rather than "LESS OF" others? How about more Goa ... more Electro ... whatever ... Expand the pie so there is more for us to listen to.  :)

Goa is way different than Techno, House, Drum-n-Bass, or Trance.. In NYC
the crowds were way different at Goa events. Typically, in the NYC area,
psytrance parties were a large % of israelies (the girls are so hot, but
typically stick to their own kind) or hippy types. Electro is cool.. I've
got a lot of live electro sets perhaps I could burn you some.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] boo!

Not really... Unless you're just hanging out with the kiddy crowd here.
Lately the bay area is dominated by a huge upswing in house and sadly,
happycore//hardcore. Something you will find out really quickly is that the
*scene* here is VERY fragmented. Stay in the house scene and you have to
figure out what part of the house scene you want to be in. Schwank side,
artsy side, glossy club side, meatmarket, and so on all exist. I just find
it funny to hear the trance comment. If we were in the years 98 - 2001 I'd
say yes for damn sure there is too much!

ryan.bailey
sninesix.design
design :: www.sninesix.com
photography :: www.innocentchild.com

Subject: Re: [sfraves] boo!

You're just not in the right end of things. It's all there. Chicago house -
Andrew Phelan - recent transplant from that city. Techno?? Good god - there
is more head pounding, skull fucking (C ambient mafia), techno in this area
than you could believe. Just that the masses aren't into it, but it's very
much there. I just did visuals for an all techno record release party this
weekend. DEFSF(think that's the crew name) had another party of the same
nature 3 weeks ago. It's *very* there and mostly enjoyed by the old
schoolers that started things here. I can't speak on behalf of the dnb
because I don't know brittish dnb from domestic. I do know the difference
between the beer though! =)

Ask for suggestions on where to go to get your fix on SFR. You've got people
that will point you in the right direction here.

:: r ::

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

guys/gals, this is going be a totally AWESOME time!  my friends and i are 
trying to raise money for burningman, so if you're into the cause, and want 
to have a wicked saturday afternoon of dope house/progressive/breaks DJs 
....check us out.  here are some of the details below...i hope to see you 
there.  i'll be the dude who can't stop dancing :)

- eric


PEACE MELON DAY PARTY
Saturday, August 16th: NOON - 7 p.m.
Cafe Cocomo
650 INDIANA STREET
$7

Please join Andrew, Christian, Cece, Lisa, Geneva & Michael, Zander, Tim & 
Megan, Veronica (Vee) & Bob, Maciek, Tim & Eric as we prepare for the playa.

What is Peace Melon?
Well, glad you asked. Peace Melon takes some of its spirit from those crazy 
Octane Parties. We decided that best of all we like to hang out with 
friends, and make new ones along the way. So, on the Playa we will be 
creating a little oasis full of shade for new and old friends to get 
together, and enjoy a little libation of watermelon, other fruits and alcohol.
Utilizing the power of the triangle, we will be creating a very large shade 
structure that if seen from the sky will resemble a butterfly; each 
individual part of the butterfly will look like a slice of luscious slice 
of watermelon. We will have decks and a long line-up of folks lending a 
hand to make for a fantastic musical and gastronomical feast.
Join us on the playa, when the shade runs long we will bust out our Melons 
to be passed around and enjoyed as one.

Featured Flavors of Music @ THE MELON DAY PARTY:
+ Ms. E (FutureBreaks, SisterSF)
+ Scott Carrelli (Satellite, Qool)
+ Samira (SisterSF)
+ KENichi (OnIce, Octane)
+ FauxQ (Noel C., Seed, Platform, DownNYurty)
+ F*Down (Maciek, 808Fell, DownNYurty)
+ Gabriel (Gabriel Alexander, RippedNet)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
*  go to  www.ofoto.com to check out PHOTOS of the venue
*  email address:  peacemelon@yahoo.com
*  password:  watermelon
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ALSO, to enjoy on the outdoor patio with your peacemelon...

- tasty BBQ for your belly
- heavenly HOOKAH pipes
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Directions from the South:
101 TO 280 NORTH TO MARIPOSA EXIT. RIGHT ON MARIPOSA.
RIGHT ON INDIANA. 1/4 MILE ON RIGHT.

Directions from the North:
BAY BRIDGE TO 101. TAKE CAESAR CHAVEZ EAST EXIT.
1/2 MILE UNDER 280 FREEWAY OVERPASS.
LEFT ON INDIANA, 8 BLOCKS. BETWEEN 19TH & MARIPOSA

Link to Map:
http://maps.yahoo.com/py/maps.py?Pyt=Tmap&ed=zWIWCup_0ToG0i2Jg9JL.h9esYn5CcXeE.8_VO_5rDFQFtG7AoNWv7PRnzFX1Nc-&csz=CA,%2B94107&country=us

. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
hellajanky.com coming soon!
.  .  .  .  .  . 
.  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .  .   .  .  .  .  .  .
p[e]Ace

</b>Well, glad you asked. Peace Melon takes some of its spirit from those
crazy Octane Parties. We decided that best of all we like to hang out
with friends, and make new ones along the way. So, on the Playa we will
be creating a little oasis full of shade for new and old friends to get
together, and enjoy a little libation of watermelon, other fruits and
alcohol.<br>
Utilizing the power of the triangle, we will be creating a very large
shade structure that if seen from the sky will resemble a butterfly; each
individual part of the butterfly will look like a slice of luscious slice
of watermelon. We will have decks and a long line-up of folks lending a
hand to make for a fantastic musical and gastronomical feast.<br>
Join us on the playa, when the shade runs long we will bust out our
Melons to be passed around and enjoyed as one.<br><br>
<b>Featured Flavors of Music @ THE MELON DAY PARTY: <br>
</b>+ Ms. E (FutureBreaks, SisterSF) <br>
+ Scott Carrelli (Satellite, Qool) <br>
+ Samira (SisterSF) <br>
+ KENichi (OnIce, Octane) <br>
+ FauxQ (Noel C., Seed, Platform, DownNYurty) <br>
+ F*Down (Maciek, 808Fell, DownNYurty) <br>
+ Gabriel (Gabriel Alexander, RippedNet)<br><br>
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br>
*&nbsp; go to&nbsp;
<a href="http://www.ofoto.com/" eudora="autourl">www.ofoto.com</a> to
check out <b>PHOTOS </b>of the venue<br>
*&nbsp; email address:&nbsp; <b>peacemelon@yahoo.com<br>
</b>*&nbsp; password:&nbsp; <b>watermelon<br>
</b>--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br><br>
<i>ALSO</i>, to enjoy on the outdoor patio with your
peacemelon...<br><br>
- tasty <b>BBQ </b>for your belly<br>
- heavenly <b>HOOKAH </b>pipes<br>
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br><br>
<b>Directions </b>from the South: <br>
101 TO 280 NORTH TO MARIPOSA EXIT. RIGHT ON MARIPOSA. <br>
RIGHT ON INDIANA. 1/4 MILE ON RIGHT.<br><br>
Directions from the North: <br>
BAY BRIDGE TO 101. TAKE CAESAR CHAVEZ EAST EXIT. <br>
1/2 MILE UNDER 280 FREEWAY OVERPASS. <br>
LEFT ON INDIANA, 8 BLOCKS. BETWEEN 19TH &amp; MARIPOSA<br><br>

From sfraves-return-104868-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Thu Aug 14 00:00:00 2003
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-104868-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org

Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm

list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 93592 invoked from network); 13 Aug 2003 23:59:59 -0000
From: gregvp@comcast.net
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Date: Wed, 13 Aug 2003 23:59:43 +0000
X-Mailer: AT&T Message Center Version 1 (Jul 22 2003)
X-Authenticated-Sender: Z3JlZ3ZwQGNvbWNhc3QubmV0
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Review: Full moon rave (FMR) on the coast

I missed the Estuary party at SS on Monday night because I had the top-secret
info line for another FMR. I just had to go since I have never been dancing in
the moonlight around here (I am usually at indoor venues).

This was a fun party but it required much patience to attend. It was a good
thing that I had some booze beforehand. I drove all the way over to Pacifica and
parked along Beach Way (or something like that), and as soon as I got out of the
car, some idiot set off a bottle rocket. I thought that would definitely bring
out the cops but nothing happened. Except when I walked up the trail to the
cliffs, there was no music or glowstick (our handy hint for directions). Good
thing I had a six-pack to slug down or I would have been frustrated. 

You were supposed to find the glowstick and follow the path up the hill. I ran
into some other ravers though, like Phillip Diaz, and we were all dismayed.
Someone called the info line again and it said to wait 15 minutes.  Finally, we
all got directions to Daly City and I was more confused then ever while driving
(cant blame the booze, either). I am not familiar with this area of the coast
because I live in East Bay.

I spotted some ravers crossing the highway near a darkened horse stable and I
knew that was my ticket. I parked nearby and started walking the sandy trail,
smelling the wafts of horse manure. Then I heard the music, saw the waving
glowsticks, and felt immediate gratification. 

I downed another beer and starting dancing in the sand. Have you ever tried this
one? I cannot recommend it for big and tall guys. It was excessively hard to
stay stable. I kept digging my own dance pit!

I was trying not to kick sand in the face of nearby e-tards (I mean, chilled
out persons), but it was impossible, the sand was flying. They had a small
dance mat in front of the DJ, near the black lights, but it kept shifting (not
tied down). 

I moved over near some vegetation (brushy terrain) to dance because it seemed
flatter and stable there, but once again, I kept sinking. 

Finally, I just gave up and walked the trail along the coast to watch the
crashing waves in the moonlight. I fell down once because the trail was narrow
and I am wide but I recovered and dusted the sand off my ass.

Hell, I was not even that drunk at the time. It felt so silly to fall down, so I
just laughed at myself. What else can you do? 

It was a lot of fun to get away on a weeknight (Monday). I love FMRs and I
cannot wait until the next one. I hope that I can see more of the people that I
know, though, because it is more fun that way.

Greg VP







---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Date: Wed, 13 Aug 2003 17:36:55 -0700

Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v552)
From: Philip X Diaz <st_indigo@earthlink.net>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
In-Reply-To: <200308131659.19N5x53nX3NZFnx0@emu>
Message-Id: <680077C2-CDEF-11D7-9F48-0003937E2222@earthlink.net>
X-Mailer: Apple Mail (2.552)
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Review: Full moon rave (FMR) on the coast

that was more a review of your night than the party, greg...

overall, it was good, hard psy, and excellent mixing. lots of 
blacklights along with amazing clear skies and a bright moon were 
enough to be able to recognize faces in the dark. lots of excellent 
glowy tapestries... it's hard to make a beach party look good, but they 
did a great job.

there were a few peeps spinning fire and putting on a show. lots of 
great eye-candy - it's a shame i had to work early the next day. :-) it 
was amazingly warm and clear, and i really wanted to stay later, but my 
friend and i cut out around 4:30 am.


AND NOW, a few things i've learned about FMR's over the years:

they rarely start on time, usually after midnight
they have no bathroom facilities
they are usually cold
they are usually a pain in the ass to find
they are on a work/school night
your friends will all say they want to go, but flake at the last minute

BUT

if you stick it out and are persistent, you will be rewarded with some 
of the best, free, outdoor parties around. the FMR on monday paled in 
comparison to some of the madness that the Wicked crew pulled off 
way-back-when... but if all of you guys showed up on monday night, it 
would have been pretty damn close. :-)

i hope to see more of you at the next one.

-philip-

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Review: Full moon rave (FMR) on the coast

Thanks, Philip, your observations are right on the money! Excellent, dude.
I forgot to mention the fire dancers and the overall good vibe, plus the
excellent weather. (clear) And those tapestries were the bomb! And I loved
the psytrance!

Yeah, y'all get out to the next one, we'll make it even better, keep the
vibes, just add to them.

I got a little carried away in my prev. message about the sandy terrain, ya
just have to wear old shoes and throw them away the next day, or just dance
barefoot.

It is true, you will experience the reward (i.e. delight) that this area has
to offer. How can you compare crashing waves, moonlight, black lights to
going to bed just so you can go to work the next morning? Ya gotta live a
little (as I stiffle a YAWN from the boring drudgery of the workday).

Greg

----- Original Message -----
From: Philip X Diaz <st_indigo@earthlink.net>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Wednesday, August 13, 2003 5:36 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Review: Full moon rave (FMR) on the coast


that was more a review of your night than the party, greg...

overall, it was good, hard psy, and excellent mixing. lots of
blacklights along with amazing clear skies and a bright moon were
enough to be able to recognize faces in the dark. lots of excellent
glowy tapestries... it's hard to make a beach party look good, but they
did a great job.

there were a few peeps spinning fire and putting on a show. lots of
great eye-candy - it's a shame i had to work early the next day. :-) it
was amazingly warm and clear, and i really wanted to stay later, but my
friend and i cut out around 4:30 am.


AND NOW, a few things i've learned about FMR's over the years:

they rarely start on time, usually after midnight
they have no bathroom facilities
they are usually cold
they are usually a pain in the ass to find
they are on a work/school night
your friends will all say they want to go, but flake at the last minute

BUT

if you stick it out and are persistent, you will be rewarded with some
of the best, free, outdoor parties around. the FMR on monday paled in
comparison to some of the madness that the Wicked crew pulled off
way-back-when... but if all of you guys showed up on monday night, it
would have been pretty damn close. :-)

i hope to see more of you at the next one.

-philip-

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Review: Full moon rave (FMR) on the coast

Well, as I said, the beer helped me have a good time, I just needed more of
it (because someone drank a few of mine for me). But I paid the next day.
(didn't get much work done; couldn't get out of bed)

On the other hand, it was great fun, good vibes, nice weather. I was feeling
negative initially (as expressed by my partial review), and I was thinking
the same thing, (i.e. where the fuck is the party), but I got over it. (only
because I was determined to experience my first FMR)

All said and done, I have no regrets about sticking it out. Got home at
around 5 am.

Greg VP

I didn't make it out to this one. But I went to one at the DC spot a while
back.  It ranked very high amongst my party experiences.

Somehow, those guys really manage to draw you into another universe. That
spot is incredibly trippy. When the fog rolls in at ~6am... man.

Actually, the party I went to down there is what got me really
interested in Psytrance - a genre I didn't really know much about before
then. Max magic.

TRH

--=====================_11801945==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

At 05:39 PM 8/13/2003 -0700, innocentchild wrote:

>To me they didn't have their shit together and I value my time and sleep
>more than waiting for some crew to update a voicemail for a party that may
>or may not occur. Reality is a bitch on the weekdays when there is work to
>be done. I would have gone if I thought the damn thing would have actually
>gone off, but no vm update in hours makes me say all bets are off.
>
>:: r ::

Well, what Philip had to say about FMRs is quite true.  Attending a Wicked 
FMR often required much patience...but the mad runs all over the Bay Area 
on those nights was well worth the effort:)  The parties rarely got going 
before 2 AM -- sometimes as late as four.  If there was a problem at one 
location we would all move to another and help the crew set up those 
awesome, but very heavy, speakers once again.  Info line messages, to my 
mind, were often unclear.  I used to take a hand-held tape recorder and 
record off the cell phone (when you could find a place where it worked), 
and then replay the damn thing over and over again while we all poured over 
maps with flashlights on the side of the road while we puzzled out 
directions.  Frequently got lost.

One could go on...the best of times, and, as they say, getting there was 
part of the fun.

I remember once at the Bonnie Dune location we got lost after we parked our 
cars.  Everyone was very quietly walking down the railroad tracks, so we 
really didn't know where the peeps were or where they were going.  We went 
in the opposite direction and, after about a mile, realized that we were 
alone.  So we went up off the tracks and onto some farmer's 
field.   Slogged through manure for what seemed like an eternity when....we 
all ended up walking right into his backyard.   We were all so fearful we 
would give the party away, so we crawled around the buildings.  Then got 
up, and headed again for the railroad tracks.  This time we made it to the 
little trail about half a mile down the tracks (unmarked) that led to the 
cliff and then the beach.  As we came up to the edge --  the moon shining 
on the water;  hundreds of people around bonfires and such;  no music, they 
were still setting up and we helped.  Then, about two hours later, the 
music.  Time from home to dancin' in the sand -- over five hours.

Love,

Apollo

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie
