----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Philip X Diaz" 
To: 
Sent: Wednesday, August 13, 2003 5:36 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Review: Full moon rave (FMR) on the coast


that was more a review of your night than the party, greg...

overall, it was good, hard psy, and excellent mixing. lots of
blacklights along with amazing clear skies and a bright moon were
enough to be able to recognize faces in the dark. lots of excellent
glowy tapestries... it's hard to make a beach party look good, but they
did a great job.

there were a few peeps spinning fire and putting on a show. lots of
great eye-candy - it's a shame i had to work early the next day. :-) it
was amazingly warm and clear, and i really wanted to stay later, but my
friend and i cut out around 4:30 am.


AND NOW, a few things i've learned about FMR's over the years:

they rarely start on time, usually after midnight
they have no bathroom facilities
they are usually cold
they are usually a pain in the ass to find
they are on a work/school night
your friends will all say they want to go, but flake at the last minute

BUT

if you stick it out and are persistent, you will be rewarded with some
of the best, free, outdoor parties around. the FMR on monday paled in
comparison to some of the madness that the Wicked crew pulled off
way-back-when... but if all of you guys showed up on monday night, it
would have been pretty damn close. :-)

i hope to see more of you at the next one.

-philip-

No cop has ever busted any of my parties... If you're thinking of ASR at the
aquatic park - that wasn't my party. I just did sound for them. =)

I don't have patience on a weeknight when time is limited due to a job that
keeps me busy (and at the office still right now). hence why I say time is
precious. If you can't get me the info in time to make it worth heading out
for then I'm not going to bother. I'd rather sleep and catch another FMR in
a month. They happen all the time so it's not a biggy. This particular event
lagged on info and had a party on a Monday night when the majority of us
have jobs the next day that we have to be awake for. It's being realistic
and having your priorities strait. Job vs yet another FMR. I'll keep my job
thnx!

:: r ::

innocentchild <innocentchild@hotmail.com> wrote:
To me they didn't have their shit together and I value my time and sleep
more than waiting for some crew to update a voicemail for a party that may
or may not occur. Reality is a bitch on the weekdays when there is work to

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Philip X Diaz"
To:
Sent: Wednesday, August 13, 2003 5:36 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Review: Full moon rave (FMR) on the coast


that was more a review of your night than the party, greg...

overall, it was good, hard psy, and excellent mixing. lots of
blacklights along with amazing clear skies and a bright moon were
enough to be able to recognize faces in the dark. lots of excellent
glowy tapestries... it's hard to make a beach party look good, but they
did a great job.

there were a few peeps spinning fire and putting on a show. lots of
great eye-candy - it's a shame i had to work early the next day. :-) it
was amazingly warm and clear, and i really wanted to stay later, but my
friend and i cut out around 4:30 am.


AND NOW, a few things i've learned about FMR's over the years:

they rarely start on time, usually after midnight
they have no bathroom facilities
they are usually cold
they are usually a pain in the ass to find
they are on a work/school night
your friends will all say they want to go, but flake at the last minute

BUT

if you stick it out and are persistent, you will be rewarded with some
of the best, free, outdoor parties around. the FMR on monday paled in
comparison to some of the madness that the Wicked crew pulled off
way-back-when... but if all of you guys showed up on monday night, it
would have been pretty damn close. :-)

i hope to see more of you at the next one.

-philip-

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Review: Full moon rave (FMR) on the coast

On Wed, Aug 13, 2003 at 08:31:23PM -0700, philip diaz wrote:
> on 8/13/03 7:49 PM, innocentchild at innocentchild@hotmail.com wrote:
> 
> > I don't have patience on a weeknight when time is limited due to a job that
> > keeps me busy (and at the office still right now). hence why I say time is
> > precious.
> 
> poopypants:

Hah hah hah!

FMR, at least by Wicked, had quite a history of a mangled phone
tree, which was the only way to know, even worse mangled directions,
and starting at 3am or so (DOH! Someone forgot turntables!)

Gods, it was a wonder anyone showed up at all. And yet 1500++ people
would turn out. We complained and complained, and yet went again and
again like it was going to be the very last party in the world.

This was probably the reason why when many of us started throwing
parties, we were determined to give better customer service. Some of
our We Can Do Better events even started 2 hours early!

But there's a certain quality only the true quest would give, when
after cursing and listening to voice mail over and over and driving
the fuck all over california lost with a carload of ravers and
walking around in the wrong directions... my God we'd finally find
the event and it's be so magic and crazy and everyone else was so
crazy... we'll be telling our grandkids about it.

Yeah we bitched on the lists and bitched to our friends and bitched
to our diaries and wondered  how it could be.

And we fucking went. Every single time. Came back with permagrin.

How about that? :)

Sean

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

On Wed, Aug 13, 2003 at 08:31:23PM -0700, philip diaz wrote:
> on 8/13/03 7:49 PM, innocentchild at innocentchild@hotmail.com wrote:
>
> > I don't have patience on a weeknight when time is limited due to a job
that
> > keeps me busy (and at the office still right now). hence why I say time
is
> > precious.
>
> poopypants:

Hah hah hah!

FMR, at least by Wicked, had quite a history of a mangled phone
tree, which was the only way to know, even worse mangled directions,
and starting at 3am or so (DOH! Someone forgot turntables!)

Gods, it was a wonder anyone showed up at all. And yet 1500++ people
would turn out. We complained and complained, and yet went again and
again like it was going to be the very last party in the world.

This was probably the reason why when many of us started throwing
parties, we were determined to give better customer service. Some of
our We Can Do Better events even started 2 hours early!

But there's a certain quality only the true quest would give, when
after cursing and listening to voice mail over and over and driving
the fuck all over california lost with a carload of ravers and
walking around in the wrong directions... my God we'd finally find
the event and it's be so magic and crazy and everyone else was so
crazy... we'll be telling our grandkids about it.

Yeah we bitched on the lists and bitched to our friends and bitched
to our diaries and wondered  how it could be.

And we fucking went. Every single time. Came back with permagrin.

How about that? :)

Sean

Subject: [sfraves] SRR:Amber CD Played @ Gym

Hey,
So I'm at 24 Hour Fitness Wednesday evening for my daily after work 
work-out. As much as I hate lower body days, I have to torture my legs cause 
I don't want to end up looking like one of those guys with massive arms and 
chicken legs. On my last set of squats, with 570 pounds on the bar, what do 
I hear come through the sound system???

AMBER:GOLD!!!

I almost lost balance and dropped the bar.

And these guys played the entire CD, from start to finish! I asked one of 
the fitness counselors about it and he pointed me to the front desk worker 
who said he was a big fan of electronica and today was his day to select the 
music.

Needless to say, I had an awesome lower body workout...the music really does 
make an impact.

Just thought I'd share...

Later,
Riz

--- gregvp@comcast.net wrote:
> I missed the Estuary party at SS on Monday night because I
> had the top-secret
> info line for another FMR. I just had to go since I have
> never been dancing in
> the moonlight around here (I am usually at indoor venues).
> 
> This was a fun party but it required much patience to attend.
> It was a good
> thing that I had some booze beforehand. I drove all the way
> over to and
> parked along (or something like that), and as soon
> as I got out of the
> car, some idiot set off a bottle rocket. I thought that would
> definitely bring
> out the cops but nothing happened. Except when I walked up
> the trail to the
> cliffs, there was no music or glowstick (our handy hint for
> directions). Good
> thing I had a six-pack to slug down or I would have been
> frustrated. 
> 
> You were supposed to find the glowstick and follow the path
> up the hill. I ran
> into some other ravers though, like Phillip Diaz, and we were
> all dismayed.
> Someone called the info line again and it said to wait 15
> minutes.  Finally, we
> all got directions to and I was more confused then
> ever while driving
> (cant blame the booze, either). I am not familiar with this
> area of the coast
> because I live in East Bay.
> 
> I spotted some ravers crossing the highway near a darkened
> horse stable and I
> knew that was my ticket. I parked nearby and started walking
> the sandy trail,
> smelling the wafts of horse manure. Then I heard the music,
> saw the waving
> glowsticks, and felt immediate gratification. 
> 
> I downed another beer and starting dancing in the sand. Have
> you ever tried this
> one? I cannot recommend it for big and tall guys. It was
> excessively hard to
> stay stable. I kept digging my own dance pit!
> 
> I was trying not to kick sand in the face of nearby e-tards
> (I mean, chilled
> out persons), but it was impossible, the sand was flying.
> They had a small
> dance mat in front of the DJ, near the black lights, but it
> kept shifting (not
> tied down). 
> 
> I moved over near some vegetation (brushy terrain) to dance
> because it seemed
> flatter and stable there, but once again, I kept sinking. 
> 
> Finally, I just gave up and walked the trail along the coast
> to watch the
> crashing waves in the moonlight. I fell down once because the
> trail was narrow
> and I am wide but I recovered and dusted the sand off my ass.
> 
> Hell, I was not even that drunk at the time. It felt so silly
> to fall down, so I
> just laughed at myself. What else can you do? 
> 
> It was a lot of fun to get away on a weeknight (Monday). I
> love FMRs and I
> cannot wait until the next one. I hope that I can see more of
> the people that I
> know, though, because it is more fun that way.
> 
> Greg VP
>

Hey!  Which 24 hr club was this???   'Cause I work at 24 hr fitness (on Mckee and Capitol) and our music played is not a CD, it's all run off of satellite.  Electronic is #17 on the DMX station.  
 
just wondering...  I've even heard a lot of awesome tracks on there.  
 
well, gotta go to work
 
~Tami

RaVin RiZ <ravin_riz@hotmail.com> wrote:
Hey,
So I'm at 24 Hour Fitness Wednesday evening for my daily after work 
work-out. As much as I hate lower body days, I have to torture my legs cause 
I don't want to end up looking like one of those guys with massive arms and 
chicken legs. On my last set of squats, with 570 pounds on the bar, what do 
I hear come through the sound system???

AMBER:GOLD!!!

I almost lost balance and dropped the bar.

And these guys played the entire CD, from start to finish! I asked one of 
the fitness counselors about it and he pointed me to the front desk worker 
who said he was a big fan of electronica and today was his day to select the 
music.

Needless to say, I had an awesome lower body workout...the music really does 
make an impact.

Just thought I'd share...

Later,
Riz

Raves become all the rage

This is a rave; a phenomenon imported from Europe that in Mexico draws 
legions of young
psycheros. They see themselves as modern hippies. They dance all night to 
"psycho-trance"
music. And they consume lots of drugs such as ecstasy, LSD and 
amphetamines, police say.

http://www.sun-sentinel.com/news/local/caribbean/sfl-hmexraves14aug14,1,3666860.story?coll=sfla-news-caribbean



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U  
--=====================_1520403==.ALT--

Hey!  Which 24 hr club was this???   'Cause I work at 24 hr fitness (on 
Mckee and Capitol) and our music played is not a CD, it's all run off of

well, gotta go to work

~Tami

RaVin RiZ <ravin_riz@hotmail.com> wrote:
Hey,
So I'm at 24 Hour Fitness Wednesday evening for my daily after work
work-out. As much as I hate lower body days, I have to torture my legs cause
I don't want to end up looking like one of those guys with massive arms and
chicken legs. On my last set of squats, with 570 pounds on the bar, what do
I hear come through the sound system???

AMBER:GOLD!!!

I almost lost balance and dropped the bar.

And these guys played the entire CD, from start to finish! I asked one of
the fitness counselors about it and he pointed me to the front desk worker
who said he was a big fan of electronica and today was his day to select the
music.

Needless to say, I had an awesome lower body workout...the music really does
make an impact.

Just thought I'd share...

Later,
Riz

-----------------------------
Raul Endymion in association with True Intent Sonic Enterprises
presents a
new party dedicated to exploring the innovative, bassbin-rumbling,
ultra-funky sounds of 2-Step/UK Garage, Broken Beat & Future Jazz:

SAFE

Every Saturday night @ The Top!

THIS WEEK'S SPECIAL GUESTS:

SUN TZU SOUNDSYSTEM (SEATTLE)
 
This triple-threat team have been the only crew representing future
funk sounds up north, with recent throwdowns featuring Domu, Daz I Kue
and Joy Jones, Titonton Duvante and Cinematic Orchestra. They're
currently touring the Left Coast and hit Safe this Saturday! You can
check out more of their steez at www.suntzusound.com. Don't miss it!
 
with resident selectors:
 
MIKEBEE (TRUE INTENT, FUTURE BREAKS FM, SAFE)
SCIENCE (VIBERATION, SAFE)
 
Arrive early for an intimate Happy Hour from 7pm to 10pm with your
hosts:
 
DOM SOME (STEP, FORWARD-THOUGHT)
DJ SEA (TRUE INTENT, FUTURE BREAKS FM)
ENZYME (STEP)
FICTION (PACIFIC STANDARD)
 
this Saturday, 8/2
@ The Top, 424 Haight St
10pm-2am
FREE BEFORE 10PM
LADIES FREE BEFORE 11PM
$5 cover
21+, ID ESSENTIAL
 
don't forget to listen to Future Breaks FM on KUSF 90.3 Saturday
afternoons
from 4-6pm to hear the freshest sounds from the breakbeat continuum,
get
connected with the local breaks community and win tickets to SF's most
boundary-pushing clubs!

 
See you there!

Raves become all the rage

This is a rave; a phenomenon imported from Europe that in Mexico draws
legions of young
psycheros. They see themselves as modern hippies. They dance all night to
"psycho-trance"
music. And they consume lots of drugs such as ecstasy, LSD and
amphetamines, police say.

http://www.sun-sentinel.com/news/local/caribbean/sfl-hmexraves14aug14,1,3666860.story?coll=sfla-news-caribbean



Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do

the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.
It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well
can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when
we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U

From: max phillips <teknobuddha@juno.com>
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 900/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Gray Davis thugs try to surpress free speech



On Thu, 14 Aug 2003 07:35:36 -0700 "This Corrosion"
<slipstream341@yahoo.com> writes:

 "What is it about the left that makes them not like free speech?"
 
 http://cortana.typepad.com/rta/2003/08/gray_davis_thug.html

What does this disgusting insident have to do with liberals? 
Your right, these people were thugs and should be prosecuted for what
they did. But.... 
There is no proof that some "official" generic "liberal" committee
organized this thuggery, or that these certain individuals got their
orders to beat up people from a such committee (conspiracy theory
hypothesis).
No proof that the unions that these thugs belonged to endorsed this
behavior, 
and no proof Gray Davis personally knew of and supported this behavior as
well.

 Most likely this was an incident perpertrated by some over zellous
individuals claiming a union affiliation, not some organized effort by
the union(s) they belonged to, to beat up people. Most likely, a union or
unions did organize the demonstration, which they had a right to do so,
but did not endorse this behavior. This should be seen a problem with
certain individuals and that the unions these people belonged to need to
facillate some disiplinary action, and to attempt to stereotype all
unions with this kind of behavior is dishonest. Also, to claim that all
liberals thug on people we disagree with and that there is some liberal
conspiricy to deniy the free spech of the pro recall movement is going a
little to far with the facts. 
Do you have any documentation that "liberals" in their "official
platform" believe in thugging people and censoring free speech? 
I have plenty of doccumention of radical conservatives doing much worse
things. 
And, have you ever done any reading on the history of union busting? 

What is your beef about unions? You don't believe workers have a right to
organize to protect themselves from being abused by capitalism? Don't try
to skirt the issue with stories of Mafia ties and corruption in unions,
which does exist, but often exaggerated to attack unions. What is your
agenda here? To attack certain thugs and their behavior, or to attack
unions by stereotyping?

First, I wasn't there to see the whole story. News footages can only show
so much. We don't know all what happened before the cameras rolled. You
know, there is a excellent chance that it started off as a usual verbal
exchange when you have demonstrations and counter demonstrations
converging. Possibly, the verbal borages got nastier (see, we don't know
who incited who first?), tempers flared, and violence happened. Like I
said, I don't endorse this kind of  behavior, especially when a seven
year old kid get's hurt, but to look at this another way, we don't know
if the pro recall people were all that innocent in this incident either. 
Is this a case of the pool of vomit telling a pile of shit "you stink"!?
There is two sides to this story and we need to get to the bottom of this
and who ever got violent should be prosecuted, both the union people and
the pro recall people. Liberals have nothing to do with this.

The $4m of tax payers money going to fight the recall is legal and fair.
You didn't mention Issa's millions going to the recall, and Davis should
have no means to defend himself? He is a government official facing a
recall and as a government official, he has the right to have $4m to
defend himself. No different than the state paying for the defence of a
defendant in a trial, even if the person has guilt written all over him.
That's called having a fair trial, which is part of having a democracy.
Having $4m to compete is called having a fair election which is a part of
having a democracy as well.
Hey, I thought you were for democracy too?

Oh, you failed to mention the $66m price tag,so far, of tax payer's money
to hold this election, which the counties will have to bear most of it
and will have to cut more services to pay for.
So, let me get this right. The state should pay $66m, so far, to fund
your recall effort,
but Davis should get $0 of tax payer's money to defend himself?
Whose getting more screwed here?

I don't like Davis too much either, but I see this recall effort as
another sad example of Republicans never seeing a fair election (they
lost) that they liked, and usurping democracy again to get their way,
like they did in Florida in 2000.

Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^

bet 9 months from now there'll be lots of babies born

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) Quote of the Day (Thu)

did i ever tell you that back in college i took a television production class and we partnered up to do live 30 
minute television shows?  yep.  two cameras, a cg, a switcher, microphones, lighting, the whole shebang.  
ready one, take one.  ready two, take two.  

my partner, roger black, did a science fiction musical.  i did, (which probably won't surprise you) a star trek 
episode.  

and now, i bring you a great quote from a book that someone i know from Maine just pulled out.  

see you tomorrow!

 "What is it about the left that makes them not like free speech?"
 
 http://cortana.typepad.com/rta/2003/08/gray_davis_thug.html

What does this disgusting insident have to do with liberals? 
Your right, these people were thugs and should be prosecuted for what
they did. But.... 
There is no proof that some "official" generic "liberal" committee
organized this thuggery, or that these certain individuals got their
orders to beat up people from a such committee (conspiracy theory
hypothesis).
No proof that the unions that these thugs belonged to endorsed this
behavior, 
and no proof Gray Davis personally knew of and supported this behavior
as
well.

 Most likely this was an incident perpertrated by some over zellous
individuals claiming a union affiliation, not some organized effort by
the union(s) they belonged to, to beat up people. Most likely, a union
or
unions did organize the demonstration, which they had a right to do so,
but did not endorse this behavior. This should be seen a problem with
certain individuals and that the unions these people belonged to need to
facillate some disiplinary action, and to attempt to stereotype all
unions with this kind of behavior is dishonest. Also, to claim that all
liberals thug on people we disagree with and that there is some liberal
conspiricy to deniy the free spech of the pro recall movement is going a
little to far with the facts. 
Do you have any documentation that "liberals" in their "official
platform" believe in thugging people and censoring free speech? 
I have plenty of doccumention of radical conservatives doing much worse
things. 
And, have you ever done any reading on the history of union busting? 

What is your beef about unions? You don't believe workers have a right
to
organize to protect themselves from being abused by capitalism? Don't
try
to skirt the issue with stories of Mafia ties and corruption in unions,
which does exist, but often exaggerated to attack unions. What is your
agenda here? To attack certain thugs and their behavior, or to attack
unions by stereotyping?

First, I wasn't there to see the whole story. News footages can only
show
so much. We don't know all what happened before the cameras rolled. You
know, there is a excellent chance that it started off as a usual verbal
exchange when you have demonstrations and counter demonstrations
converging. Possibly, the verbal borages got nastier (see, we don't know
who incited who first?), tempers flared, and violence happened. Like I
said, I don't endorse this kind of  behavior, especially when a seven
year old kid get's hurt, but to look at this another way, we don't know
if the pro recall people were all that innocent in this incident either.

Is this a case of the pool of vomit telling a pile of shit "you stink"!?
There is two sides to this story and we need to get to the bottom of
this
and who ever got violent should be prosecuted, both the union people and
the pro recall people. Liberals have nothing to do with this.

The $4m of tax payers money going to fight the recall is legal and fair.
You didn't mention Issa's millions going to the recall, and Davis should
have no means to defend himself? He is a government official facing a
recall and as a government official, he has the right to have $4m to
defend himself. No different than the state paying for the defence of a
defendant in a trial, even if the person has guilt written all over him.
That's called having a fair trial, which is part of having a democracy.
Having $4m to compete is called having a fair election which is a part
of
having a democracy as well.
Hey, I thought you were for democracy too?

Oh, you failed to mention the $66m price tag,so far, of tax payer's
money
to hold this election, which the counties will have to bear most of it
and will have to cut more services to pay for.
So, let me get this right. The state should pay $66m, so far, to fund
your recall effort,
but Davis should get $0 of tax payer's money to defend himself?
Whose getting more screwed here?

I don't like Davis too much either, but I see this recall effort as
another sad example of Republicans never seeing a fair election (they
lost) that they liked, and usurping democracy again to get their way,
like they did in Florida in 2000.

Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^

From: <legba@roargroup.org>
To: <ElectroFunk138@hotmail.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 13, 2003 12:07 PM
Subject: FIGHT ANTI-MUSIC LAWS::NATIONAL PROTEST/PARTY 9/6/03


>
> ROAR!
> THE NATIONAL DANCE AND MUSIC RIGHTS ALLIANCE
> WWW.ROARGROUP.ORG
>
> ::POWER TO THE PEOPLE WHO PARTY::
>
> SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 6, 2003
> NOON TO MIDNIGHT
> DEMONSTRATION AT THE US CAPITOL
> AGAINST ANTI-MUSIC LAWS
>
> THE RAVE ACT HAS PASSED!
>
> Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean everyone's not out to get you.
>
> It's been a crazy couple of years for the Electronic Dance Music scene. On
top
> of the last decade of being targeted with raids, arrests, harassment,
> intimidation and smear campaigns, last summer saw the introduction of the
now-
> infamous RAVE Act. Passed in the spring, the law can fine promoters,
managers,
> or employees up to $500,000 and/or imprison them for 20 years for holding
an
> event where even a single person is arrested for narcotics--potentially
> shutting down events everywhere. This year, we are facing the CLEAN-UP Act
and
> the Ecstasy Awareness Act, both of which would impose far harsher
penalties.
>
> Last summer, well over a thousans descended US Capitol for ROAR! and
America's
> first ever party-as-protest. Other events have popped up in cities all
over the
> country--Seattle, NYC, LA, SF, Austin, Albequerque to name a few--marking
the
> start of an entire movement and bringing a whole generation to power.
>
> This summer join ROAR! and let's bring thousands to the US Capitol for a
free
> outdoor festival and protest against the continuing assault on music,
dancing
> and civil liberties. We will display the force and unity of our culture
through
> performances by international headlining talent, speakers from major
industry
> groups and politically influential organizations.
>
>
> EVENT INFORMATION
>
> UPPER SENATE PARK, US CAPITOL, WASHINGTON, DC
> Constitution Ave between New Jersey NW and Delaware Ave NE
>
> METRO ACCESSIBLE, 2 BLOCKS FROM UNION STATION. FOR BUS OR OTHER TRAVEL

> PLEASE EMAIL OR CALL!!

sole author of the state budget...

>the union(s) they belonged to, to beat up people. Most likely, a union
>or
>unions did organize the demonstration, which they had a right to do so,
>but did not endorse this behavior. This should be seen a problem with
>certain individuals and that the unions these people belonged to need to
>facillate some disiplinary action, and to attempt to stereotype all
>unions with this kind of behavior is dishonest. Also, to claim that all
>liberals thug on people we disagree with and that there is some liberal
>conspiricy to deniy the free spech of the pro recall movement is going a
>little to far with the facts.
>Do you have any documentation that "liberals" in their "official
>platform" believe in thugging people and censoring free speech?
>I have plenty of doccumention of radical conservatives doing much worse
>things.
>And, have you ever done any reading on the history of union busting?
>
>What is your beef about unions? You don't believe workers have a right
>to
>organize to protect themselves from being abused by capitalism? Don't
>try
>to skirt the issue with stories of Mafia ties and corruption in unions,
>which does exist, but often exaggerated to attack unions. What is your
>agenda here? To attack certain thugs and their behavior, or to attack
>unions by stereotyping?
>
>First, I wasn't there to see the whole story. News footages can only
>show
>so much. We don't know all what happened before the cameras rolled. You
>know, there is a excellent chance that it started off as a usual verbal
>exchange when you have demonstrations and counter demonstrations
>converging. Possibly, the verbal borages got nastier (see, we don't know
>who incited who first?), tempers flared, and violence happened. Like I
>said, I don't endorse this kind of  behavior, especially when a seven
>year old kid get's hurt, but to look at this another way, we don't know
>if the pro recall people were all that innocent in this incident either.
>
>Is this a case of the pool of vomit telling a pile of shit "you stink"!?
>There is two sides to this story and we need to get to the bottom of
>this
>and who ever got violent should be prosecuted, both the union people and
>the pro recall people. Liberals have nothing to do with this.
>
>The $4m of tax payers money going to fight the recall is legal and fair.
>You didn't mention Issa's millions going to the recall, and Davis should
>have no means to defend himself? He is a government official facing a
>recall and as a government official, he has the right to have $4m to
>defend himself. No different than the state paying for the defence of a
>defendant in a trial, even if the person has guilt written all over him.
>That's called having a fair trial, which is part of having a democracy.
>Having $4m to compete is called having a fair election which is a part
>of
>having a democracy as well.
>Hey, I thought you were for democracy too?
>
>Oh, you failed to mention the $66m price tag,so far, of tax payer's
>money
>to hold this election, which the counties will have to bear most of it
>and will have to cut more services to pay for.
>So, let me get this right. The state should pay $66m, so far, to fund
>your recall effort,
>but Davis should get $0 of tax payer's money to defend himself?
>Whose getting more screwed here?
>
>I don't like Davis too much either, but I see this recall effort as
>another sad example of Republicans never seeing a fair election (they
>lost) that they liked, and usurping democracy again to get their way,
>like they did in Florida in 2000.
>
>Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^

Interested in getting involved? Contact us as we are looking for performance artists, volunteers, promoters, cool attractions, visual artists, & anything that may benefit this years Cyberfestemail to info@coolworld.com. 

STAY TUNED TO: 
COOLWORLD.COM 
For all your event information and updates

> to

> try

> show

> recall and as a government official, he has the right to have $4m to
> defend himself. No different than the state paying for the defence of a
> defendant in a trial, even if the person has guilt written all over him.
> That's called having a fair trial, which is part of having a democracy.

> of

> Hey, I thought you were for democracy too?

> but Davis should get $0 of tax payer's money to defend himself?
> Whose getting more screwed here?

Friends & Fellow SF Ravers,

I am truly happy today, because in only 2 days is the opening night of =
progression @ 26 mix [ AUGUST 17th 2003 - @ 8pm ] . If you like the deep =
tribal/progressive vibe, with a dash of dirty sporadic breaks, than I =
can guarantee you'll will NOT want to miss this. For the opening night =
we are keeping the doors free and welcome everyone to join us....in =
fact, I may go so far as to say that if you do show up and are truly not =
enjoying yourself, you just are not feeling the vibe or the love and =
hard work that is gonna go into making this a good time, come locate 'ol =
jack himself and I will buy you a drink - I am that sure that you will =
enjoy yourself. There is gonna be no shakedowns at the door, no as*hole =
bouncers given you s**t for wearing hats, no rules against jeans and no =
haters on the floor. I can't think of a better way to close out your =
weekend.=20

This is an exclusive Sunday experience that will entail some serious =
tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks at one of the best, most =
intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.=20

This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory =
experience built around sound and dance. We are putting out a call for =
the masses to join our party, a temporal community where an attitude of=20
acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of our =
underground movement, with its roots founded on electronic music and our =
personal desire to expose it to everyone.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Raves become all the rage

   That would sound like a good idea. I always wondered where you could
have beach parties like they have in places like Goa in India, Ibizu
Spain, and Thailand here on this side of the world. I'm not sure why we
don't have such hang out's here, is it politics? Does it have anything to
do with any government on this side friendly to having a beach party
scene like Goa? Do they have them on that side of the world because this
is more of a European scene?
 We have to remember that places like Mexico is swarming with DEA, and
I'm sure if there was a Goa style beach party colony going on in Mexico,
or even in places like Costa Rica or Brazil that would be perfect places,
the DEA would pressure Mexico and any host country to shut it down
because of drug use. Another nasy aspect of the drug war and why we need
to get political! The US has pretty much control of things on this side
of the world, and wouldn't stand for such a scene happening here. What
about Jamaica? Too dangerous and you could get 10-20 years there for
using drugs. That pretty much goes for about all Caribbean countries.
Most of them are former British colonies and still have old Victorian
laws on the books, especially about sexuality.
Maybe I'm all wrong, but you have places like Baja that would be another
perfect place for such a scene, but we don't have one even there. Maybe
because of the reasons I mentioned. I'm sure it was tried before, and the
response was if you do, there will be plenty of room in Mexican jails,
and the US will make sure that would happen. Another way it could be done
is through making friends with drug lords and using bribery, and I don't
want to even be near a party like that!  But there is one more thought
about having a Ibizu style colony, is the enviromental damage. Would the
beaches of the Mayan Riveria and the clear waters of the Caribbean be
destroyed with such an influx of people? Beach parties are very
environmentally destructive and that could be another reason we don't
have beach parties here.
 But if someone can pull it off and such parties could be safe to go to,
I'd be so there!
Peace, Bodhi ^ _ ^

At 01:09 PM 8/15/2003 -0700, Omid Tavallai wrote:

>Actually...
>
>         http://www.snopes.com/pregnant/blackout.htm
>
>Just more urban legend. Blackouts don't cause baby booms :)
>

But, as I recall from the blackout in NYC in 1977, there IS lots of 
sex...at least there was from my perspective.  Also, as pointed out in the 
"Oral History of Hip-Hop's First Decade," many DJs of the time got their 
first turntables and other equipment in the looting that ensued.

Love,

Apollo

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

>than I can guarantee you'll will NOT want to miss this. For the 
>opening night we are keeping the doors free and welcome everyone to 
>join us....in fact, I may go so far as to say that if you do show up 
>and are truly not enjoying yourself, you just are not feeling the vibe 
>or the love and hard work that is gonna go into making this a good 
>time, come locate 'ol jack himself and I will buy you a drink - I am 
>that sure that you will enjoy yourself. There is gonna be no 
>shakedowns at the door, no as*hole bouncers given you s**t for wearing 
>hats, no rules against jeans and no haters on the floor. I can't think 
>of a better way to close out your weekend. 
>
>This is an exclusive Sunday experience that will entail some serious 
>tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks at one of the best, most 
>intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix. 
>
>This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory 
>experience built around sound and dance. We are putting out a call for 
>the masses to join our party, a temporal community where an attitude 
>of 
>acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of 
>our underground movement, with its roots founded on electronic music 
>and our personal desire to expose it to everyone.
>

Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org

From: "Brynne and Hernan" <cortezco@pacbell.net>
To: "Sfraves" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Date: Fri, 15 Aug 2003 16:26:09 -0700
Message-ID: <IEEMJLJJCOJJJEAEDMNAIEOAFDAA.cortezco@pacbell.net>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook IMO, Build 9.0.2416 (9.0.2910.0)
Importance: Normal
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V5.50.4133.2400
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] (NRR) Hippie culture

Haight-Ashbury
By Denis Mueller

The "hippies" of the 1960s did not come out of nowhere. They 
were the descendants of the "beats" of the previous generation. 
People like the poet Allen Ginsberg moved quite easily from 
the "beat generation" to the counter-culture of the 1960s. The 
counter-culture is often confused with the New Left, but they 
held an uneasy alliance. In fact, it was SDS who invaded the 
communes of the Liberation News Service and ransacked one of 
the more cultural enclaves of the movement. 

The hippies rejected the cultural norms of middle class society 
and rebelled against its norm and turning convention on its 
head while using guerrilla theater as a means of protest. They 
were more interested in dropping out of the rat race than 
reforming it but retained a anarchist streak that often 
promoted spontaneous actions by the hippies. It was a movement 
that sought a utopia that put them within other utopian 
alternatives of living, which are very much in the American 
tradition.
 

The hippies wanted to live the revolution as if it had been 
won, rather than join organized political campaigns. They were 
more into, a phrase from the day, in creating an 'alternative 
world'. Their politics were more tied to groups like the 
"Diggers", who provided free food to the residents of the 
Haight, than the bomb-throwing tactics of the "Weathermen". 
They became targets for the police shakedowns and, while they 
saw the man as an oppressor, they wanted the police to leave 
them alone and let them live their lives. 

The world of the hippies was also tied to drugs, mostly pot 
and LSD, but not limited to those drugs. They saw LSD, and pot 
to a lesser extent, as mind alternating drugs that could raise 
the consciousness of people. It is, in retrospect, quite 
interesting that LSD was first developed as a mind-control 
program for the Army and CIA. But, back then, it was thought 
that acid could free your mind from the constraints of society.
  
 

Rock music played an important role in the development of this 
youth culture. When the Beatles arrived in America, the seed 
for this culture was planted. They were a force unlike the 
music of the previous decade and soon rock groups began to 
flourish across the country. The Beatles were followed by the 
Rolling Stones, the Animals, the Kinks, the Who and Jimmy 
Hendrix, who was from Seattle but became part of the English 
invasion. In America, groups like the Greatful Dead, The 
Jeffersom Airplane, the Doors and the Lovin Spoonful drew their 
support directly from these alternative pockets of culture.

The flight to the suburbs in the 1950s left many areas, with 
spacious housing, available to the young people. These cheap 
rents in the Haight or on New York's lower east side allowed 
the hippies to live on very little money. It was a generation 
that sought to remove themselves from the dominant culture and 
create their own world. In the end, it failed and was over-
whelmed by the drug culture. But it was an act of resistance 
that sought a way out of the rat race and for a better world. 
That it wasn't is not the point, but it should be remembered 
that there were people who tried to resist the dominant 
consumer culture.

1968, Robert Daniels


---------------------------------------------------------------------

Subject: Re: [sfraves] ~*LIQUID 3*~ FRIDAY.OCTOBER.24th.2003 (* 15 DJs*)(XTORT)*BSP*

Really, depending on what kind of Chicago house your talking about, if your 
into that bangin' sheit you'll be more than happy with Jak. My man 
mixing-wise is hands down the most technicly talented TECHNO deejay based on 
the West coast. He drops so many tracks but actually mixes them, 
LOOOONNNNGGGGG mixes, short tracks, never a dull moment and you'll hardly 
ever hear just one track playing alone. In my opinion it hard to compare 
ANYONE to Misstress Barbara but so far, Jak has come the closest to that 
sort of performance deejaying in my travels.

Honestly he's pretty much the only reason I'll be there... Plus I always 
gotta support my boy Sascha 23. Even if I still cant get with trance or NRG 
(never will BTW).

Vivenite's "System" ... coming soon.

Subject: [sfraves] Warm Air and Base Beats [a poem]

------=_NextPart_000_0106_01C3634C.6E69AEF0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

boom
boom
boom
boom
base beats bounce of the walls of a non descript warehouse
in the darkened corners of this urban underground
where a new light emerges
from spaces that have grown quiet
a new culture of sound, music, and dance is born
and on nights like these we gather under rays of artificial rainbows
moving to hypnotic hits and mesmerizing melodies

my feet follow their path of fight in fours:
up off the ground, turn, back down again, and up
fueled by the air condensing moving through me
as the beats become part of
become part of what sustains me
until there's nothing else around me
and its just me and the DJ
and time means nothing
as the clock strikes 1:00
and time means nothing
as the clock strikes 2:00
and time means nothing
as the clock strikes 3:00
and time means nothing
as the clock strikes 4:00
and there's still people on the dance floor
moving as the sun rises over San Francisco
as the day begins our day has yet to end

sweat pours down my face
my legs are numb
and as I move my arms in time with rhythmic subtleties=20
I am more than me
I am everything and for just one moment the world
stops

boom

boom

boom

boom

and I see everyone around me
everyone from the glowing pacifier welding candy kids
to the fallen angles in spaghetti straps and silver cargo pants
from the jaded clubbers
to the suburban teenagers
form the 17 year olds just looking for something to do on a Friday
to the 35 year olds just looking for an excuse to stay up all night

an they're all here together dancing
as the world out side brew it's morning coffee
here inside we brew a mixture of base and sweat
stirred by swaying bodies and heated to a boiling point

we cheer as the DJ plays that final track
to remind us that it's 6:00am
and we have the greatest counter culture to ever grace the earth
that we can more alive here then we can ever imagine being as sales =
associates
waiters, clerks, or secretaries
but if we ever want to get back here
and feel like we've been reborn as warm air and base beats
all we have to do is
boom boom
all we have to do is
boom boom
all we have to do is
boom boom boom boom
dance


------------------------------

Peace,
Mystic

-[http://www.lostways.com]-

------=_NextPart_000_0106_01C3634C.6E69AEF0--

Subject: [sfraves] Rave Scene Hits a new Low!!!

Well I just got back from seeing Freddy Vs. Jason and that movie is Damn 
funny with all the bad acting TnA action and all.. But what was really low 
is one of the Main Scenes is where all the Elm street kids are at a "Rave" 
in a cornfield and they play up the glowstick craze real well. I won't give 
to much more away on the bad plot for those that may be seeing it shortly. 
But I guess it isn't any different then seeing a "Rave" scene on 90210 or 
Dawsons creek or any other pubscent teenie bop flick.


oh well..

Subject: [sfraves] SFR Calendar: August 15, 2003 

Illumination means that the delusory distinction between the two shores of
a worldly and transcendental existence no longer holds.

It is not the answer that enlightens, but the question.

A man's true wealth is the good he does in the world. Beauty is eternity
gazing at itself in a mirror. But you are eternity and you are the mirror.
- Kahlil Gibran

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** Manifest **

MYSTIC FAMILY CIRCUS and YOGATAICHI COLLECTIVE presents:  MANIFEST

A fundraiser for our camp at Burning Man 2003. At the magical Noodle
Factory in West Oakland Friday 15th August; 9pm- 4am

DJs: CB, Moondoggy, Trinity, Shawna, Rockar-T, Muse, and Platurn playing;
break beats, hip-hop, reggae/ dancehall and down tempo in two rooms.
Opening ceremony by Tekeba BANTU. Performances by Mystic Family Circus,
including the Mandala Prayer, the Bird Bride and more. Bonus performances
by Suga, Burning Man Opera Omphalos Project, Lucid Dawn and more.

Tasty treats, chocalate truffles by Phillippe, massage by Sherry and crew,
Kissing Booth, visuals by Ninka,Sherry and CB, Gypsy Fortune-telling by
Ginny, Fantasy Circus Portraits by David Houston, Altars, video screening
of "Silence of Sex", featuring Aima "Yams", arts and crafts booths, and
much much more. Bring your beautiful creative self, drums and whatever
else you want to share.  If you are interested in vending or want driving
directions/information: 415-2677634. Tickets are $5 before 10pm, and
$10-$20 afterwards.

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** Max Graham @ Ten 15 Folsom **

Euphoria Dreams & Spundae Presents: Origin @ Ten 15 Folsom
Mainroom: Spundae Presents: Max Graham with opening set by Gianni
Bassment: Dead Dan Ismael Rodriguez Cyber Joe
VIP Lounge: Eladio Raoul Kahn Atimatik
Frontroom: Rafeal Fiero

In 2001, as Kinetic records announced they chose the relatively unknown
Max Graham to mix the fourth installment of the Transport mix CD, the
music industry listened.  That year saw Max hit #23 in the coveted DJ
Magazine Top 100 - the highest new entry. While Nick Warren proclaimed Max
was going to be a worldwide success after hearing just a taste of his
production work, Paul Oakenfold himself called and invited the artist to
join him on tour dates through the US to Ibiza after hearing him play just
once. Location: 1015 Folsom St., San Francisco Doors: 10pm-6am, 21+ w/ID
only Cover: $20 door/$15 presale Info: www.euphoriadreams.com;
415.431.1200

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D662 Sa=
n
Francisco California, USA

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** The Summit: Slow Burning Sound **

This Friday, Massive Selector have something extra curious for you,
concocting a mixed potion of Jamaican and AfroLatin-influenced music from
east to west, from north to south. Upstairs, we^=D2re going to have roots
reggae, old school dancehall, reggae in dub, and dub house to take you
through the different neighborhoods of Jamaican-influenced music.
Downstairs, it^=D2s all about the basement party soundsystem! The main room
downstairs will be bumping with all night of hiphop, dancehall, and funk
to make you uprock, bounce, step, salsa, freak...whatever your style.
With:  * J. Boogie (OM Records),

altering, jazz... Saturday August 16th 2003 directions Punch Gallery 155
10th st. SF, Ca. 90sec. Dance Contest! Re-introducing the 90sec. dance
contest. It's all fun, step up and rock your body to your favorite
rhythms. You'll be amazed at how much
supercalifragilisticexpialidocious-dance-dancing can happen in 90 seconds.

on show. You have 90sec. to take over the dance floor. 530pm:  Dance

rhythm and natural movement, into dynamic moves and creativity - Ten"
urban dance is challenging, exciting and fun art form (quadmag.com/ten)

Sunday, August 17, 2003 ** Progression **

As unique as the progressive genre itself, enuriye productions launches
'Progression'. This is an exclusive Sunday experience that will entail
some serious tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks at one of the
best, most intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.

This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory
experience built around sound and dance. We are putting out a call for the
masses to join our party, a temporal community where an attitude of
acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of our
underground movement, with its roots founded on electronic music and our
personal desire to expose it to everyone.Join our family and experience
what an awesome year it has been musically for our DJ^=D2s of this
up-and-coming progressive collective. Every 3rd Sunday 26 Mix 3024 Mission
St. San Francisco Ca. 94117 info: enuriye@hotmail.com jack@jacktriumph.com

we can make to help insure that the children in this area have what they
need to go to school this year with confidence.

-------------------------------------------------
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

SFRaves serves the greater SF Bay Area, but reaches
beyond the local scene to all corners of the Terra Firma -
thanks to everyone whose support of and contribution to
the SFRAVES.org community - locally --> to both poles
---> to all points along the equator ---> as well as each
longitude and latitude perspective that makes this beautiful
place we know as Earth our home.

Please notify me regarding new events, event changes,
deprecated event information, or any other information
pertaining to events in the greater SF Bay Area and beyond.

I look forward to hearing from you @ karina@hyperreal.org

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

Faithfully yours,
-- Karina --
karina@hyperreal.org

**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************
**************************************************************

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** Manifest **

MYSTIC FAMILY CIRCUS and YOGATAICHI COLLECTIVE presents:  MANIFEST

A fundraiser for our camp at Burning Man 2003. At the magical Noodle
Factory in West Oakland Friday 15th August; 9pm- 4am

DJs: CB, Moondoggy, Trinity, Shawna, Rockar-T, Muse, and Platurn playing;
break beats, hip-hop, reggae/ dancehall and down tempo in two rooms.

including the Mandala Prayer, the Bird Bride and more. Bonus performances
by Suga, Burning Man Opera Omphalos Project, Lucid Dawn and more.

Tasty treats, chocalate truffles by Phillippe, massage by Sherry and crew,
Kissing Booth, visuals by Ninka,Sherry and CB, Gypsy Fortune-telling by
Ginny, Fantasy Circus Portraits by David Houston, Altars, video screening
of "Silence of Sex", featuring Aima "Yams", arts and crafts booths, and
much much more. Bring your beautiful creative self, drums and whatever
else you want to share.  If you are interested in vending or want driving
directions/information: 415-2677634. Tickets are $5 before 10pm, and
$10-$20 afterwards.

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** Max Graham @ Ten 15 Folsom **

Euphoria Dreams & Spundae Presents: Origin @ Ten 15 Folsom
Mainroom: Spundae Presents: Max Graham with opening set by Gianni
Bassment: Dead Dan Ismael Rodriguez Cyber Joe
VIP Lounge: Eladio Raoul Kahn Atimatik
Frontroom: Rafeal Fiero

In 2001, as Kinetic records announced they chose the relatively unknown
Max Graham to mix the fourth installment of the Transport mix CD, the
music industry listened.  That year saw Max hit #23 in the coveted DJ
Magazine Top 100 - the highest new entry. While Nick Warren proclaimed Max
was going to be a worldwide success after hearing just a taste of his
production work, Paul Oakenfold himself called and invited the artist to
join him on tour dates through the US to Ibiza after hearing him play just
once. Location: 1015 Folsom St., San Francisco Doors: 10pm-6am, 21+ w/ID
only Cover: $20 door/$15 presale Info: www.euphoriadreams.com;
415.431.1200

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D662 Sa=
n

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** The Summit: Slow Burning Sound **

concocting a mixed potion of Jamaican and AfroLatin-influenced music from
east to west, from north to south. Upstairs, we^=D2re going to have roots
reggae, old school dancehall, reggae in dub, and dub house to take you
through the different neighborhoods of Jamaican-influenced music.
Downstairs, it^=D2s all about the basement party soundsystem! The main room
downstairs will be bumping with all night of hiphop, dancehall, and funk
to make you uprock, bounce, step, salsa, freak...whatever your style.

Sunday, August 17, 2003 ** Progression **

As unique as the progressive genre itself, enuriye productions launches
'Progression'. This is an exclusive Sunday experience that will entail
some serious tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks at one of the
best, most intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.

This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory
experience built around sound and dance. We are putting out a call for the
masses to join our party, a temporal community where an attitude of
acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of our
underground movement, with its roots founded on electronic music and our
personal desire to expose it to everyone.Join our family and experience
what an awesome year it has been musically for our DJ^=D2s of this
up-and-coming progressive collective. Every 3rd Sunday 26 Mix 3024 Mission
St. San Francisco Ca. 94117 info: enuriye@hotmail.com jack@jacktriumph.com
925-577-4311 510-697-7790 with DJ's DJ Jack Triumph (enuriye, KZSU Radio,
Frisky Radio, Qo=F6l DJ Mike Ward (enuriye, BoardStock, Paragon Lounge).

Sunday, August 31, 2003 ** RCP West presents Free Day Party **

Carlos Alfonso - DJ OrionZ - DJ James Dub - DJ Sound Sorcerer, DJ Felipe
Avelar - DJ Frequency - Captain Nemo - DJ Molly Mush; More performers
expected, so check our webpage for updates!  This event for all ages will
last from 10 AM till Dusk at a Santa Clara Count park with plenty of shade
to help keep everybody cool. No concessions will be sold at this party, so
everybody is encouraged to bring their food and drink, although there will
be grills onsite for those that want to BBQ--make sure to bring the
charcoal and burgers! RCP West is also collecting school supplies and new
or used school age clothing (in good condition) to benefit those in need
as school nears. We feel that this is a small but important gesture that
we can make to help insure that the children in this area have what they
need to go to school this year with confidence.

-------------------------------------------------
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

SFRaves serves the greater SF Bay Area, but reaches
beyond the local scene to all corners of the Terra Firma -
thanks to everyone whose support of and contribution to
the SFRAVES.org community - locally --> to both poles
---> to all points along the equator ---> as well as each
longitude and latitude perspective that makes this beautiful
place we know as Earth our home.

Please notify me regarding new events, event changes,
deprecated event information, or any other information
pertaining to events in the greater SF Bay Area and beyond.

I look forward to hearing from you @ karina@hyperreal.org

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

Faithfully yours,
-- Karina --
karina@hyperreal.org

**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************
**************************************************************

funny with all the bad acting TnA action and all.. But what was really low
is one of the Main Scenes is where all the Elm street kids are at a "Rave"
in a cornfield and they play up the glowstick craze real well. I won't give
to much more away on the bad plot for those that may be seeing it shortly.
But I guess it isn't any different then seeing a "Rave" scene on 90210 or
Dawsons creek or any other pubscent teenie bop flick.


oh well..

Subject: [sfraves] SFR Calendar: August 15, 2003 

Illumination means that the delusory distinction between the two shores of
a worldly and transcendental existence no longer holds.

It is not the answer that enlightens, but the question.

A man's true wealth is the good he does in the world. Beauty is eternity
gazing at itself in a mirror. But you are eternity and you are the mirror.
- Kahlil Gibran

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** Manifest **

MYSTIC FAMILY CIRCUS and YOGATAICHI COLLECTIVE presents:  MANIFEST

A fundraiser for our camp at Burning Man 2003. At the magical Noodle
Factory in West Oakland Friday 15th August; 9pm- 4am

DJs: CB, Moondoggy, Trinity, Shawna, Rockar-T, Muse, and Platurn playing;
break beats, hip-hop, reggae/ dancehall and down tempo in two rooms.
Opening ceremony by Tekeba BANTU. Performances by Mystic Family Circus,
including the Mandala Prayer, the Bird Bride and more. Bonus performances
by Suga, Burning Man Opera Omphalos Project, Lucid Dawn and more.

Tasty treats, chocalate truffles by Phillippe, massage by Sherry and crew,
Kissing Booth, visuals by Ninka,Sherry and CB, Gypsy Fortune-telling by
Ginny, Fantasy Circus Portraits by David Houston, Altars, video screening
of "Silence of Sex", featuring Aima "Yams", arts and crafts booths, and
much much more. Bring your beautiful creative self, drums and whatever
else you want to share.  If you are interested in vending or want driving
directions/information: 415-2677634. Tickets are $5 before 10pm, and
$10-$20 afterwards.

And Cyber Joe. Vip Lounge: (House) Eladio, Raoul Kahn, And Atimatik.

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** Max Graham @ Ten 15 Folsom **

Euphoria Dreams & Spundae Presents: Origin @ Ten 15 Folsom
Mainroom: Spundae Presents: Max Graham with opening set by Gianni
Bassment: Dead Dan Ismael Rodriguez Cyber Joe
VIP Lounge: Eladio Raoul Kahn Atimatik
Frontroom: Rafeal Fiero

In 2001, as Kinetic records announced they chose the relatively unknown
Max Graham to mix the fourth installment of the Transport mix CD, the
music industry listened.  That year saw Max hit #23 in the coveted DJ
Magazine Top 100 - the highest new entry. While Nick Warren proclaimed Max
was going to be a worldwide success after hearing just a taste of his
production work, Paul Oakenfold himself called and invited the artist to
join him on tour dates through the US to Ibiza after hearing him play just
once. Location: 1015 Folsom St., San Francisco Doors: 10pm-6am, 21+ w/ID
only Cover: $20 door/$15 presale Info: www.euphoriadreams.com;
415.431.1200

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D662 Sa=
n
Francisco California, USA

Friday, August 15, 2003 ** The Summit: Slow Burning Sound **

This Friday, Massive Selector have something extra curious for you,
concocting a mixed potion of Jamaican and AfroLatin-influenced music from
east to west, from north to south. Upstairs, we^=D2re going to have roots
reggae, old school dancehall, reggae in dub, and dub house to take you
through the different neighborhoods of Jamaican-influenced music.
Downstairs, it^=D2s all about the basement party soundsystem! The main room
downstairs will be bumping with all night of hiphop, dancehall, and funk
to make you uprock, bounce, step, salsa, freak...whatever your style.
With:  * J. Boogie (OM Records),
 * Rasta Cue (Various Blends), * Tomas (XLR8R), * Rueben (Musica).

Saturday, August 16, 2003 ** Blue **

On Saturday August 16th from 12pm-2am Nite Life Entertainment will have
its 1st ever pool party at the Park Plaza Hotel in San Jose, CA.  Come
party pool side and listen to the sounds of Chris Fenton, MJ Gamez, Armann
the Brainchild, Roger Moorehouse, Ivan Bautista and many other DJ's
spinning the best in House music.  Dont forget to book your room for $59
which will include to tickets to the "Blue"  Party!!  Park Plaza hotel
located at 1355 N. Fourth Street in San Jose, CA.  Call 408-453-5340 and
mention the Blue Party for your discount room rate.  For more information
log onto www.getanitelife.com 21 and over please.  Dont miss this 1st ever
pool party brought to you by Nite Life Entertainment!!

Saturday, August 16, 2003 ** FabFresh **

FabFresh hiphop, breakdance, housedance, capoeira, locking, popping,
altering, jazz... Saturday August 16th 2003 directions Punch Gallery 155
10th st. SF, Ca. 90sec. Dance Contest! Re-introducing the 90sec. dance
contest. It's all fun, step up and rock your body to your favorite
rhythms. You'll be amazed at how much
supercalifragilisticexpialidocious-dance-dancing can happen in 90 seconds.
Objective wow the crowd and win over the judges, what ever you got, put it
on show. You have 90sec. to take over the dance floor. 530pm:  Dance
Workshop (poster) with TeN, a unique class sharing fundamentals from
house,breaking, hiphop and raw urban movement, "I like to develop your
rhythm and natural movement, into dynamic moves and creativity - Ten"
urban dance is challenging, exciting and fun art form (quadmag.com/ten)
Dance Performances: organized movement rhythmically enhanced with Bay
Areas top dance crews. 7pm: Get your feet dancing music Hip Hop, Classics
and House sounds Kevin Koga (nulife sf), Infinit (Hawaii) & Chris Montel
(nulife sf). 7pm-2am | first 50 people in the door at $5 | $10 after so
get in early! pre-register email ten@flo-ology.com info: ten@flo-ology.com
| www.punchgallery.com | www.soullebrity.com | www.flo-ology.com |

Sunday, August 17, 2003 ** Progression **

As unique as the progressive genre itself, enuriye productions launches
'Progression'. This is an exclusive Sunday experience that will entail
some serious tribal/progressive madness rocking the decks at one of the
best, most intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.

This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory
experience built around sound and dance. We are putting out a call for the
masses to join our party, a temporal community where an attitude of
acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of our
underground movement, with its roots founded on electronic music and our
personal desire to expose it to everyone.Join our family and experience
what an awesome year it has been musically for our DJ^=D2s of this
up-and-coming progressive collective. Every 3rd Sunday 26 Mix 3024 Mission
St. San Francisco Ca. 94117 info: enuriye@hotmail.com jack@jacktriumph.com
925-577-4311 510-697-7790 with DJ's DJ Jack Triumph (enuriye, KZSU Radio,
Frisky Radio, Qo=F6l DJ Mike Ward (enuriye, BoardStock, Paragon Lounge).

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D689 Sa=
n
Francisco CA. California, USA

Sunday, August 31, 2003 ** RCP West presents Free Day Party **

Carlos Alfonso - DJ OrionZ - DJ James Dub - DJ Sound Sorcerer, DJ Felipe
Avelar - DJ Frequency - Captain Nemo - DJ Molly Mush; More performers
expected, so check our webpage for updates!  This event for all ages will
last from 10 AM till Dusk at a Santa Clara Count park with plenty of shade
to help keep everybody cool. No concessions will be sold at this party, so
everybody is encouraged to bring their food and drink, although there will
be grills onsite for those that want to BBQ--make sure to bring the
charcoal and burgers! RCP West is also collecting school supplies and new
or used school age clothing (in good condition) to benefit those in need
as school nears. We feel that this is a small but important gesture that
we can make to help insure that the children in this area have what they
need to go to school this year with confidence.

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events/view?identifier=3D709 SF
Bay Area California, USA

-------------------------------------------------
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

SFRaves serves the greater SF Bay Area, but reaches
beyond the local scene to all corners of the Terra Firma -
thanks to everyone whose support of and contribution to
the SFRAVES.org community - locally --> to both poles
---> to all points along the equator ---> as well as each
longitude and latitude perspective that makes this beautiful
place we know as Earth our home.

Please notify me regarding new events, event changes,
deprecated event information, or any other information
pertaining to events in the greater SF Bay Area and beyond.

I look forward to hearing from you @ karina@hyperreal.org

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.

To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or
sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

Faithfully yours,
-- Karina --
karina@hyperreal.org

**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<**********************
If there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so
much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] :c code review pt 2!!

OK... so when Wolanda & I got in, Amber was hard on workin' on her mad scientist set & bustin' out all this Bad Ass Fuckn' Techno!  I mean... I coulda sworn I heard a few acid tracks here & there... but I dunno... I was still confussed @ that point... la la la

Wolando right away got her groove on & strait became the mistress on the floor!  Then Tek gave her a hoola hoop & she was hula hooping on beat!!  She's fuckin' Dope man!!!

Oh Oh Oh... then Matt Nee went on after Amber... OK... so like I was on the computer checkin' my fster acct & some Dude walks up 2 the comp & said, "Dude... you're like on friendster too, huh?"  LoL  So me & this Dude like talk talk talk 4 heeeeeeeella long about how Dope fster is & how it changed our lives & all those other fster wanna be sites (tribe, everyonesconnected) jus' fuckin' suck!!  Then we added each other 2 each others list & it was Dope!!  So YAY!! I met a friendster who became my fster in lilke 1/2 an hour!

Actually... it happened twoce that night... through Danny P... I made another friendster @ the club!!!  YAAAAAAAAY!!!

Anyways... so Matt & I talked & I was getting kinda ansty so I like told him 2 like go & dance & I"m sorry if I was hoggin' up his time... la la la... 'cause I soo wanted 2 get back 2 fster.. anywaze... he bust out behind the decks & started spinning!!!  It was Dope!!  I mean... I wanna sayt he spun like this minimalistic kinda Tachno @ 1st I guess... them he went 2 kinda harder stuff!!!  I liked it alot!!

But it was hard 'cause like Micron & Lick The DJ were spinning up stairs also!!  Hello 2Day... & they like totally started spinning this like this Housey Techno-ie kinda Acid stuff @ 1st & it was Dope!!  I mean... I was totally groovin'!

Then it all went like towards the end of the set... ACID TRANCE in like full force!!  I Loved it!!!

Then in that room like upstairs...grrr.. I dunno who it was but they totally started spining acid break beats & ooooooh my gosh.. I Loved it!

Downstairs... there was this oh gosh... I dunno how 2 define what it was... but it was this bad ass Live PA from ?Hesio? & oooh man... I mean... I wanna say like Housey Techno maybe???  Teck House???  It was Dope!!!

LoL... it's been a few months since I seen Micro so it was Dope all catchin' up w/ Homeboy!!  Oh oh oh... yeah... I got 2 lick the DJs 'cause well.... it was Lick the Micron & Lick the DJ... so I did... they were kinda tastey!!  Micron had like this Orange Sherbert flav & Lick tasted like Neopolitain!  

The last set down stair was Shane & this Dude doin' this fuckin' AWESOME JUNGLE SET!!!  I LOVED LOVED IT!  I had the best time dancing  during that set!!!

Alota people did pop up!!!  It was awesome seein' NomadicDJ there!! =)  We may both graduate from UOP @ the same time!!!  Groovy!  Oh Gosh... so many people showed up... Family!!!  Awesome Groovy Fuckin' Vibe!!!  I had the best time!!!  I was tired as fuck @ work earlier 2Day... but it was well worth it! =)

Hello 2Day... I used "I" & "work" in the same sentence... whoooo... I got gitters in my spin when I reread that!  LoL

Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

rekkids, and try to keep up with the list again =)

been missing at future parties, and hopefully at the
last Code ever :,|  Also, I've gotten a new job at the
new Bose store in Stanford Shopping Centre,so you
allshould come down and visit me (and add some
excitement to my day).  Oh yea, and the store, i
think, is looking for a part timer, so if anyone wants
come by and ask for an application.  It's a very chill
job.  

Cheerio!

	boundary="----=_NextPart_000_0225_01C3638E.96FBDC20"

X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V5.00.2615.200
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] short review: aural confection (Thursday at the Oasis)

------=_NextPart_000_0225_01C3638E.96FBDC20
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

What the hell, is there anything going on tonight? (Friday)

It really doesn't matter, I had such a good time last night at the =
Oasis, where I go on Thursday nights because it is convenient (downtown =
Oakland).

They usually have house music on this night.

I'm not crazy about house, but I just like to dance close to home and =
support local establishments in the East Bay (esp. when they have DJs =
spinning records).

Anyway, it was a treat last night because they had live PA to accompany =
the house music, only it wasn't a "rapper", instead it was a sexy =
saxophone player. A very musical dancing experience, indeed. I totally =
enjoyed the ambience of the alto sax.

But I don't know who was playing. I just noticed that he seemed nervous =
at first, even with the small crowd. That's a natural reaction when you =
are doing a live performance. All I know is that I wanted to dance to =
show my appreciation, which I did.

This guy was good--no mess-ups in the sound. (woodwinds can be difficult =
to play--they "squeak")

It brought back memories of my childhood when Mom paid for music lessons =
and I used my uncle's hand-me-down saxophone to learn how to play in the =
school orchestra, and to march in the band (football season).

The Oasis is always full of surprises--just last week they had a fashion =
show to accompany the music.=20

Check it out, if you get a chance, and since they like to have weekly =
parties, watch your local flyers.

Last night, someone told me that on Sunday one of the guys from the =
Wicked crew will be spinning.

Greg VP

------=_NextPart_000_0225_01C3638E.96FBDC20--

Subject: [sfraves] incognito nrr

--0-1033569905-1061054413=:11686
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

so, i went out last night, incognito, of course, and here is what i have to report: everything was loud, there was lots of cheapo lingerie and ugly porn, but the floors were clean...guys who aren't really lifetime wino's, meaning they shower and sleep indoors as a general rule, 
were having to take breaks to sit on the sidewalk outside, because they couldn't stand up straight...someone offered me cash for sex.....got my picture taken.....didn't listen to the music, as loud as it all was...was too busy thinking about peter frampton singing, "do you, you! feel like 
i do? do you, you! feel like i do...woke up this morning, with a wine glass in my hand...who's wine? what wine? where the hell did i dine? must have been a dream...i can't believe where i've been! come on! let's do it again! do you, you! feel like i do? how you feel? do you, you! feel like i do!"......that song is 
well before pretty much anyone's party life, but it can be your party life song too...trust me...go listen to it, and get drunk, if you must...okay, back to my evening...picked up a souvenir, of course, so now i sparkle again...gotta please myself in the midst of all that romantic as hell judgement 
and potential prostition and such...tried to walk past a series of partiers unnoticed to use the restroom...made it, but almost got nabbed by someone who woke up momentarily, so i picked up the pace, and that put a stop to that....lots of really cool lights..i'm into lights....:)
