NEWS=20

Deep and Dark Recordings Upcoming Release by Neurotron - Texture of you will=
=20
be hitting stores near you in September. This release is one of the most=20
anticipated albums as it being the first release of Deep and Dark Recordings=
 USA.=20
If you would like more information on the release please visit <A HREF=3D"ht=
tp://www.neurotron-music.com/releases.html">
http://www.neurotron-music.com/releases.html</A>=A0 or <A HREF=3D"www.deepan=
ddark.com">www.deepanddark.com</A>.=A0 If you would like to=20
buy the CD please send all inquiries to monk7923@aol.com. This CD is going t=
o be=20
must have for anyone.=20
Sept 2003

<A HREF=3D"http://www.neurotron-music.com/releases.html">DeepGer001</A>
Neurotron-Texture of you
full length album=20


Neurotron

The heads of Neurotron, Axel Schuh and Andr=E9 Kroenert were born in 1978 in=
=20
Guestrow, a small very old city in the north-east of Germany. Since school t=
hey=20
hung around together and developed their love for electronic music by hearin=
g=20
EBM, Industrial, Experimental and Acid-House. After many great and wonderful=
=20
partys and moments with this music they decided to produce such music by=20
themselves. In 1995 Andre started to work as DJ Phrase. Later he brought the=
=20
self-made sound to the dance floors outside the live acts of Neurotron as Le=
 Dub=20
Dwell. In 1995/96 they bought a Roland MC-202 and a 606. Little later a 909=20=
and a=20
whole depot of synthesizers, effect tools and samplers and started to perfor=
m=20
live acts as Yakusa in Guestrow, Rostock and Kiel. At first the sound was=20
realy hard grooving Detroit-Techno, influenced by artists like Plasticman, U=
R,=20
Cybotron, Stacey Pullen & Aphex Twin. Later they begun to use laptops and=20
combined this with the hardware in their studio. By increasing influences by=
 labels=20
like Force Tracks, Raum Musik , Basic Channel or Poker Flat and Kompakt thei=
r=20
sound became more dubby, deep and minimal. In this time they got to know Eri=
k=20
Klingbeil from Berlin. He is a very talented designer, who creates flyers,=20
videos and covers with his artworks <A HREF=3D"http://www.cubelab.de/">(www.=
cubelab.de)</A> for Neurotron since that=20
time. With the change of their sound, their attitude of life and of music th=
ey=20
changed their name as well. Neurotron was born. The harmonious connection be=
tween=20
human nerves and electronic physics. The result : a positive change of=20
perception by electronic. Live this is reflected by both and transferred to=20=
the=20
audience. DJ Phrase changed his name. In 2001/2002 they released their first=
 music=20
on Thinner Records. After this they start to produce for more and more=20
projects. Since 2002 Le Dub Dwell is supporting the whole and cares for the=20
spreading of this attitude outside live acts with his deep and groovy sets.=20=
In 2002=20
they got to know Timothy Dorsey of <A HREF=3D"http://www.deepanddark.com/">D=
eep & Dark Recordings(us)</A> and Alexandra=20
Konka of <A HREF=3D"http://www.deepanddark.de/">Deep & Dark Recordings(ger)<=
/A>. This was the start of a very great=20
friendship and musical cooperation and they made many remixes and production=
s for D&D.=20
After the summer 2003 they released their full length Album Neurotron: Textu=
re=20
of you on Deep&Dark Recordings. In the middle of 2003 they start their own=20
label <A HREF=3D"http://www.night-drive-music.com/">Night-Drive-Music</A>. T=
he sound is very deep, minimal and harmonic with=20
internationl Acts. Like a beautiful nightdrive.=20


Neurotron presents - Texture of you (full lenght album)

Iraqis Offer Tips Over U.S. Blackout

By NIKO PRICE
The Associated Press
Friday, August 15, 2003; 9:32 AM

BAGHDAD, Iraq - Iraqis who have suffered for months with little electricity=
=20
gloated Friday over a blackout in the northeastern United States and=20
southern Canada and offered some tips to help Americans beat the heat.

 From frequent showers to rooftop slumber parties, Iraqis have developed=20
advanced techniques to adapt to life without electricity.

Daily highs have soared above 120 degrees recently as Iraq's U.S.=20
administrators have been unable to get power back to prewar levels. Some=20
said it was poetic justice that some Americans should suffer the same fate,=
=20
if only briefly.

"Let them taste what we have tasted," said Ali Abdul Hussein, selling "Keep=
=20
Cold" brand ice chests on a sidewalk. "Let them sit outside drinking tea=20
and smoking cigarettes waiting for the power to come back, just like the=20
Iraqis."

Here are some tips from the streets of Baghdad:

- SLEEP ON THE ROOF. Without power - and hence without air conditioning -=20
Iraqis have taken to climbing up stairs in the hot nights. Some install=20
metal bed frames on rooftops, while others simply stretch out on thin=20
mattresses. "It's cooler there," said Hadia Zeydan Khalaf, 38.

- SIT IN THE SHADE. Many Iraqis head outside when the power's off. "We sit=
=20
in the shade," said George Ruweid, 27, playing cards with friends on the=20
sidewalk. Of the U.S. blackout, he said: "I hope it lasts for 20 years. Let=
=20
them feel our suffering."

- HEAD FOR THE WATER. "We go to the river, just like in the old days," said=
=20
Saleh Moayet, 53.

- SHOWER FREQUENTLY. "I take showers all day," said Raed Ali, 33.

- BUY BLOCKS OF ICE. Mohammed Abdul Zahara, 24, sells about 20 a day from a=
=20
roadside table.

- GET A GENERATOR. Abbas Abdul al-Amir, 53, has one of a long row of shops=
=20
selling generators in Baghdad's Karadah shopping street. When the power=20
goes out, sales go up, he said.

- CALL IN THE IRAQIS. Some suggested the Americans ask the Iraqis how to=20
get the power going again. "Let them take experts from Iraq," said Alaa=20
Hussein, 32, waiting in a long line for gas because there was no=20
electricity for the pumps. "Our experts have a lot of experience in these=20
matters."

---

EDITOR'S NOTE - Niko Price is correspondent-at-large for The Associated=
 Press.

=A9 2003 The Associated Press


Moksha Tribe: www.mokshatribe.net

=20
children of humans as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in=
=20
the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or=20
nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Lives based on having are less free than lives based on either doing or on=
=20
being."
-William James

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org> wrote:
Iraqis Offer Tips Over U.S. Blackout

By NIKO PRICE
The Associated Press
Friday, August 15, 2003; 9:32 AM

BAGHDAD, Iraq - Iraqis who have suffered for months with little electricity 
gloated Friday over a blackout in the northeastern United States and 
southern Canada and offered some tips to help Americans beat the heat.

>From frequent showers to rooftop slumber parties, Iraqis have developed 
advanced techniques to adapt to life without electricity.

Daily highs have soared above 120 degrees recently as Iraq's U.S. 
administrators have been unable to get power back to prewar levels. Some 
said it was poetic justice that some Americans should suffer the same fate, 
if only briefly.

"Let them taste what we have tasted," said Ali Abdul Hussein, selling "Keep 
Cold" brand ice chests on a sidewalk. "Let them sit outside drinking tea 
and smoking cigarettes waiting for the power to come back, just like the 
Iraqis."

Here are some tips from the streets of Baghdad:

- SLEEP ON THE ROOF. Without power - and hence without air conditioning - 
Iraqis have taken to climbing up stairs in the hot nights. Some install 
metal bed frames on rooftops, while others simply stretch out on thin 
mattresses. "It's cooler there," said Hadia Zeydan Khalaf, 38.

- SIT IN THE SHADE. Many Iraqis head outside when the power's off. "We sit 
in the shade," said George Ruweid, 27, playing cards with friends on the 
sidewalk. Of the U.S. blackout, he said: "I hope it lasts for 20 years. Let 
them feel our suffering."

- HEAD FOR THE WATER. "We go to the river, just like in the old days," said 
Saleh Moayet, 53.

- SHOWER FREQUENTLY. "I take showers all day," said Raed Ali, 33.

- BUY BLOCKS OF ICE. Mohammed Abdul Zahara, 24, sells about 20 a day from a 
roadside table.

- GET A GENERATOR. Abbas Abdul al-Amir, 53, has one of a long row of shops 
selling generators in Baghdad's Karadah shopping street. When the power 
goes out, sales go up, he said.

- CALL IN THE IRAQIS. Some suggested the Americans ask the Iraqis how to 
get the power going again. "Let them take experts from Iraq," said Alaa 
Hussein, 32, waiting in a long line for gas because there was no 
electricity for the pumps. "Our experts have a lot of experience in these 
matters."

---

EDITOR'S NOTE - Niko Price is correspondent-at-large for The Associated Press.

© 2003 The Associated Press

Subject: [sfraves] "DETROIT" - THE BLACKOUT EDITION, this Sunday night @ Skylark (SF)

--0-773334012-1061102717=:39597
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii


Crazy stuff going on back in the D this week, what with the 90+ degree heat and the biggest blackout in history making it hard to stay cool. Of course - we'll be sure to turn the heat up and the lights low this Sunday night at our weekly tribute to the music of Detroit. As always, Motor City mavens Baby Daddy (Rob Goppold) and 12 Mile (Brian Stein) will mix it all from soulful to edgy and back again.

Detroit is free, and starts at 9 every Sunday night at the Skylark, 3089 16st., San Francisco.

Thanks - The Woodward Posse


 

Above: The City of Detroit, waiting for the lights to come on.

Subject: [sfraves] .: Tonight : Dirtbox Radio : Syndrome Industries : PiC :.

Hey guess what.

It's Sunday.

You know what that means?

I think you do....

IT'S DIRTBOX TIME GODDAMMIT!

We've got a great show for ya, just in case you were expecting any less
(which ya shouldn't).  Tonight's the fourth in a five week run we
arbitrarily chose to do, showcasing some of the hot ass talent that makes
up the greater DC metro area's DNB scene.

This week we're proud as a dude who just bought a Ferrari to present you
with tonight's lineup of junglistic fools.  The Syndrome Industries crew
(http://www.syndromeindustries.com) will be holdin down the fort for the
show tonight, with ODJ, Jerel, Hooligan, and possibly K-Lungz of the
Partners in Crime and Dirtbox Kru reppin for the Afterhours massif.  Never
sleepin, always killin, we've got about 30 new records to present you
with.  Fuck payin' bills, we buy records - true junglist style.

Here's the times and such:

07-12am EST - Akasha, Akasha, illEffect, Ricky Ricardo, and Shade of
Syndrome Industries (insuWrecktionist & TM are MIA).
12-??am EST - Hooligan, Jerel, K-Lungz (maybe), and ODJ of the Partners in
Crime and Dirtbox Kru.

All the links necessary to enjoy the show are located on the site @
http://www.dirtboxradio.com/listen.html, or directly by clickin' below:
64k mp3 - http://jungletrain.net/64kbps.pls
24k mp3 - http://jungletrain.net/24kbps.pls
webcam (10sec refresh) -
http://glue.umd.edu/~odjallen/dirtboxradio/webcam.html
chatroom - http://www.jungletrain.net/chat.htm (or IRC via
irc.jungletrain.net #jungletrain)

To tune into the show, you'll need something like winamp
(http://www.winamp.com), real player
(http://www.real.com/realoneplayer.html?pp=choice&src=realplayer) if you
run windows, or xmms (http://www.xmms.org) if you run *nix or mac osX.

If you'd like to join the plethora of talent that has graced our studio,
just send an email to us at holla@dirtboxradio.com.  We'll accept tapes,
CDs, MDs, and streams.  We rep all styles of DNB/Jungle, Breaks, Hip-Hop,
and some other random shizzle.

Upcoming Guests:
August 24th & 30th - R3 & Mantis Sound Takeovers (official sched. TBA)
September 7th - Breaks Nite 4 - Matt Sinne, Ikarus F, Bioteknik
September 14th - Scathe
September 21st - 2tuff Crew

The best place for up-to-date info, lineups, and those pesky Archives is
the official Dirtbox Radio website, located at http://dirtboxradio.com.
Bookmark that ish:)

Alright, see y'all tonight in the chat!

Respect,
Jackson (ODJ)
Partners in Crime, Dirtbox Radio, Trividual Productions, ALIAS

Catch ODJ at:
August 20th - The OHM/ALIAS/DCDNB/KIND BASS Takeover, Club Five, 1214 B
18th St NW, DC
August 28th - ALIAS, Nation, 1015 Half St SE, DC
August 30th - Destination @ DC Tunnel, 2135 Queens Chapel Rd NE, DC

.....................jackson.
.partners.in.crime...........
.dirtbox.radio...............
.trividual.productions.......
.a.l.i.a.s...................
.........................odj.

Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 69490 invoked from network); 17 Aug 2003 18:13:11 -0000
Message-ID: <20030817181310.12024.qmail@web41903.mail.yahoo.com>
Date: Sun, 17 Aug 2003 11:13:10 -0700 (PDT)
From: miss g <rhythmzslave@yahoo.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] nrr: ztrip be the man @ ben harper

hey everyone....this is pretty random, but i'm just
too stoked about it to not say anything

i'm an enthusiastic ben harper fan, albeit quite the
newbie compared to many of his old school fans,
including my sister.  so we had tix for sat..

jack johnson...doesn't interest me much, but i was
there wicked early anyway to get front row seats for
our ben...and who should i discover is opening and
providing live incidental mixing but 

ZTRIP!!!!

oh so stoked was i, i couldn't believe it.  the frat
boys swilling beer with their arms wrapped around
their trophy chicks could have cared less when the
master scratcher walked up to his decks, and where did
we happen to be stationed?  my eyes were frantically
searching the entire stage, until i looked right above
me and was greeted with a huge ZTRIP banner in front
of my face, we had even haphazardly ended up right in
front of him!

he must have died laughing when he saw the crowd, but
he did his thang which kept the majority happy...he
scratched up some grateful dead, joplin, motown, nappy
roots, depeche, and even oasis.  oasis never sounded
so good..he made them a hell of a lot better.  i was
laughing and dancing my ass off.  he closed with that
signature deal from 'scratch' which closed off the
movie (i forget now..that classical thing..i should
know i'm a bit out of it at the moment).  when he
first walked up to the decks, i flashed my pitiful 

ZTRIP sign made in bold sharpie and my DNA flier, and
he said, 'yeah totally, i'll sign it after.' so he
playd for an hour, but jack johnson came on stage
before he was done, and they literally dragged him
backstage.  insane.  i was pissed.  towards the end of
jack's set, my pal mike turned and said 'hey look
there's your dj' and ztrip was looking out at the
crowd towards where we were hanging, but he didn't see
me:( i ran but missd him, and the backstage peeps were
NOT friendly to me.  so i patiently waited for his
next set in between jack and ben.  sure enough, i
flashed my sign again, and he looks down at me 'SURE
AFTER, ' points to the right 'OVER THERE AFTER'
haha..in front of 8500 people, ZTRIP pointed at me and
invited me to the backstage door!!!

my pal michelle and i got our grooves on some more,
still no one was really dancing except for us, but we
cared not.  i dashed over there after his set and sure
enough, he greeted me despite his battle wound on his
left shin from carting vinyl bins, and signed
everything i gave him, and introduced me to his
girlfriend. he seemed very grateful to have a fan
amongst the crowd.  when he asked if i was going to
DNA i sheepishly answered that i didn't have enough
money, and a lot has been happing personally etc.  and
he was like, 'oh that's ok, how about the guest list?
plus one? if you can make it, if you can make it, it
would be cool' my mouth dropped open and my eyes
widened...personally invited by the man himself...oooh
the excitement...

feeling the ztrip love,

lauren

intimate venues in San Francisco: 26 Mix.=20

This is your personal invitation to participate in a hyper-sensory =
experience built around sound and dance. We are putting out a call for =
the masses to join our party, a temporal community where an attitude of =
acceptance, comradery and freedom prevails. This is the beginning of our =
underground movement, with its roots founded on electronic music and our =
personal desire to expose it to everyone.

Subject: [sfraves] wow, almost missed the deadline nrr

what is there to say. i just think it is all so sweet to be a mutha-fugg'in tourist. what's great about being a tourist is that home is elsewhere, and sometimes, you might think to yourself, "there's no place like home". and their ain't. people really are a product of their upbringing. you can put the cow in the boy, but you can't ever take it out, cuz once the damage has been done, we all know, it's been done, and then there's nothing to do but just accept who you are, what is going on in  your life, and that very little will probably ever change, despite an apparent environmental displacement from time to time. keep your feet on the ground and your ears wherever you want them to be, and always value your true friendships, because without them, you have no friends, and that means, you are a total loner. :)

like home". and their ain't. people really are a product of their
upbringing. you can put the cow in the boy, but you can't ever take it out,
cuz once the damage has been done, we all know, it's been done, and then
there's nothing to do but just accept who you are, what is going on in  your
life, and that very little will probably ever change, despite an apparent
environmental displacement from time to time. keep your feet on the ground
and your ears wherever you want them to be, and always value your true
friendships, because without them, you have no friends, and that means, you
are a total loner. :)
>
>
>
> ---------------------------------
> Do you Yahoo!?
> Yahoo! SiteBuilder - Free, easy-to-use web site design software

> treatment. Guys like that played for a $10 cover charge on a weekly
> basis.
> Nothing like seeing Richie Hawtin on a work night for $10!!!

It's like this in London as well- a lot of our fave big-time folks from
over there throw their own, often low-key events at small clubs.  When
I first went, I saw Andy from Groove Armada spin for 5 pounds- and I
got to have a few drinks with the both of them first :)  Then next
night it was Barry from the Dub Pistols, for FREE.  Then, of course,
some big clubs'll charge 20 bob ($30!) for 3 or so marginal progressive
house djs, so it runs the gamut.  It's great to see stars not taking
themselves too seriously though.

Funny thing is, I was there promoting a record.  I'd say, "Yeah, I'm
from the US", and the shop/distro people'd be like, "Uch." (this was
just after 9/11)  Then, every time, I'd mention I was from San
Francisco, and they'd be like, "OH, COOL!  How is stuff out there?".

Makes ya a little proud to be around here :)

GeorgeC
www.djorigami.com

Subject: [sfraves] FAULTLINE 5 - Sat 9/6 - UG D&B w/Pieter K, EHL, Illformants, more

FAULTLINE 5 
Saturday September 6 2003 
Drum 'n Bass & Oldskool Hardcore 

** NOTE NEW DATE! ALL-NEW ALL-CONFIRMED LINEUP! **

Online flyer:
http://faultlinednb.com/events/faultline5/front500.jpg
http://faultlinednb.com/events/faultline5/back500.jpg

PIETER K (Breakbeat Science / Metaformal Recordings /
Palette - LA) 
This highly-respected and thoroughly innovative
producer has carved out his own unique sound with
releases on labels such as Breakbeat Science,
Renegade, Phunckateck, Thermal, Vortex, Higher
Education and his own Metaformal. His debut LP,
"Everything All the Time" dropped earlier this year as
BBS's first full-length release and was drooled on by
critics at XLR8R, Knowledge, Urb, Mixer and countless
other publications. His music is known for its
intricate drum programming, emotional depth and
dancefloor appeal. Pieter's career has included
extensive DJ gigs all over the globe and we are
excited to welcome him back to the Bay.

EHL (Warm Communications - Texas) 
Heading up the Warm Communications label with releases
from such top-notch artists as Seba, Equinox, ASC,
P.B.K., Banaczech and Probe One, EHL is known for his
upfront high-tech atmospheric selection. He hosts a
weekly radio show on http://bassdrive.com every
Wednesday from 4-5:30pm central which showcases the
new, harder, dancefloor atmospheric sound. Don't miss
this Bay Area debut! 

ILLFORMANTS (Breakbeat Science / Subtitles) 
Controlled Substance and Angelzero have received much
well-due attention throughout their solo careers.
Recording together as Illformants, they've also turned
heads with a single on BBS and two on Teebee's
Subtitles label, including the wildly successful "The
Bizarre" which continues to smash the top10s and
playlists of a wide range of world-class DJs. Watch
out for these local favorites ripping up a tag-team
FinalScratch session. 

DJ M (Faultline / Tenderloft / Freebeats) 

FIFE (Faultline / InnerspaceResearchGroup) 

teKtite (Urban Terrorists / Elevation) 

new visual statements 
SCATHA 
KELLY PORTER (Otherworld) 
KARA (Faultline) 

moving image 
L7VJ (Connected Systems) 

flyer by INFLU3NZ (tsumimag.com -
influ3nz@tsumimag.com) 

10pm to after hours 
$10 until 11pm, $12 after 
all-ages underground san francisco location 
infoline: 415.435.7933 
mailing list signup & more: http://faultlinednb.com
contact: hello@faultlinednb.com

> --- dank@countercultured.net wrote:

> > Christian SMith used to throw a weekly in NYC on wensdays, tronic
> > treatment. Guys like that played for a $10 cover charge on a weekly
> > basis.
> > Nothing like seeing Richie Hawtin on a work night for $10!!!
>
> It's like this in London as well- a lot of our fave big-time folks from
> over there throw their own, often low-key events at small clubs.  When
> I first went, I saw Andy from Groove Armada spin for 5 pounds- and I
> got to have a few drinks with the both of them first :)  Then next
> night it was Barry from the Dub Pistols, for FREE.  Then, of course,
> some big clubs'll charge 20 bob ($30!) for 3 or so marginal progressive
> house djs, so it runs the gamut.  It's great to see stars not taking
> themselves too seriously though.
>
> Funny thing is, I was there promoting a record.  I'd say, "Yeah, I'm
> from the US", and the shop/distro people'd be like, "Uch." (this was
> just after 9/11)  Then, every time, I'd mention I was from San
> Francisco, and they'd be like, "OH, COOL!  How is stuff out there?".
>
> Makes ya a little proud to be around here :)

Thanks Sarah, as I tend to believe a lot of things on face value. 
To RealistRaver: Like Sarah I'll give you the benefit of the doubt and assume you're not the ass who flamed her. So, here's your best bet. It's really easy. 
 
1. Go to parties.
2. Be nice, smile, say hi to people.
3. Make friends.

If you just follow these three easy steps, there's really no need to search for new raver friends on a mailing list. 

Also, keep in mind that there could be DEA agents or other law enforcement types pretending to be ravers in order to get names of people to contact or investigate. So it shouldn't be too surprising if your broadcast call for friends doesn't result in much. 
Best wishes,
JonnyR

misguieded city sooner?"

damage to you, the mask just falls off.

Subject: [sfraves] Quote The Raver

--part1_103.34752a29.2c72fab0_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Quote The Raver

Give me beats 
I want to dance 
Give me something new 
I'll take the chance 
Quote the Raver, "Give me more!" 

Give me your loving music 
I long for my fix 
Give it to me now 
I want to get lost in your mix 
Quote the Raver, "Give me more!" 

Give me all your energy 
I want to get into my groove 
If you spin like there's no tomorrow 
Then I'll dance like I have nothing to prove! 
Quote the Raver, "Give me more!" 

Give me your truth 
And I'll show you mine 
Give me your everything 
Cause you got me feeling fine 
Quote the Raver, "Give me more!" 

Give it to me DJ 
Do what you do 
I'm going to dance here 
I'm going to dance for you 
Quote the Raver, "Give me more!" 

Kristopher Ramer  (aka MrPink)
July 21st, 2003

--part1_103.34752a29.2c72fab0_boundary--

Date: Tue, 19 Aug 2003 00:03:15 EDT
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org

X-Mailer: 8.0 for Windows sub 6014
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] A Short Poem, "A Reality Dreamt"

--part1_185.1f405bf9.2c72fb83_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

A Feeling of Oneness

The lights flash.  The music thumps.  My skin tingles.  I'm dancing like 
noone else is there.  I begin to wonder, "what has come over me?"  Then I remember 
that little pill.  Courage swallowed with a mouthful of water.  I watch as 
everyone around me becomes more vibrant.  All of a sudden the tempo changes.  It 
climbs to higher beats.  My body reacts as if the music was a infection in 
full control.  I look up to the dj and begin to cheer along with the masses.  
The laser light illuminates pictures in mid air.  I'm lost in them as everything 
slows down.  I seem to have trancended time.  I glance to the left with a 
look of amazement to see a skinny young brunette
expressing with her body exactly what I was feeling.  I then realize that 
everything and everyone was connected through this music, through the room's 
energy.  Then the beat changes, begins to come to a slowing pace.  It creeps 
painfully and pleasantly to a climax.  Taking us all to places we have never felt 
before.  Leaves us suspended in antiscipation.  The crowd's roar becomes 
intense as the music seduces us further.  "Boom", that beat hits with a thunderous 
sensation as everyone jumps and moves to it.  The energy is feirce with 
passion.  An unbelieveably large mass, beating together as one.  One energy.  One 
force.  One ideal.  We are all as one.  I decide that I need to catch my breathe, 
but before I depart from the dance floor, I lean over to the brunette and 
say, "I hope you don't think this is wierd but, Thank You!" not knowing how she 
would repsond.  She looks to me and says, "No, thank you!"  And smiles in 
satisfaction.  I then understand that what I was feeling was not mine own, but was 
shared by everyone there.  I have never felt so complete before, but soon hope 
to feel that again.

Kristopher Ramer  (aka MrPink)
July 21st, 2003

--part1_185.1f405bf9.2c72fb83_boundary--

Subject: [sfraves] Jobs for a newbie???

Hey there people!

My name is Marco, and as some of you may already know, I'll be moving =
out there to the Bay Area (from Washington DC) in the next couple of =
weeks. Naturally, I'm going to need employment as soon as humanly =
possible. I know that a lot of folks out that way are also in need of =
work, so I'm not expecting miracles, but any help will be sincrely =
appreciated.

The bulk of my work experience lies in Customer Service work. Both in =
call centers, and retail. I've been both a supervisor, and store =
manager, and my work has always included office administration, data =
entry, and general clerical/receptionist skills. I've got almost 10 =
years experience in customer service and data entry alone.=20

If anyone out there knows of anything I might be able to nab, PLEASE let =
me know. I can go from working at a store (of any kind really), to any =
sort of call center, to just being an office paper-jockey. I'm not going =
to be picky about work or salary to start off with, because my goal is =
to start paying my bills as quickly as I can. I've had some offers from =
places out there already, but they all wanted me to start this past =
week, and I still have to finish packing and taking a class before I can =
move. My lease out here ends the 31st, and I will be out of here no =
later than that day (with an additional 4-5 days to drive out there).=20

Any help is great, and if the help results in a job, I will personally =
take you out for drinks or dinner or something in appreciation!!!

Thanks in advance...

Marc(O)
*THWAP!* // Substructure
DC/MD/VA
www.djmarcom.com
deep.funky.techy.tribal.progressive.nuskool.beats&bass
aim: OPKing138 or ElectroFunk138

1st off : this is not rave related (if it were marked as such, i would =
have just let it go, like i do all the others...)

2nd : not trying to spread anti-raver vibes but am i the only one who is =
disconcerted with each solicitation for jobs on this list ?

a temporary place to live in time of need, a ride to a party, help =
moving, home for unwanted pets, free junk, GOOD deals on sound equipment =
and records, sure...  that is a small, but important part of what this =
list is about... community.

what it is not about is soliciting for people to give them the Free =
Parking and a Get Out of Jail FREE card.  okay, well, that's just my =
opinion.  but the fact is there are tens of thousands of unemployed =
people in this area, and untold numbers of underemployed (raises hand.)  =
 if you want a job you're gonna have to bust your ass for it out here.

much more appropriate (and something you will see once in a while on =
here) are postings about available jobs.  again, this goes back to =
community.  at another time (can you say 1998 =3D), i'd say it'd be =
totally appropriate... but here and how, i'd really discourage people =
from posting job solicitations to the list. =20

peace

-=3Ddave

Subject: [sfraves] Weekend review: Friday night... Fire & Ice

So Friday night... I went 2 Galt w/ Amber & Company 2 check out the shindig & support my Homegirl on the decks!!  The party was like in the same venue like where Power Puff Girls was earlier this year!!  That Huge ball room place!!  Nice NIce Venue!

Anywaze.. when we got there... UberZone was on stage!!  I mean... they do alota like production & stuff... right??  I mean... I was hoping they were gonna do some kinda Live  PA kinda thing, but they jus' like spun records from what I saw!  I mean... it was a good set when I got there!!  Hello 2day... Breakbeats... Yum!!  They also spun alota trance which was Groovy!  I seriously thought Brandon was gonna pop up somewhere... LoL... jk!  But I dunno... even if they did spin some OG tracks, I couldn't tell 'cause I dunno...  They coulda like had something hooked up there where they wre doin' live stuff, but I didn't have my glasses on, so I couldn't tell...

Then Amber went on!!  She started out spinning Hard HOuse... it was kinda weird 'cause I don't think I ever heard her spin hard house b4... but it was fun!!  Eventually... she got into some hmmmm... it's always hard to classify what Amber spins lately.. she jus' spins Amber Music!!  But I coulda sworn that her set went in2 some Hard kinda dark Trance, Acid Trance, maybe some Acid Techo here & there, but man... she totally spun a remix remix of Silence by Delerium!!  Oh mYgosh man.. she dropped it right on time 2!!

See.. what happened, as I notice always happens when Amber gets on the decks & I"m there, is that people leave the room & 1/2 the floors opnly left!  But Amber plays harder tracks as her set goes on & more people start 2 go like, "Oh Shit, this DJs Fuckin' Awesome!"  Then more people start dancing & this mondo crowd like totally builds up in front of the DJ booth!!  I mean... this was so CooL!!  I mean... I would always like yell during a small break in the song & the whole floor would like totally start 2 yell!!  LoL... Then Amber wuld look up & totally be cheesin'!!  It's Groovy!  I kinda yelled "Fuck the DJ" kinda 2 early & we flipped each other off as usual... lol... but man... Amber set was Mondo Fun!!  So Dope!  Thank U Amber Time =)

Whenever it got hella hot from dancing & stuff... I totally went 2 the outdoor section place they had there!!  It was Groovy 'cause Nick was there & we kick it!!  So Was Nicole!!  YAAAAAAAY!!!  Oh gosh... there were a few people who I knew there, but I sooo can'tremember their names right now =\  Anywaze... I went out this 1 time & LoL.. I bumped in2 Simon Apex... LoL... it was Dope 'cause we haven't seen each other since like last summer, so we like totally caught up & talked & stuff!!  I swear man... he a Groovy guy!

So anywaze... he went on after Amber.. OK... Simon busted out his 2st track this cid Breakbeats tune!! BAD ASS man!!  Oh Gosh man... then he went in2 this like Heavenly Kinda Melodic Breakbeats track next.. Yuuuuuuuuum!!!  LoL.. Then that record did this totally funky breakdown & turned in2 this like totally crazy Jungle song!!  It was Dope!!  Then I was like Heeeeeella buggin' 'cause Wow... Simon Apex & Jungle were 2 things I never thought of 2gether!!  

It was during that song that we took off back 2 the Bay...

But the party was totally fun!!  There wasn't like nearly as much people as there was when Amber & I were last there @ that venue... but the vibe was really Awesome!!  Every1 was CooL!  Decorations were kinda minimal, but nice!  2 huge screens of Groovy visuals!  These circles that had projections from both sides playing! 1 was a color thingie changer & the other was these pictures & stuff!!  Behind the DJ booth was this HUGE YING YANG symbol!  

YAAAAAAY.. fun night!!!


Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] [nrr] Jobs for a newbie???

----- Original Message -----
From: "SE/30" <grindingbassline@hotmail.com>
To: "Marc(O)" <ElectroFunk138@hotmail.com>; <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Tuesday, August 19, 2003 3:42 AM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] [nrr] Jobs for a newbie???


1st off : this is not rave related (if it were marked as such, i would have
just let it go, like i do all the others...)

2nd : not trying to spread anti-raver vibes but am i the only one who is
disconcerted with each solicitation for jobs on this list ?

a temporary place to live in time of need, a ride to a party, help moving,
home for unwanted pets, free junk, GOOD deals on sound equipment and
records, sure...  that is a small, but important part of what this list is
about... community.

what it is not about is soliciting for people to give them the Free Parking
and a Get Out of Jail FREE card.  okay, well, that's just my opinion.  but
the fact is there are tens of thousands of unemployed people in this area,
and untold numbers of underemployed (raises hand.)   if you want a job
you're gonna have to bust your ass for it out here.

much more appropriate (and something you will see once in a while on here)
are postings about available jobs.  again, this goes back to community.  at
another time (can you say 1998 =), i'd say it'd be totally appropriate...
but here and how, i'd really discourage people from posting job
solicitations to the list.

peace

-=dave

  ----- Original Message -----
  From: Marc(O)
  To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
  Cc: sf-oasis@saturn5.com
  Sent: Monday, August 18, 2003 11:00 PM
  Subject: [sfraves] Jobs for a newbie???


  Hey there people!

  My name is Marco, and as some of you may already know, I'll be moving out
there to the Bay Area (from Washington DC) in the next couple of weeks.
Naturally, I'm going to need employment as soon as humanly possible. I know
that a lot of folks out that way are also in need of work, so I'm not
expecting miracles, but any help will be sincrely appreciated.

  The bulk of my work experience lies in Customer Service work. Both in call
centers, and retail. I've been both a supervisor, and store manager, and my
work has always included office administration, data entry, and general
clerical/receptionist skills. I've got almost 10 years experience in
customer service and data entry alone.

  If anyone out there knows of anything I might be able to nab, PLEASE let
me know. I can go from working at a store (of any kind really), to any sort
of call center, to just being an office paper-jockey. I'm not going to be
picky about work or salary to start off with, because my goal is to start
paying my bills as quickly as I can. I've had some offers from places out
there already, but they all wanted me to start this past week, and I still
have to finish packing and taking a class before I can move. My lease out
here ends the 31st, and I will be out of here no later than that day (with
an additional 4-5 days to drive out there).

  Any help is great, and if the help results in a job, I will personally
take you out for drinks or dinner or something in appreciation!!!

  Thanks in advance...

  Marc(O)

  DC/MD/VA

  deep.funky.techy.tribal.progressive.nuskool.beats&bass

Subject: [sfraves] Saturday night... ACME 6 year Anniversary & Reunion

OK... this really wasn't a big thing... but after getting the invite... I was kinda nostalgic & hoping 4 thsi big thing... well... it was a house party instead of something underground... but this was a chill thing I guess!!  It started early & unfortunately I wasn't able 2 make it until later that night around 11 PM 'cause oh gosh..... it was confussing!!

When I got there... OH Shit... Mighty Mouse was spinning & Good Fuckin' Shit man... I ain't seen that Dude since 4ever man!!  So I went in while he was spinning some nice yummy kinda deep house... that was Dope!!  We gave each other this mondo hug 'cause that Dude's still 1 of my closest Bro's!!!

OK... I think Phaedrus went on next & Hello 2Day... He spun Jungle!!  I LOVED IT!!! Oh Gosh man... I Loved his whole set... but man... he busted out this 1 classic Jungle track & I went fuckin' Crazy man 'cause it's 1 of my all time Fave Jungle songs!  Hello 2Day... that set was totally Orgasmic!!

But the Jungle didn't stop there... Happy went on & Yu,mmmmm... continued spinning more Jungle!!  I Loved it!!  Oh Gosh man... he went toally hard during his set!!  All his tracks... it hard to pick out when he got me like hyped the most!!  I Loved it!!  It was Hard Happy Jungle!!  Wow... new genre of Jungle?  LoL

OK... I think Alkaline (another face of ACME & 1 of my Grooviest Homeboys so I ain't seen in a long time) got on next & spun this Dope House set!!!  I dunno, he got off on like well.. it's been a few daze now, & I soooo can't remember exactly what kinda house... but it was fun jus' seein' homeboy spn again!

OK.. Then Brak went on & spun this totally hillarious Disco House set!!  I mean.... he purposely went 4 the cheese!!  It was sooo funny!!!  But it was sooo fun 2 dance 2!!

This Hip Hop DJ spun after that & well... it was what it was & I dunno what I can say since I'm not that bigga hip hop anymore!!  BUt well... he did spun Groovy Tracks... his set was alright 4 what it was...

Then BRD went on & ooooh my gosh man... He spun this really Dope set that went all over the fuckin' place!  He started out spinning Hypbrid, got into trance for a bit, then house, back to breakbeats, breakbeats, breakbeats, more trance, never foofoo btw, then old school tracks, it was amazing!!!  I Loved it!!  I mean... I was @ the point of exsaustion already, but I had 2 stick this set out!!  It waw Awesome!!! =)  I Loved it!  Hello 2Day I <3ed it!

This party was fun!!  I LOVE all the people I hung out w/ over there 'cause they all my Bros & Sistas! I mean... I know I'm like a mondo dork 4 getting there late & missing alota people who swung by, but I dunno... I was hoping 4 like Old School ACME was gonna be there, but well... it wasn't like that & I was CooL w/ that!!  It will happen again I'm sure!!  

Regadless of all that, HAPPY 6 YEAR ANNIVERSARY ACME & Congratulations Joe 4 Graduating!  I so can't wait 'til the next party! =)


Take Care,
Peace-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] *OVERLOAD 3! October 10th & 11th! - FULL LINEUP*

Hardscience and Liquidvinyldjs.com are very pleased to bring you an event 
we've been planning for over 1 year.. the event many of you have been asking 
for..

OVERLOAD 3
Friday, October 10th and Saturday, October 11th!
ALL AGES / 2 Days of Fun - Music - Friends!
2000 Capacity / Beautiful Outdoor Location!
$1 Presale Tickets!

This event means the world to us, and we want it to mean the world to you 
after it's all said and done! Be prepared to come out and have a great 
weekend listening and dancing to your favorite DJs, being among great 
friends and above all else.. having fun! DJs joining us for the weekend:


OVERLOADED HARDCORE AREA:

| MARC SMITH (Notorious Vinyl/Bonkerz : Glasgow, Scotland) *FIRST USA 
APPEARANCE!*
Marc is truly a legend within the UK hardcore scene. Hailing from Scotland, 
where if it's not hard they don't wanna hear it, he is always one of the 
hardest. Playing all throughout Great Britain and most of Europe, he is 
widely known to drop some of the hardest hitting material around. With such 
anthems as "Boom Pow", "Encounters", and "Identify The Beat", along with 
countless others on labels such as Clubscene, Bonkerz, Mainframe and his own 
Notorious Vinyl, Marc has continued to push a sound he has both originated 
and pioneered. Please join us as we are proud to present Marc Smith for his 
first USA appearance!

| STARGAZER (Phase 4/Raw Elements/Elation : London, UK) *FIRST USA 
APPEARANCE!*
In the last two years, Stargazer has proven to be one of the busiest 
hardcore producers in the UK.With several releases under his belt on his own 
label Phase 4, along with appearances on Elation, Raw Elements, Raver Baby, 
and too many engineering credits to mention, the secret is definately out 
that he is the fastest rising producer in the UK Hardcore scene. One of the 
few remaining secrets about Stargazer's incredible talent is his DJing, as 
he rarely plays in the UK due to his busy engineering schedule. This is a 
very rare DJ appearance and FIRST USA APPEARANCE for this amazingly talented 
producer!

| OMAR SANTANA (H2OH Recordings/Moonshine/Topaz : Los Angeles)
This man really needs no introduction. Widely recognized throughout the 
world as one of the USA's top Hardcore DJ's and Producers, Omar Santana is a 
full force to be reckoned with. When he's not touring such far off places as 
Holland, Italy, Spain, Belgium, or one of his many stops here in America, he 
is in the studio writing material for his top Hardcore label - H20H 
Recordings. We are proud to welcome Omar Santanafor a very rare Northern 
California appearance.. so get ready to rock.. and ROCK HARD!

| CLOUDSKIPPER vs. DJ SPREE (Raw Elements/Liquidvinyldjs.com : SF vs. 
Sonicfury.net/Spreeandadb.com : Minneapolis - CLOUDSKIPPER CD RELEASE!)
Quite possibly the most popular and talented Happy Hardcore DJs in the USA.. 
there is little doubt that comes to mind when you ask the fans of these two, 
which stretch all across the world! Cloudskipper and Spree were the 
beginning of Hardcore to many people, especially here in the USA, and over 
time their sound and style have developed into both of them being the most 
respected Happy Hardcore DJs in America. They will be coming out to perform 
together for the first time in 2 years here on the West Coast.. this is the 
one set for all the Harder and the Happier not to miss!

and of course that awesome OVERLOAD vibe you've all come to know and love.. 
celebrated under the full moon and stars!

following outlets:

Or Purchase Tickets ONLINE: http://www.spinfoil.com


We FULLY expect for those $1 Presale Tickets to sell VERY VERY QUICK! Why? 
Well, because tickets for shows like this usually aren't that cheap. So get 
those $1 Presale Tickets QUICK before they sell out!

After those $1 Presale Tickets sell out, we will have more tickets for $5, 
then after those $5 Presale Tickets sell out we'll have $10 Presale Tickets. 
Get your tickets early and save some cash! All prices INCLUDE BOTH NIGHTS of 
the event!! If you make the mistake of not getting a presale ticket.. not to 
worry. We will have door tickets available throughout the weekend for your 
OVERLOAD party needs!

OVERLOAD 3 will be an ALL AGES event, FULLY PERMITTED and Centrally Located 
in Northern California. Be prepared to campout.. bring tents, sleeping bags, 
water guns, water balloons, toilet paper, sunscreen.. anything you might 
need to make yourself feel more comfortable. We will have food and drinks 
being sold on the premesis.. so bring some extra spending cash with you for 
the great food we have to offer!!

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="ISO-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

This is more of a short story or a really long poem, not a short poem... to=20
call it a short poem is like false advertiseing because it was the "short po=
em"=20
that incouraged me to read it. Had i known it was going to be so long i'm no=
t=20
sure if i would have read it, but after i had started reading it and realize=
d=20
how long it was, i figured hell i'm almost halfway through why not finish=20
reading...=20
But you know, now that i've gone through the effert of reading this=20
poem/story i'm glad i read it because it reminds me that good ol timeless ra=
ve=20
phenomina/myth that some people would like to kind of, sort of reluctantly c=
all PLUR
PLUR is the central ideology and backbone of the old candy-kid scene that i'=
m=20
sure just about every one on this list was either a part of or had a their=20
runs-ins with it. When it was at it's peak in the bay area, i'd like to say=20=
that=20
was about 97 & 98 & 99 it had everyone wondering... is this really real? is=20
there some kind of "vibe" or "oneness" that no one has ever mentioned in my=20
entire life that a person can only experience at a rave? is it just the ecst=
acy=20
itself? does ecstacy enhance us into superhuman telepathic beings??? hmmm  =20
And then as you get older every time you mention the idea to your friends=20
they make fun of you, little by little everyone you know stops raving and ge=
ts=20
all serious about their job and how they got promoted to manager with a doll=
ar=20
raise.... the idea has become taboo, you can't talk abotu it without getting=
 a=20
rolling of the eyes or a change of subject or an offended look upons someone=
s=20
face.
it's like the glowstick twilight zone... it just vanishes and it's not to be=
=20
talked about.. never persued again. and you wonder was it just some kind of=20
practical joke? were people just pretending to be about something? were we=20
brash? naive? you mature and you forget it all... untill some newbie raver t=
akes=20
another e pill at just the right party and just the right moment and is=20
compelled to write a short poem that is not actually short...

> A Feeling of Oneness
>=20
> The lights flash.=A0 The music thumps.=A0 My skin tingles.=A0 I'm dancing=20=
like
> noone else is there.=A0 I begin to wonder, "what has come over me?"=A0 The=
n I=20
> remember
> that little pill.=A0 Courage swallowed with a mouthful of water.=A0 I watc=
h as
> everyone around me becomes more vibrant.=A0 All of a sudden the tempo=20
> changes.=A0 It
> climbs to higher beats.=A0 My body reacts as if the music was a infection=20=
in
> full control.=A0 I look up to the dj and begin to cheer along with the=20
> masses.=A0
> The laser light illuminates pictures in mid air.=A0 I'm lost in them as=20
> everything
> slows down.=A0 I seem to have trancended time.=A0 I glance to the left wit=
h a
> look of amazement to see a skinny young brunette
> expressing with her body exactly what I was feeling.=A0 I then realize tha=
t
> everything and everyone was connected through this music, through the room=
's
> energy.=A0 Then the beat changes, begins to come to a slowing pace.=A0 It=20=
creeps
> painfully and pleasantly to a climax.=A0 Taking us all to places we have n=
ever=20
> felt
> before.=A0 Leaves us suspended in antiscipation.=A0 The crowd's roar becom=
es
> intense as the music seduces us further.=A0 "Boom", that beat hits with a=20
> thunderous
> sensation as everyone jumps and moves to it.=A0 The energy is feirce with
> passion.=A0 An unbelieveably large mass, beating together as one.=A0 One=20
> energy.=A0 One
> force.=A0 One ideal.=A0 We are all as one.=A0 I decide that I need to catc=
h my=20
> breathe,
> but before I depart from the dance floor, I lean over to the brunette and
> say, "I hope you don't think this is wierd but, Thank You!" not knowing ho=
w=20
> she
> would repsond.=A0 She looks to me and says, "No, thank you!"=A0 And smiles=
 in
> satisfaction.=A0 I then understand that what I was feeling was not mine ow=
n,=20
> but was
> shared by everyone there.=A0 I have never felt so complete before, but soo=
n=20
> hope
> to feel that again.
>=20
> Kristopher Ramer=A0 (aka MrPink)
> July 21st, 2003

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="ISO-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

A new raver steps into an anchient scene
and is profoundeded...
he speaks of feeling *energy*
a truth that has gone out of fashion
a purity out of style
a PLUR cliche and catch phrases
he sticks out like a sore thumb
in the valley jaded ravers
where we only speak of venues & technics 1200
this cosmic war, a metaphor
can naive defeat pretentious?
'tis a battle of enternity
infernity envelops us all
ashes to sparkles and dust to methamphetomines...
e-tards and telepathic-super-human-beings


In a message dated 8/18/03 9:00:48 PM, OhNoNotMrPink@aol.com writes:


> Quote The Raver
>=20
> Give me beats
> I want to dance
> Give me something new
> I'll take the chance
> Quote the Raver, "Give me more!"
>=20
> Give me your loving music
> I long for my fix
> Give it to me now
> I want to get lost in your mix
> Quote the Raver, "Give me more!"
>=20
> Give me all your energy
> I want to get into my groove
> If you spin like there's no tomorrow
> Then I'll dance like I have nothing to prove!
> Quote the Raver, "Give me more!"
>=20
> Give me your truth
> And I'll show you mine
> Give me your everything
> Cause you got me feeling fine
> Quote the Raver, "Give me more!"
>=20
> Give it to me DJ
> Do what you do
> I'm going to dance here
> I'm going to dance for you
> Quote the Raver, "Give me more!"
>=20
> Kristopher Ramer=A0 (aka MrPink)
> July 21st, 2003
>=20

Subject: [sfraves] Osby, thanks for your party reviews, I'd like to see more about the parties

there's been some discussion on and off about what belongs on SF Raves. I just wanted to thank Osby (you nut! Hello 2Day!) for writing his entertaining reviews of parties and events he goes to. 
There's room for all kinds of topics on here, but I'm extra happy when I can read about the events. Did I miss something really fun? What was the music like? What was the energy like? 

Thanks, Osby!  (And, for those of you who don't know the cat, he really DOES talk just like he writes! And his face lights up like a ravin' maniac when he's talking!  
:)
JonnyR in Berkeley

From: "O§by Jamz" <osby@hellokitty.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>; <amber@iamthedj.com>
Sent: Tuesday, August 19, 2003 1:03 AM
Subject: [sfraves] Weekend review: Friday night... Fire & Ice


> So Friday night... I went 2 Galt w/ Amber & Company 2 check out the
shindig & support my Homegirl on the decks!!  The party was like in the same
venue like where Power Puff Girls was earlier this year!!  That Huge ball
room place!!  Nice NIce Venue!
>
> Anywaze.. when we got there... UberZone was on stage!!  I mean... they do
alota like production & stuff... right??  I mean... I was hoping they were
gonna do some kinda Live  PA kinda thing, but they jus' like spun records
from what I saw!  I mean... it was a good set when I got there!!  Hello
2day... Breakbeats... Yum!!  They also spun alota trance which was Groovy!
I seriously thought Brandon was gonna pop up somewhere... LoL... jk!  But I
dunno... even if they did spin some OG tracks, I couldn't tell 'cause I
dunno...  They coulda like had something hooked up there where they wre
doin' live stuff, but I didn't have my glasses on, so I couldn't tell...
>
> Then Amber went on!!  She started out spinning Hard HOuse... it was kinda
weird 'cause I don't think I ever heard her spin hard house b4... but it was
fun!!  Eventually... she got into some hmmmm... it's always hard to classify
what Amber spins lately.. she jus' spins Amber Music!!  But I coulda sworn
that her set went in2 some Hard kinda dark Trance, Acid Trance, maybe some
Acid Techo here & there, but man... she totally spun a remix remix of
Silence by Delerium!!  Oh mYgosh man.. she dropped it right on time 2!!
>
> See.. what happened, as I notice always happens when Amber gets on the
decks & I"m there, is that people leave the room & 1/2 the floors opnly
left!  But Amber plays harder tracks as her set goes on & more people start
2 go like, "Oh Shit, this DJs Fuckin' Awesome!"  Then more people start
dancing & this mondo crowd like totally builds up in front of the DJ booth!!
I mean... this was so CooL!!  I mean... I would always like yell during a
small break in the song & the whole floor would like totally start 2 yell!!
LoL... Then Amber wuld look up & totally be cheesin'!!  It's Groovy!  I
kinda yelled "Fuck the DJ" kinda 2 early & we flipped each other off as
usual... lol... but man... Amber set was Mondo Fun!!  So Dope!  Thank U
Amber Time =)
>
> Whenever it got hella hot from dancing & stuff... I totally went 2 the
outdoor section place they had there!!  It was Groovy 'cause Nick was there
& we kick it!!  So Was Nicole!!  YAAAAAAAY!!!  Oh gosh... there were a few
people who I knew there, but I sooo can'tremember their names right now =\
Anywaze... I went out this 1 time & LoL.. I bumped in2 Simon Apex... LoL...
it was Dope 'cause we haven't seen each other since like last summer, so we
like totally caught up & talked & stuff!!  I swear man... he a Groovy guy!
>
> So anywaze... he went on after Amber.. OK... Simon busted out his 2st
track this cid Breakbeats tune!! BAD ASS man!!  Oh Gosh man... then he went
in2 this like Heavenly Kinda Melodic Breakbeats track next.. Yuuuuuuuuum!!!
LoL.. Then that record did this totally funky breakdown & turned in2 this
like totally crazy Jungle song!!  It was Dope!!  Then I was like Heeeeeella
buggin' 'cause Wow... Simon Apex & Jungle were 2 things I never thought of
2gether!!
>
> It was during that song that we took off back 2 the Bay...
>
> But the party was totally fun!!  There wasn't like nearly as much people
as there was when Amber & I were last there @ that venue... but the vibe was
really Awesome!!  Every1 was CooL!  Decorations were kinda minimal, but
nice!  2 huge screens of Groovy visuals!  These circles that had projections
from both sides playing! 1 was a color thingie changer & the other was these
pictures & stuff!!  Behind the DJ booth was this HUGE YING YANG symbol!
>
> YAAAAAAY.. fun night!!!
>
>

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR?Weds.:AudioFlashMob (SF)

Hello all. I would like to extent an invitation to all musicians, video 
artists and noise makers. I am organizing a "flash mob" that will take place 
Weds. night between 9:30pm and 2:00am at Julip in San Francisco.

I am asking that whatever you bring out, that it's self contained (i.e. no 
patching into the house PA, bring your own amps, cables, etc.) Also, tell 
your friends. We will have people coming and going ALL EVENING, so there's 
no time requirement, other than after 9:30pm and before 2:00am.

Again,the location is:

Julip Cocktail Lounge (sorry 21+ please)
On Geary, Between Hyde and Larkin (more info at http://www.julipsf.com)
San Francisco

Thanks all.....

Stephen/Zygote > under the radar//
http://utr.praemedia.com

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U  
--=====================_15708929==.ALT--

References: <5.2.1.1.2.20030819214526.02bdb040@mail.speakeasy.net> <5.2.1.1.2.20030819234132.02bdfd90@mail.speakeasy.net>
Date: Wed, 20 Aug 2003 10:28:58 -0700
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2800.1158
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1165
Message-ID: <BAY9-DAV26se1fTvOSQ0001a0e8@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 20 Aug 2003 17:28:59.0278 (UTC) FILETIME=[8A532AE0:01C36740]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:Fwd: Content violation

If you're using Outlook or Outlook Express disable the preview pane. If you
click on a message with an attachment that's harmful and have the preview
pane open it will execute and you will have problems. What I do first and
foremost now is use my powerbook for mail handling. When I'm on my pc and
need to check things to see what kind of attachment it is I right click on
the message, choose properties, then message source. You will see a bunch of
odd looking text, but something that looks like *mime-type* in there. Should
be followed by a file name and if that file doesn't look like something a
friend would send you... delete the message. Basically this is a safe way to
see if the content of the message that has an attachment is friend or foe.

:: r y a n ::

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.net

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

U

Subject: [sfraves]The needle/AIDs myth about Raves

About 4-5 years ago when I first started partying, I remember my Mom telling 
me, "Don't go to raves! Kids walk around there with needles infected with 
AIDs there!"  I have since exposed my mother to what partying is truly 
about.  However, one time, when I was at this warehouse party on the border 
of Oakland and Emeryville, I was totally tripping balls on E and Acid and I 
could have sworn that this kid wearing dark clothes stuck me with a needle!  
I had a black mark on my arm afterwards..however, this WAS a dirty/dusty 
party, so I could have just gotten that mark some other way.

Long story short, it didn't have aids on it or whatever.  I just recently 
got tested for everything and I am VERY RELEIVED to be negative on every 
test that was run.  Anyway, I was just wondering if you guys had any 
experiences like this?

fable....

Subject: Re: [sfraves]The needle/AIDs myth about Raves

Yep,

The scare went around at homebase a few years ago at a feelgood event...
Girl screamed right next to me and literally freaked out, then passed out..
Swore she was jabbed with something...  but all she had was a small red mark
on her back..  I kept in touch and nothing came of it.

But in all honesty, if you do your research, youll find that (last time I
checked) there is only 1 instance of needle jabbing/disease transfer of that
nature recorded.. which happened when an inmate stuck a gaurd with a
makeshift syringe full of his own infected blood.

Also, if I remember correctly..  either the virus or the blood can only
survive less than around 3 minutes or so (or was that 30 seconds?)  ...
either way, it made it somewhat difficult to do that in any setting... not
to mention getting needles past any security out there (if there is any)

-B

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves]The needle/AIDs myth about Raves

Coincidentally, I was just reading about this on snopes.com (devoted to urban legends). The whole thing was never more than a rumor. 
I remember when the rumor was going around. Word was spreading on Ravelinks, I believe, that somebody was "going to" poke people with needles at a massive. As a result, copycats figured that if you poked people with a ballpoint pen, the corner of a glossy flyer, or some other semi-sharp object, they would freak out. There was a lot of media attention in those days, and it's not surprising that some people were trying to take advantage of the hysteria by causing more.

It's a good idea to do this in general, not just because this liates 
worm/virus is out. There are a ton of them out there, also a good virus 
checker helps I use AVG's Free Virus checker, and yes it cought the one 
that is going around in one of my emails the other day. Plus not opening 
attachments from people you dont know, or just deleteing strange looking 
emails in general helps you can always have friends send you things again 
if they actually sent you something and you deleted it.

http://www.grisoft.com/us/us_dwnl_free.php   - where to download it

At 10:28 AM 8/20/2003 -0700, innocentchild wrote:

>If you're using Outlook or Outlook Express disable the preview pane. If you
>click on a message with an attachment that's harmful and have the preview
>pane open it will execute and you will have problems. What I do first and
>foremost now is use my powerbook for mail handling. When I'm on my pc and
>need to check things to see what kind of attachment it is I right click on
>the message, choose properties, then message source. You will see a bunch of
>odd looking text, but something that looks like *mime-type* in there. Should
>be followed by a file name and if that file doesn't look like something a
>friend would send you... delete the message. Basically this is a safe way to
>see if the content of the message that has an attachment is friend or foe.
>
>:: r y a n ::

X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook, Build 10.0.4024
In-Reply-To: <608F4EA8.6DCD4AA9.0004D974@aol.com>
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1165
Importance: Normal
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 20 Aug 2003 19:29:34.0212 (UTC) FILETIME=[62AE7C40:01C36751]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves]The needle/AIDs myth about Raves

How did I miss this rumor.. Or do I just not remember it... Hard to tell
which.

To clear up the aids part via a simple jab multiple times with a "dirty
needle" wouldn't really be feasable.  If someone had just say, jabbed it
into themselves and they have aids, there would be fresh residual blood
on the needle.  With this very thin sheet of blood on the blade it would
dry quickly.  Aids can only survive out in the air for 1 - 3 minutes.
If they inject you with infected blood there is a chance that this is
possible because not too much air mixes into the needle to kill the
contents inside.  Say you see a pool of blood from an infected aids
patient, it has the ability to survive a little longer because the outer
part of the blood starts to clot and keeps air from getting inside.  Now
actually getting infected from it would take it mixing with your blood
via an open wound.  There are a lot of scarier things out there that are
a lot easier and more possible than infecting someone with aids aside
from unprotected sex or needle sharing for IV drugs and the rare chances
from a tattoo parlor.  When I worked for a medical lab we were much more
scared of the Hepatitis strains because they can survive out in the air
for longer and could be absorbed through mucous(sp?) membranes.
Although exploding poo was also a scary thing too.. But that's for
another story. In all reality, the scariest thing for me working there
was the giant wolf spiders that would try and attack me at my desk while
I was working.  Although 30 minutes later in a centerfuge and they posed
no problems.

-Rayn

urban legends). The whole thing was never more than a rumor. 
I remember when the rumor was going around. Word was spreading on
Ravelinks, I believe, that somebody was "going to" poke people with
needles at a massive. As a result, copycats figured that if you poked
people with a ballpoint pen, the corner of a glossy flyer, or some other
semi-sharp object, they would freak out. There was a lot of media
attention in those days, and it's not surprising that some people were
trying to take advantage of the hysteria by causing more.

Subject: RE: [sfraves]The needle/AIDs myth about Raves

--0-2032017587-1061408306=:24518
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

exploding poo?  this sounds kinda interesting...

Rayn <acydrayn@hotmail.com> wrote:How did I miss this rumor.. Or do I just not remember it... Hard to tell
which.

To clear up the aids part via a simple jab multiple times with a "dirty
needle" wouldn't really be feasable. If someone had just say, jabbed it
into themselves and they have aids, there would be fresh residual blood
on the needle. With this very thin sheet of blood on the blade it would
dry quickly. Aids can only survive out in the air for 1 - 3 minutes.
If they inject you with infected blood there is a chance that this is
possible because not too much air mixes into the needle to kill the
contents inside. Say you see a pool of blood from an infected aids
patient, it has the ability to survive a little longer because the outer
part of the blood starts to clot and keeps air from getting inside. Now
actually getting infected from it would take it mixing with your blood
via an open wound. There are a lot of scarier things out there that are
a lot easier and more possible than infecting someone with aids aside
from unprotected sex or needle sharing for IV drugs and the rare chances
from a tattoo parlor. When I worked for a medical lab we were much more
scared of the Hepatitis strains because they can survive out in the air
for longer and could be absorbed through mucous(sp?) membranes.
Although exploding poo was also a scary thing too.. But that's for
another story. In all reality, the scariest thing for me working there
was the giant wolf spiders that would try and attack me at my desk while
I was working. Although 30 minutes later in a centerfuge and they posed
no problems.

-Rayn

-----Original Message-----
From: JonnyR@aol.com [mailto:JonnyR@aol.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, August 20, 2003 11:34 AM
To: fable4our@hotmail.com; sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: Re: [sfraves]The needle/AIDs myth about Raves


Coincidentally, I was just reading about this on snopes.com (devoted to
urban legends). The whole thing was never more than a rumor. 
I remember when the rumor was going around. Word was spreading on
Ravelinks, I believe, that somebody was "going to" poke people with
needles at a massive. As a result, copycats figured that if you poked
people with a ballpoint pen, the corner of a glossy flyer, or some other
semi-sharp object, they would freak out. There was a lot of media
attention in those days, and it's not surprising that some people were
trying to take advantage of the hysteria by causing more.

From: "Becky Sibio" <zerostar@iols.com>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Wednesday, August 20, 2003 11:39 AM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR:Fwd: Content violation


> It's a good idea to do this in general, not just because this liates
> worm/virus is out. There are a ton of them out there, also a good virus
> checker helps I use AVG's Free Virus checker, and yes it cought the one
> that is going around in one of my emails the other day. Plus not opening
> attachments from people you dont know, or just deleteing strange looking
> emails in general helps you can always have friends send you things again
> if they actually sent you something and you deleted it.
>
> http://www.grisoft.com/us/us_dwnl_free.php   - where to download it
>
> At 10:28 AM 8/20/2003 -0700, innocentchild wrote:
>
> >If you're using Outlook or Outlook Express disable the preview pane. If
you
> >click on a message with an attachment that's harmful and have the preview
> >pane open it will execute and you will have problems. What I do first and
> >foremost now is use my powerbook for mail handling. When I'm on my pc and
> >need to check things to see what kind of attachment it is I right click
on
> >the message, choose properties, then message source. You will see a bunch
of
> >odd looking text, but something that looks like *mime-type* in there.
Should
> >be followed by a file name and if that file doesn't look like something a
> >friend would send you... delete the message. Basically this is a safe way
to
> >see if the content of the message that has an attachment is friend or
foe.
> >
> >:: r y a n ::
> >

In-Reply-To: <005001c36751$622cf030$191ae4d1@na.cp.net>
Message-ID: <Pine.GSO.4.44.0308201412400.14150-100000@gere.odin.pdx.edu>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves]The needle/AIDs myth about Raves


So we think.

It seems we can't really decide if HIV is incredibly virulent or
incredibly hard to catch. A lot of the time, I really wonder where science
leaves off and wishful thinking begins. How much of 'you can't catch aids
from...' is just an attempt to quell panic?  I mean, if we found out
tomorrow that AIDS could be passed from person to person like a cold? We'd
have -mass- panic. That won't happen, mind -- if it could pass through the
air like that, we'd all be dead.

Interesting factoid, though. The california dental association (I think
that's what it's called?) recommends that dentists see  known HIV-infected
patients at the very end of the day, so they can sanitize and leave the
room overnight. It's not a requirement, but it's their recommendation.

Perhaps they're being too careful.
If there is such a thing.

TRH

On Wed, 20 Aug 2003, Rayn wrote:

> How did I miss this rumor.. Or do I just not remember it... Hard to tell
> which.
>
> To clear up the aids part via a simple jab multiple times with a "dirty
> needle" wouldn't really be feasable.  If someone had just say, jabbed it
> into themselves and they have aids, there would be fresh residual blood
> on the needle.  With this very thin sheet of blood on the blade it would
> dry quickly.  Aids can only survive out in the air for 1 - 3 minutes.
> If they inject you with infected blood there is a chance that this is
> possible because not too much air mixes into the needle to kill the
> contents inside.  Say you see a pool of blood from an infected aids
> patient, it has the ability to survive a little longer because the outer
> part of the blood starts to clot and keeps air from getting inside.  Now
> actually getting infected from it would take it mixing with your blood
> via an open wound.  There are a lot of scarier things out there that are
> a lot easier and more possible than infecting someone with aids aside
> from unprotected sex or needle sharing for IV drugs and the rare chances
> from a tattoo parlor.  When I worked for a medical lab we were much more
> scared of the Hepatitis strains because they can survive out in the air
> for longer and could be absorbed through mucous(sp?) membranes.
> Although exploding poo was also a scary thing too.. But that's for
> another story. In all reality, the scariest thing for me working there
> was the giant wolf spiders that would try and attack me at my desk while
> I was working.  Although 30 minutes later in a centerfuge and they posed
> no problems.
>
> -Rayn
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: JonnyR@aol.com [mailto:JonnyR@aol.com]
> Sent: Wednesday, August 20, 2003 11:34 AM
> To: fable4our@hotmail.com; sfraves@hyperreal.org
> Subject: Re: [sfraves]The needle/AIDs myth about Raves
>
>
> Coincidentally, I was just reading about this on snopes.com (devoted to
> urban legends). The whole thing was never more than a rumor.
> I remember when the rumor was going around. Word was spreading on
> Ravelinks, I believe, that somebody was "going to" poke people with
> needles at a massive. As a result, copycats figured that if you poked
> people with a ballpoint pen, the corner of a glossy flyer, or some other
> semi-sharp object, they would freak out. There was a lot of media
> attention in those days, and it's not surprising that some people were
> trying to take advantage of the hysteria by causing more.
>
>

Subject: [sfraves] theories of personality nrr

--0-446906628-1061414396=:94172
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

here's my theory: if someone sees that someone set you on fire, and then tells you not to provoke the person who lit the flame when you scream for help in pain, do you think you should answer that 
person in kind when you have a paper cut sometime down the road, and they ask what the band-aid is for? here's a further piece of anthropology for you: do you think you should marry the 
person who supports the original flame thrower, invites new ones into the bedroom, wants gratuitous trust and forgiveness for each deliberate injury, and can't stop handing over thousands of dollars to 
other flame throwers just because "she" would rather you spend "thousands of dollars" at the grocery store than a simple ten in peace? perhaps this sounds outrageous, but are you actually living it? :)

"Security is mostly a superstition.  It does not exist in nature, nor do 
the children of humans as a whole experience it.  Avoiding danger is no 
safer in the long run than outright exposure.  Life is either a daring 
adventure or nothing."
-Helen Keller

"Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded.  It's 
a relationship between equals.  Only when we know our own darkness well can 
we be present with the darkness of others.  Compassion becomes real when we 
recognize our shared humanity."
-Pema Chodron

"It's taken me all my life to learn what not to play."
-Dizzy Gillespie

I don't get too many chances to hit up the south bay, but tonight I'll
be there.  Come have a beer with me...
 
------------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------
 
Illumination Records presents...

MIRAGE

A midweek phantasm on the 1st and 3rd Wednesday of each month

djs:
KEM (Elastiq - San Francisco)
T.O.B. (Thump Radio - San Francisco)
MICHAEL LIU
DRAGN'FLY 
Special decor:
PSYBERDRUM and EYEZMIND

Drink specials from 9pm to 11pm -> $1 Well drinks and $1 Domestic draft
beers

Music starts at 9pm
21+ ID required
$5 Door ($1 with flyer or this post printed out)
Ladies get in free

Resident DJs:
MICHAEL LIU
NEUROPSYNTIST
DJ DENISE
DRAGN'FLY
MAJERE

Mirage is located at Club 4, 514 S Bascom Ave, San Jose

(40 8) <http://www.ezboard.com/images/emoticons/glasses.gif> 278-5211


 
  <http://www.djdragnfly.com>

Well, the deal is this. I meet this really sweet nice girl about 4-5 months 
ago her name is Jamie. She lives with a mean roommate that gets made when she 
comes home from clubbing or a night out on the towns. *cops where involded* 

So anyway I am trying to find something to do for her last 2 night in 
California she leaves tomorrow at 10pm :-( "SAD". So the real question is what could 
I show her in SF/sac to do rave/event wise. 

She has never been to a rave or an underground event ever in her life. She 
would love to see something before she leaves. 

-=(PS)=-
        Please help me show her one last fun time in CA, please.

--part1_17a.1f1d5179.2c7551fc_boundary--

i foud this in someones profile over the net 


A poem for us.... 

I shave my legs, 
I sit down to pee. 
And I can justify 
any shopping spree. 

Don't go to a barber, 
but a beauty salon. 
I can get a massage 
without a hard-on. 

I can balance the checkbook, 
I can pump my own gas. 
Can talk to my friends, 
about the size of my ass. 

My beauty's a masterpiece, 
and yes, it takes long. 
At least I can admit, 
to others when I'm wrong. 

I don't drive in circles, 
at any cost. 
And I don't have a problem, 
admitting I'm lost. 

I never forget, 
an important date. 
You just gotta deal with it, 
I'm usually late. 

I don't watch movies, 
with lots of gore. 
Don't need instant replay, 
to remember the score. 

I won't lose my hair, 
I don't get jock itch. 
And just cause I'm assertive, 
Don't call me a bitch. 

Don't say to your friends, 
Oh yeah, I can get her. 
In your dreams, my dear, 
I can do better! 

Flowers are okay, 
But jewelry's best. 
Look at me you idiot... 
Not at my chest???? 

I don't have a problem, 
With Expressing my feelings. 
I know when you're lying, 
You look at the ceiling. 

DON'T call me a GIRL , 
a BABE or a CHICK . 

I am a WOMAN. 

Get it?, you DICK!?! 



    


--part1_3a.3d4b1ac8.2c75fa4d_boundary--
